loans.name: Msasani Group

texts.en: Mamvua, who is in her mid-30s, is single and has one child who goes to school. She has been running a business selling simple breakfasts and standard lunches for three years. She works from 7 am to 10 am daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. This will be Mamvua's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to buy more sodas, juice, wheat flour, baking flour, cooking oil and beans. Her dream is, one day, to be able to own a hotel. Mamvua will share this loan with the other members of Msasani Group, which consists of eleven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sodas, juice, wheat flour, baking flour, cooking oil and beans for her business.

loans.name: Mady

texts.en:
Mady’s source of income is from his farm. He owns a plot of land where he grows maize, wheat and onions. His wife and his elder son help him with managing business. He has six children. They sell their harvest at the local markets, from which they derive a small monthly income.

For some years, he has tried to organize a retail business, but he doesn't have the money and experience to organize a business to better their poor living conditions. He consulted with his wife and decided to develop his business with farming as he has great experience and skills. As he lives far from town in a village, he has a good opportunity to develop his farming business. 

With his loan he will start new sowing; that is, he plans to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He hopes that this loan will help him to get a good harvest and to develop his business.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for his farming business.

loans.name: Gany

texts.en:
Gany makes a living by transporting passengers in a minibus and offering express trips. He has been in this business for five years, and he works from Monday to Saturday. He is 60 years old and married. His wife is some years younger than him, and they have four children. His wife has been busy with animal husbandry. 

He needs this loan to make a wedding party as his children are adults, and one of his children wants to be married in the near months. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni. This loan will help him to make his child happy. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To make a wedding party for his child.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling “Kooko” (fermented maize porridge) in Egyirfa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. Aba is married and has five children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband to cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. Aba wants to use her loan to increase her inventory levels, thus allowing her to sell more Kooko. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest the profits in her business, thus helping her to expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her inventory levels, thus allowing her to sell more Kooko (fermented maize porridge).

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Although he has received no formal education, Isaac is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling charcoal in Egyirfa (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for 20 years. Isaac is married and has one child. His wife works as a trader. The proceeds from his business normally go toward helping his wife to cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. Isaac wants to use his loan to increase his inventory levels, thus allowing him to sell more charcoal. In the long term, Isaac plans to reinvest the profits in his business, which will help him to expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase his inventory levels, which will enable him to sell more charcoal.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is married with five children. She has been educated through primary school and her husband is a farmer. For the past 20 years, Afia has sold baby cream and cosmetics in Twifo Praso, near Cape Coast. She is responsible for supporting her husband to pay their family's utility bills and school fees.

Afia is requesting a loan to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her loan to expand her baby cream and cosmetics business and increase her capital base. In the long run, Afia wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her stock and buy different types of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en:
Abdurahim is 33 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and three children. He has had his own business for five years, and it is his source of income. He sells sugar, rice, beans, eggs, soft drinks, etc. 

He has had not many customers, and that’s why he decided to widen the assortment of his goods. He is asking for a loan of 7,000 somoni. With it, he is going to buy dairy products, meats and cold cuts, as he wishes to satisfy the demand from his customers, and always keep his store well-stocked. 

His goal is to always keep his business brisk, as it is the source of income for his family.

loans.use: To buy food items for widening the assortment of goods.

loans.name: Gede Suta

texts.en:
Gede was born and raised in Nusa Penida, a small island off the south-east coast of Bali. The island is considered an underdeveloped area. Electricity and clean water are only accessible on certain parts of the island. Gede owns a small shop selling food, drinks and toiletries. He also sells phone credit for extra income. 

After learning about technologies designed for people living in remote communities, Gede was very keen to sell these technologies in his community. He saw a market for solar lights that can help people living in areas with limited access to electricity, and for water filters for people who usually drink straight from rain water because clean water is very hard to get, and for clean, fuel-efficient cookstoves for households who still use three-stone stoves which produce a lot of harmful smoke.

He will use the loan to purchase these technologies and set up a technology kiosk, the first on Nusa Penida selling life-changing, eco-friendly technologies.

loans.use: to buy more green technology products

loans.name: Shohimardon

texts.en:
Shohimardon has been teaching since 2011. He is a high-degree person. Shohimardon graduated from Pedagogical University of Tajikistan and for three years, he has worked at the village school as a teacher of chemistry and biology. He is one of the best and most clever teachers.
 
He has one child. He is a very careful father.
 
Since last year, Shohimardon has been rebuilding his house, and there is still some work to be done to finish it completely. Now, his house is in bad condition. The loan of 5,000 Somoni he is taking will be dedicated to covering some missing building materials for rebuilding his family house.

loans.use: To buy building materials for rebuilding his family house.

loans.name: Sady

texts.en:
Sady is a kind and hardworking man. He and his wife have four children. He is very industrious and kind-natured. He has a lot of friends, and all of them love him very much.

Sady has been farming for 25 years, producing potatoes. He has a great experience in this field. His products are sold at the local market in the village. 

In order to provide his potatoes with the needed attention, Sady is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni so that he can buy fertilizer and continue improving his potato production. He hopes to generate more income so that he can maintain a better standard of living and help his children continue their education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for land where he grows potatoes.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is married with three children. Her husband works selling medication and she completed primary school. For the past 14 years, Abena has worked selling baby clothing in Twifo Praso, near Cape Coast. She uses her income to help her husband pay household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. Abena sees an opportunity to expand her business but does not have the necessary working capital.

Abena is requesting a loan to buy more baby wear to help boost her overall sales. She wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. Abena plans to channel the profits from her loan back into her baby wear enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more baby wear

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Even though Ekua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Ekua is an entrepreneur who sells cassava and plantains in Twifo Praso, near Cape Coast. Her business has grown substantially since she began four years ago. Ekua uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their three children. She has identified growing customer demand but is unable to meet it due to her limited inventory capacity. 

Ekua is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava and plantains to sell. With the profits from her expanded business, Ekua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance themselves from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and plantains to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is divorced and has a number of children. After successfully graduating primary school, Aba is now an established businesswoman who has been selling yams in Twifo Praso, near Cape Coast, for the past ten years. Aba is the sole breadwinner in the family.

Aba is requesting a loan to purchase increased amounts of yams to improve her overall sales. With the profits from her loan, she plans to diversify the type of products that she sells to adapt to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase yams

loans.name: Mujeres Guapas Group

texts.es:
Las 15 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas invierten sus créditos para el sustento de sus familias y mejoramiento de sus negocios. Todas las señoras de este comité se muestran muy agradecidas por el apoyo recibido, porque les permite ir mejorando su calidad de vida.
Clementina es una de las integrantes, ella es una persona muy sacrificada, se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, ya sea para mate o terere, que son bebidas tradicionales del Paraguay. Cuenta que por mas de que sea un trabajo sacrificado, lo hace por dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de remedios naturales para la venta, ya que con ello podrá seguir trabajando y generando los ingresos que su familia necesita.
texts.en:
The 15 members of this committee have various activities. Each one of them invest their loans in order to support their families and improve their businesses. All of the ladies of this committee are very grateful for the support because it permits them to improve their quality of life.

Clementina is one of the members. She is a self-sacrificing person. She works selling natural remedies, such as mate or terere, which are traditional drinks of Paraguay. She says that the harder one works, the more possible it becomes to give your family everything they need.

She is requesting this loan to buy natural remedies in order to sell them, so she can keep working and earning income that her family needs.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is divorced without any children. Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, she is an entrepreneur who sells bread in Twifo Praso, near Cape Coast. Adwoa has been involved in this enterprise for five years and the proceeds from her business normally go toward supporting herself and her extended family. 

Adwoa is requesting a loan to increase her current inventory levels to improve her bread sales. In the long term, she plans to reinvest her future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to buy bread

loans.name: Lafia Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe LAFIA II sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Tinimbougou, un des villages de la commune de Kaladougou,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, du mil, du gombo et du sésame. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MAH la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 2.5Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Kaladougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75000 F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of LAFIA II Group are women averaging 43 years of age and five children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Tinimbougou, one of the villages in Kaladougou, Dioîla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region, second administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to better organize their activities at the start of the rainy season. Their crops include, among others, peanuts, millet, okra, and sesame.

They are seeking their sixth loan from Soro Yiriwaso. With this new loan, Mah (the woman in the center of the sitting row) intends to buy farm inputs and small equipments, and pay for plowing to maintain approximately 2.5 hectare of peanuts.

After the harvests, the production is sold in Kaladougou, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She intends to turn an average profit of XOF 75'000 (ca US$ 150) per farming cycle.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and small equipments, and pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Lafia Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe LAFIA III sont  par des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINIMBOUGOU. région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres (Culture de l’arachide, du mil, du gombo et du sésame). Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, TENIMBA,  la personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Kaladougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000 FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of LAFIA III Group are married women averaging 41 years of age and four children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Tinimbougou, Koulikoro Region, second administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to better organize their activities at the start of the rainy season. Their crops include, among others, peanuts, millet, okra, and sesame.

They are seeking their sixth loan from Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan, Tenimba (the woman in the center of the standing row) intends to buy farm inputs and small equipments, and pay for plowing to maintain about one hectare of millet and peanuts.

After the harvests, the production is sold in Kaladougou, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She intends to turn an average profit of XOF 100'000 (ca US$ 200) per farming cycle.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and small equipments, and pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du BENKADI I sont par des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Djambougou un des villages de la commune de Marka Coungo,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du mil, du gombo et du sésame. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DJENEBA la personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,5 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Marka Coungo, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of BENKADI I Group are married women averaging 38 years of age and four children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Djambougou, one of the villages in Marka Coungo, Dioïla Prefecture, in Koulikoro Region, second administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to better organize their activities at the start of the rainy season. Their crops include, among others, peanuts, millet, okra, and sesame.

They are seeking their sixth loan from Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan, Djeneba (the woman in the center of the standing row) intends to buy farm inputs and small equipments, and pay for plowing to maintain about 1.5 hectare of millet and peanuts.

After the harvests, the production is sold in Marka Coungo, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She intends to turn an average profit of XOF 75'000 (ca US$ 150) per farming cycle.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicide

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Rory está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde las 13 integrantes se encuentran trabajando y procurando de mejorar su estado de pobreza. Francisca está consciente de que con su trabajo y esfuerzo podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. Ella se dedica a las ventas, y cuenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida con variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Gracias a que siempre se ha esforzado es que tiene este negocio.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos en general, lo que le ayudará a surtir su negocio con leche, harina, huevos, frutas, verduras y demás, ya que son los que más vende y quiere seguir cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called Kuña Rory is doing the Poverty Stoplight survey for the elimination of poverty. These 13 women are working and trying to improve their state of poverty. 

Francisca is aware that through hard work and effort she can give her family a better state of wellbeing. She works in sales, and says that she has a well stocked facility with a variety of staples and because she has always worked she has this business.

She is asking for this loan to buy products in general, which will help her supply her business with milk, flour, eggs, fruit, vegetables and more, as these are what she sells the most of and she wants to continue to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy milk, flour, eggs, fruit, vegetables, and more to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fatia, un des villages de SIKASSO,  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Sixième  prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  la tomate et le maïs avec     Korotoumou   debout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide, semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO et environna après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes et subvenir au frais de santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The ten members of BENKADI 1 Group are married women averaging 37 years of age and three children. They all live in traditional families in Fatia, one of the villages in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to better organize their activities at the start of the rainy season. They are seeking their sixth loan, and the previous ones were repaid without problems.

Korotoumou grows tomatoes and corn. She's the woman in the center of the standing row in the photograph. She intends to buy farm inputs, fertilizers, seeds, and pay for plowing to maintain about 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and at the market in Sikasso, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She intends to turn an average profit of XOF 45'000 (ca US$ 90) per farming cycle.

The profit will enable her to repay the loan and also help her large family cover its daily expenses and pay her children's healthcare expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and pay for plowing

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Amistad está en su primer ciclo, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer a situación de cada una, donde 2 de las quince señoras están en el nivel uno,  por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Mercedes, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza medio. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las capacitaciones que recibe, está segura que irá mejorando. Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma hace desde muy tempranas horas del día. Cuenta que tiene buena clientela que desde tempranas horas del día la esperan para comer sus ricos alimentos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, jamón, queso, huevo y demás insumos para poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las comidas ricas que hace.
texts.en:
"La Amistad" group is in its first season. They are completing a survey on the elimination of poverty in order to find out about each member's situation. Two of the fifteen women are in level one, below the poverty line. That is to say, their incomes are very low. Mercedes, according to the survey, is at a mid level of poverty. With effort, continuous work, and the training that she receives, she is sure that her situation will continue to improve. 

Mercedes earns a living selling foods that she herself prepares very early in the day. She notes that she has good customers who wait in the early morning hours to eat her delicious foods. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of meat, vegetables, condiments, ham, cheese, eggs and other supplies to be able to continue delighting her customers with the delicious meals that she makes.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, ham, cheese, eggs and other supplies.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres muy trabajadoras forman parte de este grupo, ellas están en su quinto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, cada una tiene como meta poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Silveria, ella  se dedica en el verano a la venta de comidas y frutas y en el invierno a la venta de carteras y lencerías, como se puede ver ella es una persona que nunca está quieta y que siempre busca la forma de ir mejorando y se adecua a los cambios y estaciones del clima.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de lencería y carteras para poder seguir con sus ventas y procurar de esa forma los ingresos que necesita para su familia.
texts.en: This group comprises 15 hardworking women, who are in their fifth loan cycle with the women's loan program. They each have a goal of helping their families through their work. Silveria, one of the members, sells food and fruits during the summer and purses and lingerie during the winter. She is never still and is always looking for ways to improve; she adjusts to temperature and season changes. She has applied for a loan to purchase lingerie and purses so that she can keep selling and earning the income her family requires.

loans.use: to buy lingerie and purses to sell.

loans.name: Set

texts.en: Set is 28 years old and lives in his own house with his spouse and two children. He makes a living in agriculture, sowing rice on one hectare of farmland. He has been doing this business for more than 10 years. He also hires out his water pump to earn extra money. Through his hardships, he is able to cover some household costs and help one of his young children to school. At the moment, Set’s water pump is not working, and he really wants to fix it. Due to inadequate funds, he is applying for a loan from HKL in order to fix his water pump. With the loan help, his water pump will be restored and he will once again be able to use it to supply water to his rice and other paddy fields for profit. He hopes to have better harvests and thus a higher income.

loans.use: to fix his water pump.

loans.name: Zaynabby

texts.en:
Zaynabby is married and has four children who are 15, 13, 9, and 6 years old. She always wanted to provide them with a good education. Since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Zaynabby decided to start a new business, sewing national dresses, in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. 

She studied at the course of ‘To Get Ahead’ at a women's organization and got enough skills about business. She will support her household with this business alone. She will be a very successful businesswoman since she is hard-working and smart. 

Zaynabby is asking for a loan of USD 1,500 to buy a sewing machine and fabrics for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to organize a new business.

loans.name: Jafarchon

texts.en: Jafarchon is one of the smartest members of his family and he lives happily, although he is poor. He is 45 years old and has a lovely wife who helps him with his business. The couple are bringing up two children and try to provide them with high quality living conditions. With this aim, 18 years ago Jafarchon began his own business by selling dried and pitted apricots, called ‘kuraga’. He buys apricot trees every year, collects the fruit, dries them and sells the ‘kuraga’ to local people. He now wants to buy more apricots as now is the season for his business. He is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni and awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy apricots for drying and selling

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
18 mujeres de la ciudad de San Lorenzo se han unido con el objetivo de formar un grupo solidario, y ayudarse las unas a las otras. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ellas se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Luz se dedica a la venta de joyería en plata, como ser anillos, cadenas, pulseras y demás. es muy buena vendedora y ya se hizo de buena clientela que siempre compra de ellas las novedades que trae. Esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza que la ayudará a conocer su situación en todas sus dimensiones.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de cadenas, pulseras, anillos y demás joyas, ya que quiere seguir innovando su stock y ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eighteen women from the city of San Lorenzo have come together to form a solidarity group and help each other.  They are improving their economic situation through their efforts, constant work, and the application of the vital behavior traits of successful women.

Luz makes a living selling silver jewelry such as rings, chains, bracelets, and other things.  She's a very good saleswoman and she already has acquired good customers who always buy the new items she has.  She's doing the poverty-elimination survey that will help her understand all aspects of her situation.

She's requesting this loan to invest in buying chains, bracelets, rings, and other jewelry.  She wants to continue updating her stock and offer her customers a variety.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas está en el 10º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una  integrante  se encuentra por debajo de la línea de pobreza, pero están trabajando con su nuevo crédito en el aumento de sus ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa, ella  en su última encuesta se encontraba fuera de la línea de la pobreza, pero de igual manera sigue muy entusiasmada y con muchas ansias de crecer.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de pollos, bebidas, aceites, harina, panificados y demás. Ella, como sus compañeras están agradecidas por esta oportunidad que reciben.
texts.en:
Mujeres Unidas (Women United) is in its 10th loan cycle with the women's loan program, through which all the women are working and getting help to succeed. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey, in which one of the members was found to be living below the poverty line, but they are working to increase their income with the new loan.

María, one of the members, has a well-stocked shop in her house. In the last survey, she was above the poverty line, but nevertheless she remains enthusiastic and eager to grow. She has applied for a loan to buy chickens, beverages, oil, flour, baked goods, and more. She, like her partners, is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy chickens, beverages, oil, flour, baked goods, and more.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang, 32, is from Kompong Speu province and has been working in farming for more than 10 years. This has given her a lot of valuable experience in tending her crops, which mainly consist of rice. Her husband and young children also help her over the planting and harvesting period. With the profits she earns from her farm, she is able to cover some household costs, but it is barely enough to satisfy their needs. Heang would like to reduce some of her operating costs by obtaining funds from Kiva to buy buffalo, so that she does not need to hire them. Thus, she is applying for a loan to buy two animals to help her with the maintenance of her fields. With the loan, she will then be able to save more money and keep providing her family with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy two buffalo to help her maintain her rice fields.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan se dedica a la producción y posterior venta de leche la cual entrega a una de las empresas acopiadoras de leche de La Paz . El vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, en casa de sus padres ubicada en la comunidad de Villandrani, de La provincia Murillo del Departamento de La Paz pueblo que se encuentra a media hora de distancia de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo requiere para compra de forraje (pasta de soya) que comprara de Santa Cruz, este forraje ayudara a la alimentación de los ganados y mejorara su producción, además ayudara al medio ambiente ya que hará descansar por una temporada sus terrenos.

El sueño de Juan, es incrementar su producción lechera de esta manera mejorar su ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan works producing milk that he then sells to one of La Paz’s milk consolidating firms.  He lives with his wife and two children in his parents’ house located in the community of Villandrani in Murillo Province in La Paz Department.  The town is located half an hour from the city of La Paz.

He needs the loan to buy forage (soy bean grass) in Santa Cruz.  This forage will help him feed his cattle and improve production; in addition it will help the environment because he will let his fields rest for a season.

Juan’s dream is to increase milk production to improve his income and his quality of life.  This is his 4th loan request to IMPRO and 3rd to KIVA.

loans.use: to buy forage to feed his dairy cows.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
Magda se dedica a la producción agrícola de verduras y flores. Ella vive con sus hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Palomar, del Sector de Rio Abajo de La provincia Murillo del Departamento de La Paz pueblo que se encuentra a una hora  de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo requiere para compra de semilla mejorada: de esta manera mejorara su producción y ayudara a la preservación del medio ambiente ya que al utilizar estas semillas ya no necesitara mucho riego de agua y así optimizara este recurso tan importante. 

El sueño de Magda, es incrementar su producción agrícola sin dañar el medio ambiente, preservándolo.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda    vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Magda works growing vegetables and flowers.  She lives with her children in her own house located in the community of Palomar, Río Abajo sector of Murillo Province, La Paz Department.  The town is located an hour away from the city of La Paz.

She needs the loan to buy improved seeds in order to improve production and also help to protect the environment since the use of these seeds requires less irrigation so the use of this important resource is optimized.  

Magda’s dream is to increase production without damaging the environment and preserving it.

This is the fourth time she’s requested a loan from IMPRO and second time from KIVA.

loans.use: to buy improved flower and vegetables seeds.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Nuevo Amanecer se formo buscando un nuevo rumbo para la vida de las integrantes del grupo, ellas están trabajando juntas y se están ayudando y cooperan para salir adelante. Están en su cuarto ciclo y tienen como meta llegar al máximo nivel de ciclos.
Obdulia es modista, tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día. Gracias a que hace muy buenos trabajos está saliendo adelante y se hace conocida entre sus clientes. Ella sueña con poder ampliar s taller y tener más maquinas de coser.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, ya que siempre tiene pedidos de sus clientes y quiere poder cumplirlos y que sus clientes estén contentos.
texts.en:
Nuevo Amanecer was formed by members looking for a new road in life.  They're working together, helping each other, and collaborating to get ahead.  They're in their fourth loan cycle and their goal is to achieve the highest level of cycles.

Obdulia's a tailor.  She has a small tailoring workshop where she starts work early every day, thanks to which she makes very good pieces.  She's getting ahead and becoming known among her customers.  She dreams of being able to expand her workshop and have more sewing machines.

She's requesting this loan to be able to invest in buying fabric and thread.  She always has customer orders that she wants to fill so her customers are satisfied.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
En su séptimo ciclo se encuentra este trabajador grupo de la ciudad de Caaguazú, como el nombre del grupo lo dice, ellas son mujeres unidas que se esfuerzan por sus familias, procurando un mejor porvenir para ellos y que no tengan que pasar por ninguna privación. Ellas estan haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para mejorar la situación de cada una de ellas.
Gladys es parte de este gran proyecto, ella se dedica a las ventas, y cuenta que tiene una pequeña, pero surtida despensa, con mucho esfuerzo pudo montar su negocio, y hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela. Ella esta contenta con su grupo que le será de mucha ayuda.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, verduras, frutas, carne y demás insumos para poder surtir su local.
texts.en:
This is the seventh loan cycle for this communal bank from the city of Caaguazú. As the group's name suggests, these women are united in their efforts to help their families, trying to provide a brighter future and ensure that they are not deprived. Each is participating in the poverty elimination survey to improve her circumstances.

Gladys is part of this important project. She is a merchant and has a small, but well-stocked, shop. She worked hard to open her business and now has many customers. She is happy with her group, which will be very helpful to her. She has applied for a loan to buy beverages, vegetables, fruits, meats, and more for inventory.

loans.use: to buy beverages, vegetables, fruits, meats, and more.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche del departamento de La Paz. El vive en casa de sus padres ubicado en la comunidad de  Sulcataca baja  del Sector Laja de la provincia Los Andes del Departamento de La Paz a tres horas  de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz; Edwin cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado de raza mejorada las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector.
.
El crédito requiere para comprar  alimento suplementario  puesto que  en el sector existe un déficit de proteína cruda en los forrajes de cebada y son necesarios en las épocas de estiaje (meses junio a noviembre), por lo tanto en estas épocas críticas se mejora la nutrición del ganado lechero, utilizando suplementos como harina de maíz, cascarilla de soya, afrecho y otros. Con la compra de alimentos suplementarios se mitiga en la presión de ampliar más áreas de producción de forraje

 Así podrá  mejorar su producción, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

El sueño de Edwin, es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.

Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Edwin makes a living raising dairy cows to produce milk, which he sells at one of the milk-processing plants in the department of La Paz.  He lives in his parents' house in the community of Sulcataca Baja in the Laja area of Los Andes Province in La Paz Department, three hours from the city of La Paz.  Edwin has some head of improved cattle, which require better care because of the area's climate conditions.

He needs the loan to buy supplementary feed because in the area there's a deficit of raw protein in the barley fodder and it's necessary in the low-water season (June-November).  During this critical season the nutrition of dairy cows is improved using supplements such as corn flour, soy chaff, bran, and other things.  Buying supplementary feed will mitigate the pressure on expanding more areas of fodder production.

This way he'll be able to improve his product and keep his cows healthy.  Edwin's dream is to increase his head of cattle, keeping in mind their good health.

This is the third time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the second time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy supplementary feed

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia se dedica a la producción agrícola de verduras y flores. Que posteriormente las vende en uno de los mercados  de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella vive con sus hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Palomar, del Sector de Rio Abajo de La provincia Murillo del Departamento de La Paz pueblo que se encuentra a una hora  de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz.
.
El crédito lo requiere para compra de semilla mejorada: de esta manera mejorara su producción tendiendo un producto de calidad y ayudara a la preservación del medio ambiente ya que al utilizar estas semillas ya no necesitara mucho riego de agua y así optimizara este recurso tan importante. 

El sueño de Delia, es incrementar su producción agrícola sin dañar el medio  
ambiente, preservándolo y producir cada ves un producto de buena calidad 
.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda    vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Delia works in agricultural production growing vegetables and flowers that she subsequently sells in one of the markets in the city of La Paz.  She lives with her children in her own house located in the community of Palomar in the Río Abajo Sector of Murillo Province in La Paz Department; a town located an hour away from the city of La Paz.

The loan she needs is to buy improved seeds in order to improve production yielding quality product that will help her preserve the environment since the use of these seeds requires less irrigation so this important resource is optimized this way.

Delia’s dream is to increase agricultural production without causing damage to the environment, preserving it and producing good quality product every time.

This is her second loan request to IMPRO and to KIVA.

loans.use: to buy improved flower and vegetables seeds.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca se dedica a la producción agrícola de verduras, además se dedica a la elaboración de queso. Ella vive con su hijo, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Palomar, del Sector de Rio Abajo de La provincia Murillo del Departamento de La Paz pueblo que se encuentra a una hora  de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo requiere para compra de semilla mejorada: de esta manera mejorara su producción de verduras y ayudara a la preservación del medio ambiente además su producción mejorara y el producto será de mejor calidad.

El sueño de Blanca, es incrementar su producción agrícola sin dañar el medio ambiente, y tener un producto de buena calidad.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda    vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Blanca works in agricultural production growing vegetables and also makes cheese.  She lives with her son in her own house located in the community of Palomar in the Río Abajo Sector of Murillo Province in La Paz Department; a town located an hour away from the city of La Paz.

The loan she needs is to buy improved seeds in order to improve production yielding quality product; in addition it she will help to preserve the environment and her production will improve and the product will be of higher quality.

Blanca’s dream is to increase agricultural production without causing damage to the environment and to produce good quality product.

This is her fourth loan request to IMPRO and second to KIVA.

loans.use: to buy improved vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La Señora Leonarda está casada con el señor Luis,  tienen hijos  todos mayores de edad, y por quienes ambos siempre se esforzaron  para poder sacarlos adelante.
Ella trabaja en su taller de costura, donde confecciona prendas de vestir sobre medida y también uniformes escolares y para oficina. El señor Luis presta sus servicios a la Policía Nacional. Gracias a sus trabajos brindaron educación a sus hijos, y logran cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar. Doña Leonarda ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos. Comenta que gracias a su trabajo pudo brindar una vida digna a su familia. Solicita este crédito para utilizarlo en la compra de telas para la confección de buzos escolares, pues esto le ayuda a incrementar sus ingresos y ayudar de esta manera a su marido en los gastos del hogar. Agradece por la a oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda. Ellos anhelan poder ver en sus hijos el fruto de sus sacrificios, viéndolos realizarse como personas y excelentes profesionales.
texts.en:
Leonarda is married to Luis, and all of their children are now adults.  Leonarda and Luis put forth great effort in order to be able to get their children ahead.  She works in a seamstress shop where she makes tailor-made clothes and also school and office uniforms.  Luis works for the National Police.  Thanks to their work, they provided their children with an education and managed to cover all of the household necessities.  

Leonarda has shown herself to be a very responsible and honest person with her commitments.  She says that thanks to her work, she was able to provide her family with a decent life.

She is requesting this loan to buy fabric to make school sportswear.  This will help her to increase her income, and this way she will help her husband with the household expenses.

She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving.  It will be a great help to her.  They are eager to be able to see the fruit of their sacrifices in their children by seeing them fulfilling themselves as people and excellent professionals.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make sportswear.

loans.name: Mayde

texts.es:
Mayde se dedica a la producción agrícola de verduras, hortalizas y flores, los cuales comercializa al por mayor en uno de los mercados  de la Ciudad de La Paz. Ella vive en casa propia junto con sus hijos, la casa esta ubicada en la comunidad de Palomar, del Sector de Rio Abajo de La provincia Murillo del Departamento de La Paz. .
El crédito lo requiere para compra de semilla mejorada: de esta manera mejorara su producción y ayudara a la preservación del medio ambiente ya que al utilizar estas semillas ya no necesitara demasiado riego de agua y así optimizara este recurso tan importante, además tendrá un producto que será de calidad del cual percibirá mayores ingresos. 

El sueño de Mayde, es incrementar su producción agrícola sin dañar el medio ambiente, preservándolo y mejorando sus ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida..

Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Mayde works growing vegetables and flowers that she then sells at wholesale in one of the markets in the city of La Paz.  She lives in her own house with her children; the house is located in the community of Palomar in Río Abajo Sector of Murillo Province in La Paz Department. 

She needs the loan to buy improved seeds so that production will be improved and the environment will be protected because by using these seeds less irrigation is needed and this very important resource will be optimized; she will also have a product that’s of such quality that it will produce higher income.

Mayde’s dream is to increase farm production without harming the environment, preserving it and improving her income to have better quality of life.

This is her fourth loan request to IMPRO and second to KIVA.

loans.use: to buy improved vegetable and flower seeds.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia se dedica a la producción agrícola de verduras, hortalizas y flores, los cuales comercializa al por mayor en uno de los mercados de la Ciudad de La Paz. Ella vive en casa propia junto con sus hijos, su esposo se encuentra trabajando en el exterior, la casa esta ubicada en la comunidad de Palomar, del Sector de Rió Abajo de La provincia Murillo del Departamento de La Paz. 
El crédito lo requiere para compra de semilla mejorada: de esta manera mejorara su producción y ayudara a la preservación del medio ambiente ya que al utilizar estas semillas ya no necesitara demasiado riego de agua y así optimizara este recurso tan importante, además tendrá un producto que será de calidad del cual percibirá mayores ingresos para invertir en sus terrenos. 

El sueño de Cecilia, es incrementar su producción agrícola sin dañar el medio ambiente, y tener un vivero forestal.

Es la séptima vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Cecilia grows vegetables and flowers, which she sells by wholesale in one of the markets of the town of La Paz. She lives with her children in a house that she owns. Her husband is currently working abroad. Her house is located in the community of Palomar of the sector of Rio Abajo, province of Murillo, deparment of La Paz.

She requests the loan in order to purchase improved seeds. That way she'll improve her production and help preserve the environment, since by using these seeds she'll no longer need too much water for irrigation and she'll optimize the use of such an important resource. In addition, she'll get a high quality produce, which will yield higher profits for investing in her land.

Cecilia's dream is to increase her agricultural production without harming the environment, and to own a tree nursery.

This is the 7th time she requests a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase improved seeds for her vegetable and flower crops.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Máxima se dedica a la producción agrícola de verduras, legumbres, hortalizas y flores, las cuales vende comercializa en uno de los Mercado  de la ciudad de El Alto. Ella vive en casa propia junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos, la casa esta ubicada en la comunidad de Palomar, del Sector de Rió Abajo de La provincia Murillo del Departamento de La Paz. 
El crédito lo requiere para compra de semilla mejorada: de esta manera mejorara su producción y ayudara a la manutención del medio ambiente ya que al utilizar estas semillas el proceso de producción en las tierras será mas corto, además el riego de agua será mínimo. Así tendrá una mejor producción y preservara el medio ambiente. 

El sueño de Máxima, es incrementar su producción agrícola sin dañar el medio ambiente, y tener una producción que mejore sus ingresos para tener un futuro mejor para sus hijos.

Es la sexta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Máxima works growing vegetables and flowers that she then sells in one of the markets in the city of El Alto.  She lives with her husband and two children in her own house located in the community of Palomar, Río Abajo sector of Murillo Province, La Paz Department.

She needs the loan to buy improved seeds in order to improve production and also help to protect the environment since the use of these seeds means a shorter growing time and so irrigation is minimal.  Thus she will improve production while preserving the environment.

Máxima’s dream is to increase production without damaging the environment and to have production that will improve her income to have a better future for her children.

This is the sixth time she’s requested a loan from IMPRO and first time from KIVA.

loans.use: to buy improved vegetable and flower seeds.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat is 33-years-old, married and has five children. She reside in her own home in Kompong Speu province. She has dedicated herself to agriculture, sowing rice, an occupation she learned from her parents. Phat has been involved in this for almost 15 years. She owns just a few pieces of farmland which are not far from her home. However, she cannot earn enough to provide for their needs, mostly just for their daily food.

The loan she needs will make it possible for her to invest in purchasing farming materials and hiring people to help work on their farm. She will buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and seeds. This will help her increase her rice production and earn a higher income. 

Her dream is to strengthen and expand the business, and offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase farming materials and hire people to help work on her farm.

loans.name: Teng

texts.en:
Teng is 62 years old, a widowed woman and the loving mother of three children. Her oldest son is working as a garment worker, and her second son is a driver; they both share some of their earned salary with family members to better their living status. 

Teng, however, doesn't rely on her children; instead, she has been involved in agriculture more than 30 years to generate a decent income. She has a few pieces of land where she grows rice once a year with the help from her last born child. 

Teng is requesting this loan to buy a motorbike to help her employed children commute to work. Also, the bike can be used to transport the family without any costs; this will help the family to save more. 

In the future, she plans to expand her agricultural business and make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to help her employed children commute to work.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom is 56 years old and lives in Mohaleaph village, which is in the Samraong Tong district of Kompong Speu. She is married, the mother of three children and had to end her education at the primary level due to financial constraints. After she quit studying, she learned agricultural from her parents. Today, her husband helps her manage their farm and sell their produce in various local markets. Mom is applying for a loan for $1,000 to buy a motorbike, which will allow her family to travel safely to nearby areas of their province. Her goal for the future is to improve her home and build a comfortable bathroom for her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia se dedica a la producción agrícola de verduras y flores, las cuales vende al por mayor en uno de los mercados  de la Ciudad de La Paz y en otor mercado de la ciudad de El Alto. Ella vive en casa propia junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos, la casa esta ubicada en la comunidad de Palomar, del Sector de Rió Abajo de La provincia Murillo del Departamento de La Paz.

El crédito lo requiere para compra de semilla mejorada: de esta manera mejorara su producción y ayudara a la preservación del medio ambiente ya que al utilizar estas semillas el terreno será menos utilizado, además el riego de agua será mínimo así tendrá una mejor producción y preservara el medio ambiente. 

El sueño de Lidia, es incrementar su producción agrícola sin dañar el medio ambiente, y tener una producción que mejore sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Es la sexta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Lidia works growing vegetables and flowers that she then sells at wholesale in the markets in La Paz and El Alto.  She lives with her husband and three children in her own house located in the community of Palomar, Río Abajo sector of Murillo Province, La Paz Department. 

She needs the loan to buy improved seeds in order to improve production and also help to protect the environment since the use of these seeds means a shorter growing time and so irrigation is minimal.  Thus she will improve production while preserving the environment.

Lidia’s dream is to increase production without damaging the environment and to have production that will improve her income to have a better future for her children.

This is the sixth time she’s requested a loan from IMPRO and first time from KIVA.

loans.use: to buy improved vegetable and flower seeds.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en el ciclo 10 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Kuña guapa quiere decir mujer laboriosa del idioma guaraní, y eso justamente son mujeres muy luchadoras.
Luciana  es una de las integrantes del grupo, se dedica al comercio, ya que vende productos de primera necesidad, y con eso ayuda a su familia. Ella es una persona que trabaja, ya que sabe que es la única forma de poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para la venta, como ser verduras, carnes, frutas y demás para poder seguir con sus ventas y luchando por sus familiares. En la foto aparecen mas personas, ya que no todas las miembros retiran crédito en este ciclo, pero si forman parte del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Kuña Guapa is in its 10th cycle with the women's loan program, in which everyone works and receives help to get ahead. Kuña Guapa means working woman in Guaraní, and the members truly are hard workers.

Luciana, one of the members, is a merchant, who sells basic household goods to support her family. She works because she realizes that this is the only way to grow and make something of life. She has applied for a loan to buy supplies such as vegetables, meats, and fruits so that she can keep selling and striving for her relatives. There are more people in the photo, as some members are not asking for money this cycle but are part of the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, fruits, and more.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Las Colinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras de las Colinas  está  empezando a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya. Está en su ciclo uno, donde están con muchas ansias de trabajar juntas aprender mucho y asistir a las capacitaciones. Ellas hacen la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una.
Juana una de las integrantes, tiene un nivel de pobreza uno, es decir con ingresos muy por debajo, pero es consciente que a través del esfuerzo y trabajo irá mejorando. Se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados, también se debe destacar el gran empeño que ella tiene.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de calzados y prendas, para poder seguir creciendo y vendiendo sus productos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras de las Colinas group is starting to work with the Fundación Paraguaya.  It is in its first cycle, where they are very eager to work together, learn a lot, and attend the trainings.  They are taking part in the survey to eliminate poverty in order to be able to learn about each other’s situations.

Juana is one of the members, and she is at a poverty level of one.  That is to say that her income is very low.  However, she is aware that through effort and work, it will improve.  She sells clothes and shoes.  Also, it should be noted that she is very determined.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy shoes and clothes.  She will do this in order to be able to continue growing and selling her products.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cañadita Group

texts.es:
Cañadita cuenta con 16 integrantes y en su mayoría amas de casa a quienes se les dio la charla del espíritu emprendedor a que tengan el conocimiento de sus cualidades aun no conocidas por ellas misma. Ellas quieren emprender actividades para poder tener mejores ingresos y ayudar a sus familias.
Tatiana quiere emprender en la venta de ropas, es por eso que solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, jeans, polleras, camisas y demás, ya que así podrá tener una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Agradece por esta oportunidad de progreso que ella y sus compañeras están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Cañadita group has 16 members who are mainly housewives.  They have all attended the 'Entrepreneurial Spirit' talk where they learned about qualities they were previously unaware they possessed.  They want to carry out business activities in order to make better income and help their families.

Tatiana would like to start selling clothing.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying t-shirts, jeans, skirts, shirts, etc.  This will give her a good variety of clothing to offer her customers.

Tatiana is grateful for this opportunity to make progress that she and her fellow group members are receiving.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans, skirts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva  se dedica a la producción agrícola de verduras y flores, los cuales vende en uno de los mercados de la Ciudad de La Paz. Ella vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la comunidad de Palomar, del Sector de Rio Abajo de La provincia Murillo del Departamento de La Paz. 
El crédito lo requiere para compra de semilla mejorada: de esta manera mejorara su producción y ayudara a la preservación del medio ambiente ya que al utilizar estas semillas ya no necesitara demasiado riego de agua y así optimizara este recurso tan importante, además tendrá un producto que será de calidad. 

El sueño de Eva, es incrementar su producción agrícola sin dañar el medio ambiente, preservándolo.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Eva works growing vegetables and flowers that she sells in one of La Paz’s markets.  She lives in her parents’ house located in the community of Palomar in the Río Abajo sector of Murillo Province in La Paz Department. 

She needs the loan to buy improved seeds so that production will increase while helping to preserve the environment because using these seeds requires less irrigation so this important resource can be optimized; in addition she’ll produce quality product.

Eva's dream is to increase agricultural production without damaging the environment, preserving it.  

This is her first loan request to IMPRO and to KIVA.

loans.use: to buy improved flower and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Mujeres Organizadas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Organizadas esta integrado por 14 mujeres muy trabajadoras que desean salir adelante y es por eso que se han unido, son de una zona rural, de difícil acceso, y un poco insegura. Ellas estan luchando pese a ello, y estan con muchas ganas de crecer y también poder mejorar su barrio.
Todas las integrantes se dedican a la cría, venta o faena de animales de corral, como ser cerdos, gallinas, vacas y demas, y con esto, sumado a su sacrificio estan teniendo los medios para ayuda a su familia. Maria, la presidenta solicita de este crédito para poder comprar balanceados para poder seguir alimentando a sus animales. Ellas agradecen por esta gran oportunidad que estan recibiendo.
texts.en:
Mujeres Organizadas is made up of 14 very hardworking women who got together because they wanted to get ahead.  They're from a rural area that's difficult to get to and a little dangerous.  Despite this they're striving, and they very much want to grow and improve their neighborhood.

All the members make a living raising, selling, or slaughtering barnyard animals such as pigs, chickens, cows, and others.  Between this and their sacrifice they're acquiring the means to help their families.

María, the president, is requesting this loan to be able to buy feed for her animals.

They're grateful for this great opportunity.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Villa Elena Group

texts.es:
Villa Elena se formo en la ciudad de Lambaré, actualmente inician el 3º ciclo del programa comité de mujeres. Con el que solicitan ellas quieren invertirlo en sus labores, ya que estas son su principal fuente de ingresos con los que ayudan a sus familias.
Ana, miembro de este grupo, cuenta que se dedica a la venta ambulante de prendas, tiene ya muy buena clientela que siempre aprecia la variedad de ropas que tiene. Cuenta que inicio con muy poco, pero que después fue creciendo cada vez más con su esfuerzo hasta llegar lo que es hoy.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, pantalones, jeans, camisas, polleras y demás, y agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben ella y sus amigas.
texts.en:
The Villa Elena communal bank was created in the city of Lambaré.  It is currently beginning its third cycle in the women’s committee program.  They are requesting the loan because they want to invest in their work.  This is the main source of income with which they help their families.

Ana is a member of this group.  She sells clothes in an itinerant manner.  She now has very good clientele who always appreciate the variety of clothes that she has.  She says that she started with very little.  However, she was later growing more and more with her effort, until it came to be what it now is.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy t-shirts, pants, jeans, shirts, skirts, and others.  They are grateful for the opportunity that she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum is 50, and married with three children. For many years, she has been growing rice to make a livelihood. She and her husband have a good partnership, and they provide enough nutritious food for their children as well as other basic needs.

Chum is requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to buy a cow to facilitate her agricultural business. 

She hopes to improve the business by expanding land size, and buying modern farming materials such as a plowing machine, a threshing machine…etc.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is married to a farmer; she has two children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses, as well as save for a rainy day. 

As a middle school graduate, Vida currently sells paddy rice and eggs in Hohoe. With over 15 years of experience in this trade, Vida sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. 

Thus, her loan will be used to buy more paddy rice and eggs, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Vida wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her paddy rice and egg enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more paddy rice and eggs.

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean, 46 years old, lives in the Kampong Siem district of Kompong Cham province. She is a widowed mother of four children, two of whom are still dependent and living with her while the other two, married, are settled down with their new families.  

Kean has been running a farming business for almost 23 years, generating approximately KHR 10,000.  Her son helps her manage the business every rainy season.

She is requesting a loan of KHR 5,000,000 to purchase a piece of land where she can build a proper house to live in, especially since she is getting older so she will live in a comfortable and warm place. 

The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future. She is confident in her ability to pay the loan back as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land where she can build a proper house to live in.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan, 43, lives with her husband and four children in a small village of the Moung Ruessei district, in the Battambang province. Until recently, she has worked in agribusinesses, growing rice and cassava, and helping her husband breed fish to ensure the needs of her children, two of whom are enrolling in school. She and her husband learned the two businesses through a project of Cambodia HARVEST, a project supported by Feed the Future, the US government’s global hunger and food security initiative. Phan’s house was chosen to be a training center by Cambodia HARVEST.  There, lots of the village's people gathered to join and improve the capacity in their businesses. Working with the project for the past few years, Phan is able to make a net income of $8.00 USD per day by growing seasonal crops and breeding fish.
 
Phan is applying for a $2,000 USD loan to buy solar energy systems to supply the energy to her household. With the remaining funds, she will buy materials and hire people to construct two bathrooms for her family members as well as trainees of Cambodia HARVEST, who come to join the training course. She hopes that, through the loan, she can provide a comfortable lifestyle to all of her children.

loans.use: to buy solar energy systems to supply energy to the household.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is married and has two children, both of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. Edith resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying for utility bills, rent for her business premises, and school fees.  

Edith has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for some time selling to all categories of people on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal for resale. She generates additional income from rental rooms and selling bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Edith aspires to own a delivery van to ease her transportation, to become a wholesaler, and also to educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and has five children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member, her father. Grace has a charcoal selling business and has been in this business for 10 years. 

Grace has applied for a loan of 2,200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from a retail shop. She sells on wholesale seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include transportation, defaulters, and thieves. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease her transportation and also to have a fully stocked retail shop. Grace resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is married and has four children, all of whom go to school. She has a pub and has been in this business for 10 years 

Judith has applied for a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of beer, soda, and jerrycans of local gin and brew.  She works in a shop that she rents and works seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality, defaulters, and thieves. Judith aspires to own a fully stocked pub and also to earn enough profits to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer, soda, and local gin.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is widowed with four children, and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 20 years selling to all categories of people by retail basis only. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from a retail shop. She sells on a retail basis and works seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season, which makes roads in the villages impassable. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a delivery van to ease in transportation. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees, paying for utility bills, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a single woman with no children. She looks after additional family members including her sister and her mother.  She has a business frying foods.  

Christine has applied for a loan of 1,700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cooking oil, baking flour, charcoal, baking powder and cow peas.  She works from home and sells on retail basis six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Christine generates additional income from tailoring.  She aspires to owning a full bakery and also buying a plot of land and building rental rooms.  

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying for utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, baking powder, baking flour and cow peas for her business.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is married with five children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling green bananas. 

Miriam has applied for a loan of 2,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas.  She generates additional income by selling samosas and chapattis.  She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Miriam aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and paying school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a single mother of six children; four of her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members including her sister. She has a business selling second-hand bags. She has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 1,600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand bags.  She does not have any other income generating activity.  She sells on wholesale basis seven days out of very week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

Miriam aspires to import second-hand bags from Dubai and earn enough profit so she can build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.   Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand bags.

loans.name: 21 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “21 DE SEPTIEMBRE”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Brígida es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de ganado vacuno, venta de leche.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Brígida es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa y queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre quien le enseño a la elaboración de estos productos, posteriormente decide llevar sus productos a las ferias donde los vende.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el alimento de sus animales (compra de cebada) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas y posteriormente lo dará a sus animales. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el ahorro.
texts.en:
21 de Septiembre Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members and governed by a board of directors of which Brígida is the president.  The bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including clothing sales, cattle sales, and milk sales.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Brígida.  She says it's the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a loan officer from the institution who went to her house.  Currently she has a business selling potatoes and cheese.  She says she learned this business from her mother, who taught her to make these products.  Later she decided to take her products to the markets to sell.

The loan she's currently getting is to buy barley for animal feed, which she'll get from the area markets and later give to her animals.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her household to the extent possible, because she's single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the trainings and saving money.

loans.use: to buy barley

loans.name: Yunguyo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YUNGUYO” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosalía es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas, venta de tullmas, tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosalía es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de  una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de tullmas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía, ya que anteriormente trabajaba con ella, posterior a su matrimonio decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá, por mayor, de las tiendas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente al elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que existe.
texts.en:
The “YUNGUYO” community bank are starting their seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which has Rosalía as its president.  The businesses that the women are engaged in are varied and include: knitting sweaters, selling hair accessories, knitting blankets and running a neighborhood store.

This loan will benefit these small micro-businesswomen of which Rosalía is one.  Rosalía says that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago, through an invite from a loan officer who went to visit her at home.  She currently has a business making 'tullmas' (woven hair accessories).  She learned this business from her aunt with whom she previously worked.  After she got married she decided to set up her own business.

Rosalía will take out this loan to increase her capital.  She will buy yarn wholesale from stores in the city of La Paz and then, after making her hair accessories, she will sell them from her sales location.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her household.  Rosalía is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Rosalía replied that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang is 33 years old, married and the father of three children, two of whom attend school. He lives with his family in Kompong Cham province, where he has earned a living for a long time by growing rice and selling pigs to people in local markets.
