They all live in traditional families in Fachoribougou, a village in Sikasso, the third-largest administrative region in Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can successfully continue with their businesses during the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan with the institution, and have repaid all their prior loans without incident.
 
The women in the group grow tomatoes, peppers and eggplant. Fanta is a member, and is pictured standing in the center of the photo. With her loan she plans to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizers and herbicides, as well as to pay for the labor expenses involved in farming her one hectare of land. After the harvest, she sells her produce in a village market in Sikasso and the surrounding areas, and her customers are both male and female. 

Fanta expects to make a profit of 150,000 francs CFA each season. These profits will allow her to make repayments on her loan, as well as to help her large family with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for labor expenses and hoeing.

loans.name: Kotognongontala  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Kotognongontala 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Fachoribougou, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Dixièmes prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  la tomate, piment  et l’aubergine  avec Sali   debout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO et environs après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 50.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The ten members of the group "Kotognongontala 4" are married women averaging 50 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in Fachoribougou, a village in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crops grown are tomatoes, chili peppers, and eggplant, as is the case with Sali, who is standing in the middle in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, fertilizer, and herbicide and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village, at the Sikasso market, and nearby to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA per planting. The profits will enable her to pay off the loan and also to help her large family to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing and weeding

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of other family members (three orphans). She has a beauty salon and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, Vaseline, braids, and weaves. She generates additional income by renting rooms. Her major business challenges include on-and-off electricity and ever-increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. She sells on a wholesale basis six days per week. She aspires to own a bridal salon and a beauty school. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills, and rent for her business premises.

loans.use: buy more cream relaxers, vaseline, braids, and weaves.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна торгует различными розничными товарами на одном из рынков Павлограда. У нее есть свой павильон, который расположен в продуктовых рядах рынка. Основные группы товаров, которые предлагает Татьяна, можно отнести к категории мелкого попутного товара, а именно, пакеты, хозяйственные сумки, крышки для консервации, закаточные ключи, химикаты, банки.
Татьяне потребовалась сумма в 22 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить пакеты, банки, крышки и другие хозтовары для консервации ягод, фруктов и овощей. Лето – сезон консервации для многих хозяек в Украине. Многие украинцы любят дачи и выращивают свои овощи на небольших земельных участках.  А потом консервируют фрукты и овощи и делают заготовки на зиму. Татьяна знает об этой украинской традиции и хочет подготовиться к насыщенному сезону и повышенному спросу.
texts.en: Tatyana sells various retail goods at one of the markets in Pavlograd.  She has her own retail outlet, located in the food rows of the market.  The main product groups that Tatyana sells can be categorized as small convenience merchandise, specifically plastic bags, heavy-duty bags, lids for canning, canning keys, chemicals and jars.  Tatyana needs a loan in the amount of 22,000 hryvnia to purchase bags, jars, lids and other household goods for canning berries, fruits and vegetables.  Summer is the season for canning for many people in Ukraine.  Many Ukrainians love dachas and grow their vegetables on small land plots, and then can fruits and vegetables to prepare for the winter.  Tatyana knows about this Ukrainian tradition and wants to get ready for the busy season and increased demand.

loans.use: purchase bags, jars, lids and other household goods for canning berries, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина – из Павлограда. Она занимается торговлей постельным бельем и покрывалами на местном рынке. У Ирины есть взрослый сын, он помогает ей на рынке. В зависимости от сезона Ирина меняет группы товаров под спрос на рынке. Занимается этим бизнесом она уже более 7 лет. За счет существования своего дела имеет возможность содержать всю семью. 
Ирина обратилась к КИВА за суммой в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить пляжные покрывала и полотенца для летнего сезона. Со временем Ирина мечтает открыть вторую торговую точку.
texts.en: Irina is from Pavlograd.  She is involved in selling bedding and bed covers at the local market.  Irina has an adult son, who helps her at the market.  Depending on the season, Irina changes her merchandise groups according to the market demand.  She has been involved in this business for over 7 years.  She is able to provide for her family through the existence of this business.  Irina requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia from Kiva to purchase beach blankets and towels for the summer season.  With time, Irina dreams of opening a second retail outlet.

loans.use: to purchase beach blankets and towels for the summer season

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es: El cliente Jorge vive en la ciudad de Libertad,  que esta ubicada en el perfil costanero del Ecuador, la actividad económica de la ciudad de su residencia mayoritariamente es el turismo y la pesca, por lo cual puede conseguir sus productos a buen precio. Don Jorge tiene 42 años, es soltero y no tiene hijos, tiene un negocio de venta de pescados y mariscos, no tiene empleados y el solo atiende a sus clientes  todos los días, la idea de realizar los prestamos en Banco D-MIRO es hacer su negocio más grande y ofrecer productos frescos  de buena calidad para tener a sus clientes contentos y satisfechos comprando pecado, mariscos variados.
texts.en:
Jorge lives in the city of Libertad, which is on the Ecuadorian coast.  The city’s business activities are centered on tourism and fishing.  Therefore, he is able to get his products at a good price.

Jorge, age 42, is single and does not have children.  He has a business selling fish and seafood.  He does not have employees, and he tends to his customers every day by himself.

The reason for the loan with Banco D-MIRO is to make his business bigger.  It is also to offer fresh, good quality products in order for his customers to be happy and satisfied buying fish and varied seafood.

loans.use: to buy fish and varied seafood.

loans.name: Heriberta

texts.es: La Sra. Heriberta reside en la ciudad de La Libertad – Ecuador, el cliente empezó a  su negocio gracias a capital cedido por su esposo para que tuviera un dinero extra, es así como inicio con un bazar en su domicilio donde trabaja sola desde las 08:00 hasta las 21:00, se decidió a realizar un préstamo en Banco D-MIRO porque desea ampliar su local y poder ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en: Heriberta lives in the city of La Libertad, Ecuador. She began her business thanks to working capital given her by her husband, which enabled her to have some extra money. This is how she started with a shop in her home, where she works alone from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. She made up her mind to undertake a loan with Banco D-Miro because she wishes to expand her shop and her home.

loans.use: To expand her shop and her home.

loans.name: Katherine Amada

texts.es: La cliente Katherine reside en la ciudad de La Libertad – Ecuador, hace algunos años se inscribió en una red de mujeres vendedoras de cosméticos por catálogos,   al inicio fue un poco complicado por cuanto no tenia clientes, pero a través del tiempo y después de vender los productos a sus familiares y amigos a podido tener un numero importante de clientes, actualmente Katherine    forma parte de varias redes de venta de productos por catálogos, lo que le ha permitido incrementar sus ingresos, ahora su sueño es ampliar su red de clientes.
texts.en:
Katherine lives in the city of La Libertad, Ecuador. Some years ago she joined a network of women selling cosmetics by catalog. At the beginning it was a bit difficult because she did not have customers, but in the course of time, and after selling products to her family members and friends, she is been able to aquire a significant number of customers. 

Currently Catherine is part of several networks selling products by catalog, and this has allowed her to increase her income. Now her dream is to expand her customer network.

loans.use: Sale of costume jewelry.

loans.name: Vicente Wilfrido

texts.es: La cliente Vicente reside en la ciudad de La Libertad – Ecuador, empezó a vender guineo en las mañanas dentro del mercado de la ciudad y como le fue bien se proyecto en un futuro tener su propio local, es así que actualmente después de mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y disciplina se puso su propio local, su esposa también es una microempresaria y se dedica a vender ropa, el préstamo que actualmente realizo es para comprar mas cajas de guineo ya que desea ampliar su numero de clientes.
texts.en:
Vicente lives in the city of La Libertad, Ecuador. He began selling bananas in the mornings in the city market, and as it went well, he planned to someday have his own shop. This is how currently, after great deal of effort, dedication and discipline, he set up his own shop. 

His wife also has a small business and sells clothing. The loan he is currently undertaking is to buy more crates of bananas, as he wishes to expand his number of customers.

loans.use: To buy fruit.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is married with two children and both her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a food stall business selling Cavendish bananas, tomatoes, mangoes, onions, oranges and cabbages. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a bigger stall and to educate her children up to university. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more cavendish bananas, tomatoes, onions, mangoes, cabbages, and oranges

loans.name: Silvia Veronica

texts.es: La cliente Silvia reside en la ciudad de La Libertad – Ecuador, empezó a vender ropa a credito  a su circulo de amistades y familiares, de esta manera consiguio otros clientes referidos, y es asi como empieza a conocer el comportamiento de este negocio en el que se ha mantenido varios años y actualmente tiene muchos clientes, el negocio lo atiende sola ya que su esposo es chofer. La idea de realizar el prestamo en Banco D-MIRO es comprar mas ropa de damas y caballeros.
texts.en:
Silvia lives in the city of La Libertad, Ecuador.  She began selling clothing on credit to her circle of friends and family members, and this way got other customers by referral. She is beginning to know how this business works. She has been in it for several years and currently has many customers. 

She runs the business on her own, as her husband is a driver. The purpose of undertaking a loan with Banco D-Miro is to buy more women's and men's clothing.

loans.use: To buy women's and men's clothing.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La cliente María reside en la ciudad de La Libertad – Ecuador, tiene ocho años a la confección de ropa, su familia se dedicaba a esta actividad y es donde aprendió este oficio, por eso ella escogió dedicarse a este negocio, donde trabaja de lunes a domingo y realiza sola todo el proceso de producción, actualmente es capaz de realizar trajes de hombres, mujeres y niños, el objetivo del préstamo en Banco D-MIRO es adquirir telas y su sueño futuro es tener maquinas especiales como botoneras, maquinas de bordado y así mejorar su taller.
texts.en:
María lives in the city of La Libertad, Ecuador. She has been making clothing for eight years. Her family worked in this business and it is where she learned this occupation. This is why she chose to devote herself to this business, where she works from Monday to Sunday, and carries out the entire production process on her own. 

Currently she is able to make outfits for men, women, and children. The purpose of the loan at Banco D-Miro is to acquire fabric, and her dream for the future is to have special equipment such as button sewers and embroidery machines, in order to improve her workshop.

loans.use: COMPRA DE TELAS

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина – предприниматель из Новой Каховки. Она торгует на местном рынке. Основная группа товаров под реализацию – женская джинсовая одежда: джинсовые брюки, юбки, рубашки, пиджаки и куртки. Ирина торгует этими товарами уже 19 лет. Землю арендует у администрации торгового центра. 
Ирине необходима сумма в размере 23 000 гривен для того, чтобы пополнить ассортимент новых моделей джинсов, а также, чтобы установить новые двери и решетку в бутике, в котором она работает. У Ирины – достаточный опыт торговли, товар качественный и ходовой. Она имеет постоянных клиентов и всегда устанавливает на свои товары умеренные цены.
texts.en: Irina is an entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. She sells women's denim clothing at a local market, including denim pants, skirts, shirts, coats and jackets. She has been selling clothing for over 19 years and rents space from the marketplace administration. Irina needs 23,000 hryvnia in order to stock  new styles of denim and to install new doors and security bars in the boutique where she works. Irene has ample retail experience and sells high-quality merchandise in popular styles. She has regular customers and always sells at reasonable prices.

loans.use: to stock new styles of denim and to install new doors and security bars in the boutique where she works

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей уже на пенсии. Раньше работал шахтером. Летом Сергей занимается выращиванием ягод и овощей на огороде. Часть выращенной продукции идет на продажу, остальное - едят сами и консервируют на зиму.

Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Сергей приобрел мотоблок, чтобы обрабатывать свою землю. В этот раз Сергей проосит предоставить кредит в размере 5000 гривен на покупку газонокосилки и стиральной машины для летнего домика. Сергей посадил сад и надеется, что через пару лет сад будет давать ему прибыль.
texts.en: Sergei is already retired.  He previously worked as a miner.  Sergei is involved in growing berries and vegetables in a garden in the summer.  A portion of the grown produce goes for sale, and the rest is consumed and canned for the winter.  Thanks to the previous loan, Sergei purchased a motoblock to treat his land.  This time, Sergei is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 hryvnia to purchase a lawnmower and a washing machine for his summer house.  Sergei planted a garden and hopes that it will bring him a profit for a couple of years.

loans.use: to purchase a lawnmower and a washing machine for his summer house

loans.name: Aku

texts.en: Even though Aku grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Aku is an entrepreneur. She sells local drinks in Hohoe. Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began two years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their seven children. Aku has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more drinks to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aku wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks for resale

loans.name: Luz De Luna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ DE LUNA”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papas fritas, venta de fruta, venta de repuestos, venta de molde de repostería, producción de papas fritas, venta de dulces, venta de productos de belleza, venta de chantilin.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de papas fritas; este negocio lo emprendió hace un año por iniciativa propia, ya que anteriormente trabajaba ayudando a sus padres a realizar estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aceites por galones) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The “LUZ DE LUNA”  (Moonlight) community bank are starting their third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani regional office.  This group has nine members and is run by a board of directors which has Alicia as its secretary.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling French fries, selling fruit, selling spare parts, selling confectionery molds, producing French fries, selling sweet treats, selling beauty products and selling chantilly cream desserts.

The loan will benefit this group of small micro-businesswomen, of which Alicia is a member.  Alicia says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago through an invite from a friend who was an existing member of the institution.  She currently has a business producing and selling French fries.  She started this business a year ago on her own initiative.  In the past, she worked helping her parents make these products.

Alicia will use this loan to increase her capital.  She will buy oil by the gallon from suppliers and then, after making her products, she will sell them from her sales location.  This work allows her to make income for her family.  Alicia is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Alicia replied that she likes the health services and the training sessions.

loans.use: to buy oil by the gallon

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter tiene 34 años y vive con su esposa en una casa construida a base de adobe.Se dedica a la  agricultura porque desde muy niño creció en el campo junto a sus padres a quienes apoyaba en tareas menores cultivando cacao y café para obtener ganancias y mantenerse económicamente.Cuando creció empezó a trabajar mucho porque tenía una familia y necesitaba salir adelante y por eso sus padres decidieron ayudarlo regalándole una pequeña parcela con plantaciones de cacao que le sirvió mucho para empezar independientemente.Actualmente cuenta con una hectárea de cultivo en donde también tiene árboles frutales. Para mejorar la calidad de sus productos suele usar abono orgánico porque considera que usar fertilizantes artificiales deteriora la calidad de sus suelos a largo plazo.Cuando es tiempo de cosechar sus productos convoca trabajadores del lugar para posteriormente secar los granos de cacao extraídos y venderlo a los compradores de la zona esperando recuperar el dinero que invirtió y también obtener ganancias adicionales. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En esta ocasión desea solicitar 1,000 nuevos soles para contratar trabajadores del lugar  y retirar la maleza de sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en: Water is 24 years old and lives with his wife in a house made of adobe. He is in agriculture for a living because as a child he grew up in the countryside together with his parents who relied on him for small tasks cultivating cocoa and coffee to obtain income and maintain themselves economically. When he grew up, he began to work a lot because he had a family and needed to get ahead in life. His parents decided to help him, gifting him a small plot of land with fields of cocoa that helped him start independently. Today he says he has a hectare of crops where he also has fruit trees. To improve the quality of his products he usually uses organic fertilizer because he thinks using artificial fertilizers deteriorates the quality of his soil. When it is time to harvest his products he hires site workers to then dry the extracted cocoa beans and sell it to the buyers of the zone, hoping to recuperate the money that he invested and also to obtain additional income. This is his first loan with Kiva and is very grateful for the financial support that he is receiveing to continue getting ahead in life. On this occasion, he would like to request 1,000 nuevos soles to contract on-site workers and remove the weeds from his farmland.

loans.use: to hire workers on site.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda  tiene 51 años, es una mujer divorciada y cuido a sus hijos sola hasta lograr que sean personas mayores y responsables. Vive en una casa hecha con bloques de adobe.Yolanda se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 40 años razón por la cual cultiva cacao, café y otros productos rentables de su zona.Actualmente sus parcelas están llenas de árboles cacaoteros y lo mantiene en buen estado gracias a la ayuda de algunos trabajadores del lugar.Actualemnte desea retirar varios árboles de cacao que están desfasados para comprar plantones nuevos y no desperdiciar parte de sus terrenos de cultivo en la próxima campaña agrícola.Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero brindado ya que le permite seguir adelante con su actividad agrícola.En esta ocasión desea solicitar 500 nuevos soles para comprar árboles de cacao y reemplazar los árboles desfasados.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 51, is a divorced woman and she raised her children alone until they became responsible adults.  She lives in a house made of adobe bricks.  Yolanda has worked in agriculture for 40 years; she grows cocoa beans, coffee and other products that are profitable in her zone.  Her parcels are currently full of cocoa bean trees that she keeps in good condition thanks to help from local day laborers.  She currently wants to remove some of the cocoa bean trees that are no longer producing and replace them with new seedlings in order not to waste any of her farmland in the next growing cycle.

This is her second Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support provided because it helps her continue with her work.  On this occasion she wants to ask for 500 new soles to buy cocoa bean trees to replace the ones that are no longer producing.

loans.use: to buy cocoa bean trees.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe.Hace 3 años uso el dinero que ahorró trabajando en el campo y puso una tienda en donde vende insumos para la agricultura como abono orgánico y polvos contra las plagas más perjudiciales de su zona.Decidió involucrarse en este negocio porque en su localidad no hay muchas tiendas similares y eso le permite tener buenas ventas para mantener a su familia. Le agrada mucho su trabajo porque a la vez puede atender a sus hijos sin salir de casa.Cuando necesita más mercadería debe solicitarlo a sus proveedores quienes viven en una ciudad muy cercana a la suya.Su principal objetivo es ampliar su negocio con más variedad de productos y a la vez reemplazar los bloques de adobe de su vivienda por ladrillos y cemento. En esta ocasión desea solicitar 2,000 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio con la compra de abono orgánico para su negocio.
texts.en: Adela, 34, is married and has three children she lives with in a house built of adobe.  Three years ago she used money she’d saved working in the fields and opened a store to sell farm supplies like organic manure and anti-pest powder for the most damaging pests in her zone.  She decided to go into this business because there aren’t many similar stores in her area and this allows her to have good sales to support her family.  She likes her work very much because she doesn’t have to leave home and can care for her children.  When she needs merchandise she has to request it from suppliers that live in a city very near her own.  Her main objective is to expand the business with more variety of products and at the same time replace the adobe in her house with bricks and cement.  On this occasion she wants to ask for 2,000 new soles to stock her store purchasing organic manure for it.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en su casa construida a base de adobe. Alicia se dedica a la agricultura razón por la cual siembre cacao y cafe orgánico , su trabajo diario consiste en mantener en buen estado sus terrenos de cultivo para solventar los gastos de su hogar con la venta de los productos que obtiene además cría gallos y gallinas. Trabaja prácticamente todo el año con ayuda de su esposo y contratando trabajadores del lugar para disminuir la carga laboral. Parte de su labor diaria es también  brindarle un buen cuidado a sus aves porque según comenta deben ser alimentados y aseados de la manera adecuada para luego ser vendidos en diferentes ferias y mercados. Posee dos mini criaderos de gallos  en su casa de campo cerca de sus terrenos y otra en su casa ubicada en el pueblo. De esta manera logra tambien mantener económicamente  a su familia y espera usar el dinero que viene ahorrando en mejorar su vivienda reemplazando los bloques de adobe por ladrillos y cemento.En está oportunidad desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para mejorar el ambiente de sus galpones con al compra de mallas metálicas y listones de madera.
texts.en:
Alicia, 38, lives with her husband and three children in an adobe house.  Alicia works in agriculture and has always grown cocoa beans and organic coffee.  Her daily work consists in keeping her farmland in good condition in order to cover household expenses with the sale of products she grows; she also raises roosters and chickens.  She works almost all year with help from her husband and hiring local day laborers to help ease the chores.  

Part of her daily chores is also to care well for her fowl because according to what she says they must be fed and cleaned adequately in order to be sold in various street markets and markets.  She own two mini coops for roosters at her country house near her fields and another one in her house in town.  She’s able to support her family this way and hopes to use the money she’s been saving to improve her house replacing the adobe with bricks and cement. On this occasion she wants to have 3,000 new soles to improve the sheds; she will buy metallic mesh and wood slats.

loans.use: to buy metallic mesh and wood slats.

loans.name: Enith

texts.es: Enith tiene 37 años de edad. Es divorciada y vive en su propia casa acompañada de su hija. Su principal actividad es el comercio, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes siendo su casa su propio centro de trabajo. A raíz de su separación ella comenzó con este negocio gracias a la  ayuda de sus padres. Enith espera sacar adelante su pequeño negocio y hacerlo crecer de tal manera que pueda abastecer a sus clientes ofreciéndoles productos de mejor calidad. Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para su desempeño laboral. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1500 soles el cual lo invertirá en la compra de artículos para surtir su tienda tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
Enith, 37, is divorced living in her own house with her daughter.  Her main activity is commerce.  She sells groceries and her place of work is located at home.  As a result of her separation she started the business with help from her parents.  Enith hopes to move the business forward and make it grow so that she can supply her customers offering them better quality products.

This is her first Kiva loan and she’s very grateful for the opportunity being presented to obtain a line of credit that will be very useful for her work’s development.  On this occasion, she will request 1,500 soles to buy merchandise like rice, sugar and milk, among others to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela tiene 24 años, vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo en una casa construida a base de adobe. Angela se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, lleva 4 años en su negocio y puede dedicarse a está actividad sin descuidar a su pequeño hijo.Ofrece a sus clientes algunos productos tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros, además de productos de limpieza y pequeños artículos comerciales entre sus consumidores.Suele comprar sus productos al por mayor para obtenerlos a bajos precio y mantener su negocio abastecido por más tiempo.
Su negocio está ubicado en el primer piso de su vivienda el cual lo habilitó con ayuda de su esposo para desempeñar su labor. Uno de sus principales objetivos es trabajar con la motivación que la caracteriza para construir su vivienda a base de ladrillos y cemento para luego ampliar su negocio para incrementar sus ganancias.En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para comprar sacos de arroz, azúcar, fideos, bebidas y otros productos que son solicitados en su zona.
texts.en:
Ángela, 24, lives with her husband and little boy in an adobe house.  Ángela she works selling food products and has been in business four years; she’s able to do business while caring for her little son.  She offers her customers such things as rice, sugar and milk, among others, as well as cleaning supplies and small commercial items among her consumers.  She tends to buy her products at wholesale so she can get lower prices and keep her store stocked for longer periods of time.

Her business is located in her house’s first floor; with help from her husband she furnished it for this purpose.  One of her main objectives is to work with her characteristic motivation in order to build a house with bricks and cement to then expand the business to increase profits.  On this occasion she wants to have 2,000 new soles to buy sacks of rice, sugar, noodles, beverages and other products in demand in her zone.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lila

texts.es: Lila tiene 29 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres con sus 3 hijos. Lila se dedica a la venta de refrescos por el día y comidas regionales por las noches. Hace dos años inicio este negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. También se dedica a la venta de productos de plásticos, como son baldes, plateros, etc. Todos los días después de vender sus refrescos sale a recorres las calles ofreciendo sus productos, percibiendo así un ingreso extra. Como una mujer emprendedora espera seguir creciendo y aumentar su negocio para mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos y ofrecer a sus hijos un mejor futuro. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido, el cual le ayudará a mejorar su negocio y a dinamizar sus ventas. Pues tendrá el capital para trabajar razón por la cual promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Lila, invertirá los S/.1000 en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus refrescos tales como azúcar, frutas , entre otros.
texts.en: Lila is 29 years old, single, and lives in her parent's home with her three children. Lilsa sells beverages during the day and traditional regional meals in the evenings. Two years ago she began this business in order to improve her quality of life and that of her family. She also sells plastic products such as buckets, dish racks, etc. Every day after selling her beverages she goes out to the streets to sell her products, and in this way earns extra income. As a woman entrepreneur she hopes to continue growing and expanding her business in order to improve sales and increase her earnings and offer her children a better future. This is her first credit with Kiva, for which she is thankful for the economic support which will help her improve her business and energize her sales. She will have the capital to work so she promises to be punctual with her loan payments. Lila will invest the S/1000 in buying ingredients such as sugar, fruit, and more in order to prepare her refreshments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make beverages.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando es mecánico, se dedica a la reparación de motos. Tiene un pequeño taller en su casa el cual es su propio centro de trabajo. Anteriormente tuvo que trabajar en diferentes talleres para lograr tener experiencia y de esa manera independizarse, es así como emprendió su negocio. Como actividad complementaria trabaja como chofer de camiones, transportando carga a la costa, percibiendo un ingreso extra que le ayuda a mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia. Rolando espera sacar adelante su pequeño taller y hacerlo crecer de tal manera que pueda abastecer a sus clientes ofreciéndoles un mejor servicio y de calidad. Esta es la primera vez que trabaja con Kiva, y está muy contento por el apoyo económico recibido. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000.00 comprara herramientas que utiliza en su trabajo a diario tales como desarmadores, martillos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Rolando is a mechanic who repairs motorcycles. He has a small shop in his house, his own work center. Previously, he had to work in different shops to gain experience and, in this manner, to become independent. That is how he started his business.

As a complementary business, he works as a truck driver transporting cargo to the  coast, earning extra income that helps improve his and his family's standard of living.

Rolando hopes to advance his small shop and make it grow sufficiently to supply his customers needs, offering them a better service, one of quality. This is the 1st time he has worked with Kiva. Rolando is very content with the economic assistance he has received. 

With the solicited total of 1,000 sols he will purchase tools to utilize in his daily work, including screwdrivers and hammers, among other tools.

loans.use: to buy tools such as screwdrivers, hammars, etc. for his repair shop.

loans.name: Cordilleritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORDILLERITAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de balones deportivos, tejido de chompas, costura de polleras, venta de bisutería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de balones; este negocio lo emprendió con un poco capital que tenía, aprendiendo el mismo de su tía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de balones) que adquirirá de las ferias, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The "Cordilleritas" Communal Bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujere from the Collpani Regional Office.The group is made up of six members and is led by a board of directors which Justina is the President of. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied, including a neighborhood store, soccer ball sales, sweater weaving, sewing of traditional skirts and jewelry sales. 

The loan that is being taken out will benefit the small business owners of Justina's group. She says that this is her first time with Pro Mujer and she entered by invitation from a friend who is already a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling soccer balls. She started this business with a little bit of capital that she had and learning from her aunt. 

The loan that she will take out is to buy soccer balls that she will get wholesale from markets and then sell at her stall. This type of work allows her to generate the resources for her family. She lives with her partner and has five children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes the health services offered.

loans.use: to buy soccer balls.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es: Benilda, de 31 años de edad, está casada con Rosendo quien es mecánico. Juntos viven cómodamente en su casa propia. La actividad que tiene Benilda es la venta de repuestos de vehículos en general como palieres, rodajes, llantas, entre otros. Para eso cuenta con un local que instalo en el interior de su vivienda. Todas sus mercaderías las cuales trae desde otra ciudad y las vende a precios competitivos logrando ganarse la preferencia de sus clientes quienes la recomiendan  con otras personas, logrando hacer crecer su clientela, siendo su tienda muy concurrida. También se dedica a la reparación de estos vehículos. Viendo los buenos resultados de su negocio, desea en un futuro aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería y ampliar su local. Este será su segundo préstamo con Kiva , por ello espera de su colaboración y así pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con  el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles comprará repuestos de vehículos al por mayor así tendrá un stock disponible para la venta.
texts.en:
Benilda, 31, is married to Rosendo who is a mechanic.  They live comfortably in their own house.  Benilda’s activity is selling auto spare parts like ball bearings, wheels and tires, among others.  To do so she set up a sales space at home.  She brings all her merchandise from another city and sells it at competitive prices earning her customers’ preference who then recommend her to other people thus expanding her clientele; her store is very busy.  She also works repairing vehicles.  

Seeing the good results her business is having she wants in future to increase the amount of merchandise and expand the locale.  This is her second Kiva loan and she’s hoping for your collaboration so she can make her plans reality.  On the other hand, she commits once more to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 2,500 new soles to buy spare parts at wholesale in order to have stock on hand to sell.

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru: У Тамары свой бизнес. Она шьет одежду на заказ. Благодаря прошлому кредиту Тамара смогла приобрести необходимое оборудование - оверлок - и расширить свой бизнес. В этот раз Тамаре нужен кредит, чтобы отремонтировать свою швейную машинку, а также благоустроить комнату, где она выполняет заказы, и оборудовать примерочную.
texts.en: Tamara has her own business sewing custom orders. Thanks to her last loan, she was able to buy an Overlock sewing machine and expand her business. Now Tamara needs a loan to repair her sewing machine and to furnish her work room and her fitting room.

loans.use: to remodel room for her sewing business and to fix her sewing machine

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha de 74 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y emprendedora , es madre soltera de 3 hijos los cuales viven en su casa propia. Bertha se dedica a la confección, cose ropa para damas, caballeros y niños para toda ocasión , está actividad la realiza en su casa propia en un ambiente bien equipado con máquinas de coser y muebles, en donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes. Trabaja en una empresa privada a medio tiempo y por las tardes realiza está actividad. Cuando empezó, solo tenía una máquina que compró con ayuda de su familia pero ahora está muy bien implementada. Esta actividad lo realiza sola. Antes de empezar con este negocio su sueldo no le alcanzaba. Espera seguir creciendo y comprar nuevas máquinas y ampliar su negocio. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 07 con Kiva, está muy contenta de poder contar con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, ya que así avanzara con su negocio y se convertirá en una gran empresaria. Con el préstamo solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará materiales de costura como telas, elásticos , hilos , entre otros.
texts.en:
Bertha, 74, is a charismatic, enterprising woman.  She’s a single mother of three children; they live in her own house.  Bertha works making clothes; she sews for women, men and children for all occasions.  She does this activity at home in an environment that’s well-equipped with sewing machines and furniture; she tends to her customers very kindly there.  She works half time for a private firm and does this activity in the afternoon.  When she started out she only had one machine that she bought with help from her family but now she’s well equipped.  She does this activity alone.  Before starting this business her salary wasn’t enough.  She hopes to continue growing and to buy new machines and to expand the business.  

Therefore, this will be her 7th Kiva loan.  She’s very happy to be able to rely on the financial support she’s getting because she moves forward with her business this way and she will become a great businesswoman.  She will use the requested 1,000 new sol loan to buy sewing supplies like fabric, elastic and thread, among others.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena, de 23 años, esta casada con William de 28 años con quien tiene una hija de 3 años de edad respectivamente; por el momento vive en la casa de su suegra. El trabajo de Elena consiste en la venta de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, aceite, entre otros. Tiene un espacio en su casa destinado a esta actividad en donde atiende diariamente a sus clientes ya que por la tardes instala su puesto de ventas al frente la escuela de la zona en la que vive y ahí se encarga de trabajar durante el recreo hasta la hora de salida de los niños. Lleva en ésta actividad 7 años, trabaja sola mientras que su pareja se dedica a otra actividad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para realizar otras actividades, actualmente desea implementar una tienda mas amplia y con productos de mejor calidad para sus clientes. Este es su noveno crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles comprará mayor cantidad de productos comestibles conformado por arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos , aceite , entre otros.
texts.en:
Elena, 23, is married to William, 28, with whom she has a 3-year-old daughter.  At present she lives in her mother-in-law’s house.  Elena’s work consists in selling food items like rice, sugar, milk, eggs and oil, among others.  She has a space at home set aside for this activity where she tends to her customers daily; during the afternoon she sets up a stand in front of the local school where she lives and works there during recess and when school lets out.  She’s been in this activity for seven years and works alone since her spouse works in a different activity.  What she likes best about her work is the freedom she has to do other things.  She currently wants to set up a larger store with better quality items for her customers.

This is her ninth Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue forward.  She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy larger amounts of food items like rice, sugar, milk, eggs and oil, among others.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ñustas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ÑUSTAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Brígida es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pollos a la broster, venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa interior, venta de huevos, venta de leche.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Brígida es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por iniciativa propia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa americana; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años con unos ahorros que tenía y en la actualidad sigue trabajando porque es un negocio rentable.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa americana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el apoyo en grupo, el área de salud y la orientación que se le brinda.
texts.en:
The "Ñustas" Communal Bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer from the Villa Adela Regional Office. The group is made up of six members and led by a board of directors in which Brígida is the Treasurer. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are several, including the sale of fried chicken, "salchipapas" (a fast food dish of french fries and sausage), underwear, eggs, and milk. 

The loan that will be taken out will benefit the small business owners within Brígida's group. She indicates that she started with Pro Mujer six months ago on her own initiative. She now has a business selling clothing from the United States. Brígida says that she began this business with some savings that she had and now continues working because the business has been profitable. 

The loan Brígida is taking out is to increase her capital through the purchase of American clothing that she will buy from wholesalers in the city of El Alto. She will then sell the clothing at her locale. This type of work allows her to generate resources to sustain her household as best as she can. She is a single mother of two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the group support, the health services and the orientation that is offered.

loans.use: to buy American clothing.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, tiene 30 años, es una mujer humilde, optimista y muy trabajadora, está casada con David de 32 años con quien tiene una hija de 07 años de edad respectivamente,juntos viven en su casa propia.
Carmen se dedica a la venta de repuestos, piezas y accesorios para todo tipo de vehículos, asimismo realiza funciones de mantenimiento y reparacion de mototaxis , los cuales presentan algunas deficiencias en su funcionamiento y gracias a la excelente calidad con la que realiza su trabajo es considerada como una de las mejores en éste rubro. Tienen muchos clientes y siempre es muy recomendada, esto  le genera seguridad y estabilidad económica ya que a diario la fluidez de la clientela es alta, éste trabajo lo realiza en un local que alquilaron juntos y aunque al principio fue un poco difícil por el temor y las dudas que sentían, no se dejaron amilanar y hoy por hoy siguen adelante con el deseo de seguir creciendo.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver que sus clientes se sienten contentos cuando observan que los vehículos terminan en buenas condiciones y funcionando a la perfección, satisfacción que conoce y comparte de cerca ya que también tiene 2 mototaxis. Este es el séptimo crédito con Kiva, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir este apoyo financiero. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles comprará repuestos, piezas y accesorios para su taller tales como cámaras, rodajes, llantas, pernos, aceites, entre otros.
texts.en:
Carmen, 30, is a humble, optimistic, very hardworking woman.  She’s married to David, 32, with whom she has a 7-year-old daughter; they all live together in her own house.

Carmen works selling spare parts for all types of vehicles and also provides maintenance and service for mototaxis that are having mechanical problems.  Thanks to the excellent work she does she’s considered one of the best in the business.  They have many customers and she’s always recommended to others which generates security and economic stability since customer turnover is high every day.  She does the work in a space they rented together and although it was a bit difficult at the beginning because of fear and doubts they felt, they didn’t become discouraged and today they continue forward hoping to continue growing.

What she likes best about her work is to see her customers feel happy when they see that their vehicles turn out in good condition and running perfectly, a satisfaction that she feels and shares herself since they also own two mototaxis.

This is her 7th Kiva loan and she’s grateful for the opportunity and for the trust placed in her to receive this financial support.  She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy spare parts and accessories for her shop like inner tubes, wheels, tires, bolts and oil, among others.

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts.

loans.name: Ollitas De Barro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “OLLITAS DE BARRO”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por seis  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas, venta de fruta, venta de ganado, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de sus amigas de grupo que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ganado; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, el área de salud y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The “Ollitas de Barro” (Little Clay Pots) communal bank will start the first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Focal Center.  It has six members led by a governing board presided over by Rosa.  The communal bank members are in a variety of businesses among which are: sweater knitting, fruit sales, cattle sales and vegetable sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Rosa.  She indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer having been invited by her girlfriends in the group who are members of the institution. She currently has a business selling cattle and she makes it known that she started it on her own initiative several years ago.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy cattle in communities adjacent to La Paz Department and then she’ll sell it in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family since she’s single and has a son.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit, the health area and the training sessions.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson tiene 34 años de edad, vive en su propia casa acompañado de su pareja y sus dos hijas.
Su principal actividad económica es la de brindar servicios en un empresa de transporte. Antes tenía su propia tierra, pero cuando su esposa se enfermo, lo vendió y gracias al apoyo de su familia pudo comprarse un carro nuevo que le ayudo a mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia. Lo que espera de su trabajo es seguir creciendo y más adelante independizarse para poner su propia empresa de transporte.
Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que esta muy contento y agradece el apoyo económico recibido, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero solicitado de S/.800.00 lo invertirá en la reparación y mantenimiento de su carro, ya que es su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Wilson is 34 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and two children. 
His primary work is providing transportation services. Previously he had his own farmland, but when his wife became sick, he sold it and thanks to the support of his family he could buy a new car that helped him improve his standard of living and that of his family. He hopes to continue growing his business and in the future become independent and own his own transportation business. 
This is his first loan with Kiva, for which he is very content and thankful for the economic support he has received. He promises to be punctual with the loan payments. The S/800.00 funds will be used to repair and maintain his car, as this is his primary work tool.

loans.use: to maintain and fix his car in order to continue working.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar, de 29 años, es soltero,pero tiene una hija pequeña de solamente 02 años, actualmente vive en una casa alquilada y trabaja mucho todos los días para mejorar su situación económica  y poder ofrecerle a su hija una mejor condición de vida. Edgard se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte urbano local mediante el traslado de pasajeros dentro y fuera de la ciudad, este trabajo lo realiza hace 13 años en el taxi que su amigo le da en alquiler, recorre las calles de la ciudad de principio a fin en busca de pasajeros que deseen llegar sanos y salvos a su destino, aunque también gracias a sus cualidades de buen conversador y por su ánimo alegre tiene clientes fijos que lo llaman  ante cualquier situación o eventualidad para contar con su servicio. Además también ofrece y vende de manera paralela repuestos y accesorios de vehículos como llantas, rodajes y otras piezas, las que ofrece de manera casual o vende por pedidos que le hacen personalmente algunos clientes y amigos, en esta actividad ha encontrado rentabilidad y con el desarrolló de ambas espera consolidarse en el rubro del transporte. Este es su cuarto crédito con Kiva y está muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite salir adelante con su actividad económica.
El monto solicitado de 2000 soles lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su vehiculo de trabajo y en la compra de repuestos, llantas, rodajes, ejes, rotulas, amortiguadores, y otras piezas para continuar su trabajo de ventas.
texts.en:
Edgar, 29, is single but has a young daughter of only 2 years.  He currently lives in a house he rents and works a lot every day to improve his financial situation and to be able to give his daughter a better quality of life.  He earns his living providing local urban transportation services to customers into and out of the city.  He's been in this line of work for 13 years using a taxi he rents from his friend.  He travels the city streets from end to end in search of clients who want to be taken safe and sound to their destinations.  But thanks to his cheerful attitude and the fact that he's a good conversationalist he also has fixed clients who hire him for all manner of situations and eventualities.

Edgar also sells vehicle spare parts and accessories including tires, bearings and other parts.  He sells parts on hand or by personal orders from some friends and clients.   He's made profits from his businesses, and by developing both of them he hopes to establish himself in the transportation sector.  This will be his fourth Kiva loan and he's very pleased to know that he has the financial support he needs to succeed in his businesses.

Edgar will invest the 2000 soles he's seeking to maintain his taxi and buy spare parts, tires, bearings, axles, sockets, shock absorbers and other parts to keep up his sales business.

loans.use: for maintenance on his car and to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Expresso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EXPRESSO”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilda es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pasteles, venta de sombreros, venta de salchipapas, venta de ladrillos, venta de comida, venta de refrescos, venta de dulces.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilda es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; este negocio lo emprendió anteriormente en un taller donde trabajaba de operaria, posteriormente decide establecer un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a ala elaoración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el consultorio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Expresso" will start its 5th loan cycle in the Villa Exaltación offices of Pro Mujer.  The group has 8 members and is led by a board of directors, of which Hilda is the Secretary.  The members of this group have a variety of businesses, including: cake sales, hat sales, salchipapas (a dish with sausages and fried potatoes) sales, brick sales, food sales, drink sales, and sweets sales.

The loan that they are taking will benefit this group of small-businesswoman, of which Hilda is a member.  She states that she joined Pro Mujer 4 years ago at the invitation of an adviser from the institution when she went to her house to visit her.  Now, Hilda has a dressmaking business.  She started out in this line of work when she was employed at a dressmaking workshop, and later she decided to establish an independent business.

She will use this loan to increase her working capital; she will buy fabric from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and later use it to make items to sell from her sales post.  This type of work is enabling her to generate resources to support her household in so far as possible.  Hilda lives with a partner and their 4 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the loans and the health clinic.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Brith

texts.es:
Brith tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 08 años. Juntas viven en una casa construida a base de adobe. Brith se dedica a la venda de insumos para la agricultura como abono orgánico y polvos para los cultivos.Se inició con su negocio hace 2 años  y se ha convertido de a pocos en su principal sustento económico porque anteriormente apoyaba a sus padres en las distintas tareas agrícolas obteniendo así dinero para mantener a su pequeña. Logró iniciar su negocio con ayuda de sus padres porque no contaba aún con el apoyo de una entidad financiera para solicitar un préstamo, es así como habilitando la vivienda que sus padres le cedieron compro un poco de mercadería para empezar y así captar sus primeros clientes y posteriormente con apoyo de su entidad financiera ampliar su negocio.Con el dinero que fue ganando logró ampliar su negocio y comprar una pequeñ o terreno agrícola en donde tiene plantaciones de cacao orgánico que cultiva con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar , el cual le sirve para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Uno de sus principales objetivos es mejorar su negocio y comprar otra parcela para ampliar su producción de cacao.En está oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio con abono orgánico, el cual es muy solicitado por sus clientes.
texts.en: Brith is 26 years old, is a single mother, and has an 8 year old daughter. They live together in an adobe house. Brith sells agricultural products such as organic fertilizer and powders for crops. She began her business 2 years ago and what began as a supplemental income now is her primary means of support because previously she supported her parents with various farming chores to earn money to support her daughter. She was able to begin her business with her parents' help because she didn't yet have a financial organization's support to get a loan. So while living with her parents they gave her a bit of merchandise to start her business and gain her first customers and now with the support of her financing organization she can expand her business. With the money she has earned she was able to expand her business and buy a small piece of land where she planted organic cacao that she harvest with the help of local workers, and this serves to improve her income. One of her primary objectives is to improve her business and buy another parcel of land to expand her cacao production. With this loan she seeks 2000 nuevos soles to stock her business with organic fertilizer, which is very sought after by her customers.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Kotognogontala  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Kotognogontala 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’Tjila, un des villages de Niena dans la commune rurale de Wateni, région SIKASSO, 3ème  ville administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide et le maïs avec Alimata                         débout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide, semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Niena et environna. Après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 185.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et subvenir au frais de santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognogontala 1 Group are married women with an average age of 37 years and an average of three children. They are all living in traditional families in N'Tjila, one of the villages in Niena, in the rural town of Wateni, located in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. The group collaborates with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Alimata, shown standing in the center in the photo, grows crops of peanuts, and corn. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizer, herbicide, seeds and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland. After the harvest, produce is sold at the village market in Niena to a clientele composed of men and women.

Alimata hopes to earn an income of 185,000 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. The money she earns will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband pay for the daily household expenses and for their children's medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizer, herbicide, seeds and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Famosas De Primavera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FAMOSAS DE PRIMAVERA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de tostado, costura de chamarras, costura de prendas de vestir, venta de abarrotes, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes; este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia utilizando los ahorros que tenía su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Famosas de primavera" will be initiating its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer. The group belongs to Pro Mujer's regional office in Villa Exaltación, consists of eight members, and is led by a governing board where Maria is the chairperson. The members of this group run several kinds of businesses, for example selling clothes and toasted snacks, sewing jackets and other garments, selling groceries, and running stores.

The loan they apply for will benefit small micro entrepreneurs, Maria being one. She says that this is the first time she works with Pro Mujer, she became a member after one of the institution's advisors came to her home and invited her to join. Currently she runs a grocery store which she opened on her own initiative using the savings of her family.

The loan she is applying for is for buying flour, which she will get at the markets in the city of El Alto and then sell in her store. This way of working helps her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the loans.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo, tiene 26 años, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su esposa y sus 2 queridos hijos de 01 y 04 años de edad respectivamente. El trabajo de Gustavo consiste en la compra y venta de pescado fresco, realiza ésta actividad desde hace 06 años con ayuda de 02 colaboradores quienes se encargan de apoyarlo en la selección, traslado y venta de los pescados, de está manera puede mantener a su familia tranquila y brindándoles lo que necesita, su constante animo de superación ha hecho que incursione en este negocio y que poco a poco sea muy conocido, ya que él vende el pescado más fresco y sabroso del mercado, al principio le fue muy complicado adaptarse a la rutina porque no conocía bien el negocio, pero con el pasar del tiempo empezó a consolidarse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientas, considera que lo más difícil es soportar el intenso olor que emana de los pescados, ya que este se le impregna en la ropa y el cuerpo, a pesar de ello espera tener en el futuro un vehículo acondicionado que le permita transportar y conservar sus productos frescos por mucho más tiempo. Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que le brindan para seguir adelante , razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 2500 soles comprara  pescados de diferentes especies y de los mejores tamaños para continuar vendiéndolos , además dará mantenimiento al vehículo que le sirve para transportar los pescados.
texts.en:
Gustavo, 26, lives in his parent's house with his wife and their 2 beloved children, aged 1 and 4.  He works buying and selling frozen fish, an activity that he has been doing for 6 years along with 2 associates who help him select, transport, and sell the fish.  With this business, he is able to support his family, giving them a tranquil life where their needs are provided for.  His constant desire to achieve led him to start up this business, and over time it is becoming well known, because he sells the freshest and tastiest fish in the market.  At first it was very complicated for him to adapt to this routine, because he didn't know the business well.  But over time, he has grown the business.  What he likes most about his work is talking to his customers.  What he considers most difficult is putting up with the intense smell that emanates from the fish, because this impregnates his clothing and his body.  

In spite of this, he hopes in the future to have a vehicle that he can set up to transport his products and keep them fresh for much longer.  This will be his 6th loan with Kiva, and he is grateful for this opportunity and for the trust being provided to him so that he can get ahead.  For this reason, he promises to make his payments on time.  With the sum of 2,500 Peruvian soles that he requests, he will buy a variety of different fish of the best sizes, so that he can continue to sell them.  Also, he will do maintenance on the vehicle that he uses to transport the fish.

loans.use: to buy fish and to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Kotognogontala  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Kotognogontala 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’Tjila, un des villages de Niena dans la commune rurale de Wateni, région SIKASSO, 3ème  ville administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide et le maïs avec Biba                         débout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide, semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Niena et environs. Après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 195.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et subvenir au frais de santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognogontala 2 Group are married women with an average age of 42 years and an average of three children. They all live in traditional families in N'Tjila, one of the villages in Niena, in the rural town of Wateni, located in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. The group collaborates with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and their prior loans have all been repaid in full.

Biba, shown standing in the center in the photo, grows crops of peanuts and corn. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizer, herbicide, and seeds, and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village market in Niena to a clientele composed of men and women.

Biba hopes to earn an income of 195,000 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. The money she earns will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband pay for daily household expenses and for their children's medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizer, herbicide, seeds and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Kotognogontala 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’Tjila, un des villages de Niena dans la commune rurale de Wateni, région SIKASSO, 3ème  ville administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide et le maïs avec  Mariam                          débout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide, semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, . Après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 175.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et subvenir au frais de santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognogontala 3 Group are married women with an average age of 44 years and an average of five children. They are all living in traditional families in N'Tjila, one of the villages in Niena, in the rural town of Wateni, located in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. The group collaborates with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and their prior loans have all been repaid in full.

Mariam, shown standing in the center in the photo, grows crops of peanuts and corn. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizer, herbicide, and seeds, and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village market to a clientele composed of men and women.

Mariam hopes to earn an income of 175,000 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. The money she earns will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband pay for daily household expenses and for their children's medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizer, herbicide, and seeds, and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Cate

texts.en:
Cate  is married with three children and only one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her in-laws). She has a business selling   green bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income through selling milk and fish. She  sells on a retail basis only, seven days out of every week. 

Cate's major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of getting permanent business premises and also becoming a wholesaler. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.ru: Юсуф является мастером по ремонту легковых автомашин. Он живет и работает в городе Конибодом. Ему 36 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Его жена в настоящее время находится на заработках в России, а за детьми присматривает мать Юсуфа. Юсуф начал свою работу 5 лет назад. Его мастерская находится в центре города. Юсуф не только ремонтирует автомашины, он также с авторынка городов Худжанд и Конибодом закупает старые машины и после их починки продает их на тех же рынках по хорошей цене. Ему в деятельности помогает брат. Юсуф запрашивает кредит для закупа запасных частей и старых автомашин для продолжения деятельности.
texts.en:
Yusuf is a Master car mechanic. He lives and works in the city of Konibodom. He is 36 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is currently a migrant worker in Russia, and Yusuf's mother looks after the children.

Yusuf started his work five years ago. His workshop is situated in the city center. Yusuf does not only repair cards, but also purchases old cars at the car markets in the cities of Khujand and Konibodom. After repairing the old cards, he sells them at the same markets for a good price. His brother helps him with the business.

Yusuf requests a loan for the purchase of spare parts and an old car, to continue his work.
