loans.use: to purchase spare parts and an old vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma    is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for seven years. She generates additional   income from rental rooms. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only, in a shop that she rents. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to start importing used clothes.  

Fatuma resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent for her business premises, and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is married with six children and all her children go to school.  She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through selling local gin.  

Oliver works from home and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis, six days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also educating her children up to university.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.   Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр житель города Конибодом. Ему 48 лет. У него жена, сын и дочь. Его жена работает в Управлении социальной защиты населения ведущим специалистом. Старшая дочь замужем и живет отдельно. А сын студент и учится в городе Душанбе. Бахтиёр зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь услугой такси. Он в этой сфере уже 12 лет и работает по маршрутной линии город Конибодом - город Душанбе. Бахтиёр получаемую ежедневную выручку тратит на семейные расходы. В данный момент ему необходимо отремонтировать машину, чтобы продолжить деятельность. С этой целью он просит кредит и надеется на помощь.
texts.en:
Bakhtiyor is a resident of the city of Konibodom. He is 48 years old. He has a wife, a son and a daughter. His wife works at the Social Welfare office, as a leading specialist. His eldest daughter is married and lives separately, and the son is a student, studying in the city of Dushanbe. 

Bakhtiyor earns money for living through providing a taxi service. He has been in this area for more than 12 years. He works on a "marshrutka" line between the city of Konibodom and the city of Dushanbe. 

The monthly income Bakhtiyor receives, he spends on household expenses. Currently he needs to repair his car in order to continue the business. With this aim he requests a loan, an hopes for your support

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  is widowed with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling chickens and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more chickens for resale.  She also generates additional income through selling popcorn and selling charcoal. 

She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on wholesale basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves.  She is aspiring of rearing chickens herself and also owning a delivery van to ease transportation.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.   Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with four children and all her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a hair-dressing business and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more braids and hair weaves.  

Rose generates additional income through selling used clothes. She works in a shop in her residence and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked shop selling braids and weaves and also building her own house.    She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her  monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more braids and hair weaves.

loans.name: Ayim

texts.en: After graduating middle school, Ayim decided to set up her own food vendor business in Hohoe. With over ten years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more ingredients for her tasty dishes. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a mason) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her tasty dishes

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim  is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her father.   She has a beauty salon and has been in this business   for three years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more braids, a hand dryer, hair weaves and cream relaxers.  She works in a shop that she rents and   works seven days out of every week.  

Shamim's major business challenges include thieves and frequent electricity outages and increasing prices of cosmetics. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked beauty salon and also buying a generator to ease the electricity problem.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent for the business premises, and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more braids, cream relaxers, hair weaves and a hand dryer

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane  is married with six children and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her grand-children). She has a business selling snacks like samosas, pancakes and 'dog nuts'.  She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cooking oil, baking powder and cow peas.  She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Jane generates additional income through selling piped water. Her major business challenges include thieves and ever increasing prices of cooking oil and baking powder.  She is aspiring of owning a big bakery and also buying a plot of land so as to build rental rooms.   She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more baking flour, cooking oil, and cow     peas.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma  is married with ten children, and three of her children go to school. She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000   Uganda shillings   from MCDT-SACCO to buy more   bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income through selling piped water.  

Fatuma works at the market six days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include   seasonality, defaulters and thieves.  She is aspiring of going to villages of Masaka for green bananas and also becoming a wholesaler. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more  bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with five children, and four of her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her brother).  She has a pub and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda.  She generates additional income through selling used clothes.    

Josephine sells both on wholesale and retail basis and works seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include the rainy season which hinders her customers to come for a drink and also defaulters.   She is aspiring of   owning a fully stocked pub and also buying a plot of land and building her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees  and paying rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана замужем. У нее двое сыновей. Она имеет свой бизнес.

Оксана занимается продажей детской и подростковой одежды на протяжении 13 лет. Самым популярным товаром является школьная форма и бальные платья. Оксана трудолюбивая и заботливая. В ее планы входит развить бизнес и дать высшее образование сыну.

Оксана просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10000 гривен на закупку детской одежды и школьной формы. Кредит поможет ей увеличить прибыль.
texts.en:
Oksana is married and has two sons. She has her own business, and has worked with selling children's and youth clothing for a period of 13 years. The most popular product is the school uniform and ballroom dresses. 

Oksana is hardworking and caring. She plans to develop her business and give her son a higher education. Oksana requests a loan in the amount 10,000 hryvnia for the purchase of children's clothing and school uniforms. The loan will give her opportunity to grow her income.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing and high school uniforms for sale

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: Wilma, de 31 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora , esta divorciada y ahora tiene a cargo la crianza de su menor hijo de 11 años con quien vive en su casa propia.El trabajo de Wilma consiste en la venta de comida, es dueña de un restaurante muy concurrido en el distrito en el que vive, el cual a diario se llena ya que el secreto de Wilma esta en brindar un plato de comida con buena sazón y buena atención. Abre su local a las 6 de la mañana y cierra recién a las 11 de la noche, el local esta en su casa y se inicio vendiendo pocos platos y con algunas dificultades pues no sabia mucho de este negocio, ahora le esta yendo muy bien, puede dar empleo a 02 personas mas y esta muy contenta de estar trabajando en lo que le gusta ya que genera ingresos en su hogar. Este será el segundo préstamo con Kiva, por tanto esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de 2000 soles, comprará algunos listones, tablas, clavos y mas para acondicionar su local, además de algunos ingredientes e insumos en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Wilma, 31, is a cheerful and hard-working woman. She is divorced and has the custody of her youngest child who is 11 years old, they live together in the house she owns. Wilma works with food sales, she owns a popular restaurant in her home district that fills up with clients every day, Wilma's secret is to offer a well-seasoned and carefully prepared plate of food. She opens her restaurant at 6 am and closes at 11 pm, the diner is located in her house. Initially she sold few dishes and encountered some difficulties since she did not know much about this type of business, but now the restaurant is going very well and she has employed two more persons. She is happy to be working with something she likes, since it generates incomes in her home. 

This will be her second loan with Kiva, and she is very happy to know that she will receive financial support since this makes her feel safer in her work, and she pledges to make her repayments in time. She will use the requested amount of 2,000 PEN to buy slats, panels, and nails to help control the inside temperature of the diner, and to buy some ingredients and inputs in larger quantities.

loans.use: to buy panels, nails, and slats to improve her restaurant

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Víctor, de 47 años de edad, es un hombre  trabajador y empeñoso, con muchas ganas de progresar, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 03 hijos  de 20, 14,  y 03 años de edad respectivamente en su casa propia.
La actividad que realiza Víctor,  es la venta de productos comestibles de primera necesidad para eso cuenta con una tienda la cual está instalada en su casa, desde  donde atiende con sus productos a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos, a quienes atiende  de manera amable y cordial, a los largo de los 05 años que viene trabajando con su bodega, realiza esta actividad sola y en ocasiones con el apoyo de su esposo.Le  gusta su trabajo pues le permite estar en la comodidad de su hogar, así como los ingresos económicos que le genera para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar. Por lo contrario, lo que no le gusta es cuando algunos de sus clientes se retrasan en el pago de sus créditos concedidos, pero eso no la desanima y continua trabajado con las mismas ganas, ahora tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer.Este será el préstamo número 02 con Kiva, Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles comprará mas como arroz, azúcar, fideos , entre otros, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras al contado, para así surtir su bodega y contar con la preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Victor is 47 years old. He is hard working and determined, with a will to get ahead in life. He lives with his spouse and 3 children, aged 20, 14, and 3 years old, in a house they own.
Victor sells groceries of first necessity in a store located in his house where he takes care of his clients, most of whom are neighbors. He treats them in a kind and friendly way. He has had this business for 5 years and carries out his work mostly on his own, though sometimes with the help of his spouse. Victor enjoys his job because it allows him to work from the comfort of his home and the business profit allows him to help his spouse with the household expenses. On the negative side, he doesn't like it when customers are late on their payments, but this doesn't discourage him and he keeps working with the same energy. His plan now is to continue to work on his business and to make it grow.
This will be Victor's second loan with Kiva. He is hoping to get help to carry out his plans. With the amount of 3000 Nuevos Soles, Victor will buy supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. He will look to get lower prices by paying in cash so he can stock his store and gain his customer's preference.

loans.use: To purchase groceries such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Swabula

texts.en:
Swabula, a married mother of four children, all of whom go to school, also takes care of additional family members who are orphans. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills and food for the family.

For three years now, seven days per week, Swabula has been selling used children’s shoes at the market. This is her sole source of income, and her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She has requested a loan of 500000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bales of children’s shoes.

Swabula aspires to become a wholesaler and build her own business premise.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es: María tiene 38 años, es casada y vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijas. María ha emprendido un negocio dedicado a la venta de gaseosas y helados de hielo, trabaja desde su casa. Su esposo trabaja como mototaxista, y María ayuda a su familia con los ingresos de su negocio. Anteriormente trabajo como empleada y uno que otro trabajo casual el cual le sirvió para ahorrar dinero. Gracias a su esfuerzo y el apoyo de su esposo pudo salir adelante y abrir su propio negocio. Como una mujer emprendedora María espera sacar adelante su pequeño negocio y hacerlo crecer de tal manera que pueda abastecer a sus clientes ofreciéndoles un mejor producto y de calidad. Para María este es su primer crédito con Kiva por lo que está muy contenta y agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido razón por la cual promete ser responsable y puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. El monto de S/.500.00 lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, e insumos para la preparación de sus helados de hielo.
texts.en:
María is 38-years old, married, and lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She runs a business from her house selling soft drinks and popsicles and contributes to household expenses. Her husband drives a motorbike taxi. María used to work as a maid and other casual jobs that allowed her to save money. Thanks to her efforts and support from her husband, she has been able to get ahead and open her own business. As an enterprising woman María hopes to grow her small business so that she can supply her customers with better products of a higher quality.

This is her first loan with Kiva. She is very happy and grateful for the financial assistance so promises to be responsible and punctual with the repayments. She plans to use the S/.500.00 to buy soft drinks and ingredients to make popsicles.

loans.use: buy soft drinks and ingredients to make popsicles

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en: Fridah is a single mother of four children, two in school. She also takes care of her grandchildren. She does tailoring and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 400000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more rolls of clothing material and threads. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works at the market six days a week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a tailoring school and also to buy a plot of land to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing material and threads.

loans.name: Lenny

texts.es: Lenny, de 35 años de edad, está divorciada y vive en compañía de su madre, sus dos hermanos, su hijo y su cuñada en la casa que les dejó su padre como herencia material. Lenny se dedica a la venta de cebiche en un  restaurante que está ubicado en su hogar , este negocio lleva funcionando un promedio de 11 años , ahí atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes con el apoyo de su madre, su cuñada, y sus hermanos, desde que se inició en éste negocio ha obtenido grandes logros ya que sus ventas siempre fueron favorables. Su negocio le permite estar siempre ocupada y generar los ingresos económicos necesarios para solventar sus gastos personales y los de su hijo al que quiere mucho, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene en su cebichería desea implementarlo con mejores muebles y otros accesorios que brinden comodidad a sus clientes. Este es su décimo crédito con Kiva, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1200 soles comprará 4 mesas con sus respectivas sillas, además de ingredientes que necesita para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Lenny, 35, is divorced living with her mother, two siblings, son and sister-in-law in the house her father left them as an inheritance.  Lenny works selling marinated seafood cocktails [ceviche] in a restaurant located at home.  This business has been in operation for 11 years on average and she tends to customers there very kindly with help from her mother, sister-in-law and siblings.  Since the business started she’s reached important goals in that her sales have been favorable.  Her business keeps her busy always and generates income needed to cover personal expenses and expenses for her son who she loves very much.

Seeing the good results her ceviche shop is having she wants to furnish it with better furniture and other accessories that will provide comfort for her customers.  This is her tenth Kiva loan and she thanks all those who make her loan possible so she can continue towards her objectives; she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 1,200 sols to buy four tables with their respective chairs as well as the ingredients she needs to stay in business.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Delgertsetseg

texts.en: Delgertsetseg is 40 years old lives with her two children in a rental apartment in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her son, Battsogt, studies at university and daughter, Naransolongo, is 3 years old and goes to the local kindergarten. Delgertsetseg has been working as saleswoman in a construction supplies store since 2008 and just started her own store in a rental stall of a local construction supplies market. She has built close relationships with her customers and suppliers. She is now requesting 4,000,000 MNT to stock up her inventory for the renovation and construction high season. She is a hardworking, enthusiastic and diligent woman.

loans.use: to stock up her inventory for the renovation and construction high season

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents and one sibling. He is from Lebanon. His father is the main source of income for the family.  As for Hasan, he has been working in a local mini market since 2009 and earns a barely sufficient income. That’s why he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay his educational fees. He is very eager to make use of the loan as his only purpose is to get an education to be competitive with others to reach higher positions in his professional career. He already benefited from previous Kiva loans and he was very satisfied with the results. He has been an excellent client making his payments on time.

loans.use: to pay his educational fees

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with two children, one in school.  She also takes care of her father. She sells used shoes and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 400000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. Margaret works at the market seven days a week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and electricity.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a single mother of two children who both go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She sells used clothes and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to sell on a wholesale basis and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes .

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es: Marianela, de 29 años, está casada con Hemilton y junto a el tiene 02 hijos de 10 y 06 años de edad respectivamente, con quienes vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Marianela es la venta de productos comestibles en general como arroz, leche, aceite, huevos, azúcar, fideos y bebidas en general, para eso estableció una pequeña bodega en su casa propia, ahí atiende todos los días desde muy temprano de manera amable y cordial a todos sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos con quienes tiene una relación de amistad y respeto. Su bodega lleva funcionando recién 6 meses, generalmente atiende sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja. Le agrada su negocio ya que le permite estar en casa y participar en las actividades escolares de sus hijos y de su hogar, así mismo, el ingreso económico que obtiene le ayuda a solventar los gastos básicos de su familia, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene hasta la fecha , desea ampliar su negocio y ofrecer mayores productos. Este es el segundo crédito con Kiva, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles comprará mayor cantidad de diferentes productos y abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
Marianela, 29, is married to Hemilton and they have two children who are 10 and six years of age respectively; they all live together in her own house.  The activity Marianela does is selling groceries like rice, milk, oil, eggs, sugar, noodles and beverages in general.  To do so she set up a small store at home.  She’s open every day starting very early and she treats her customers with kindness and courtesy; most of her customers are her neighbors with whom she has a relationship of friendship and respect.

Her store has been in operation for just six months.  She usually tends to it by herself but occasionally her spouse helps her.  She likes her business because it allows her to stay home and participate in her children’s school activities and at home.  Also, the income she earns helps her cover her family’s basic expenses.

Seeing the good results it’s had to date, she wants to expand the business and offer more products.  This is her second Kiva loan and she’s very happy to know that she has financial support because she feels more confident about advancing with her work that way.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.

She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy larger amounts of various products and groceries like rice, sugar and milk, among others.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es: Paquita, de 58 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, es divorciada y tiene 9 hijos pero actualmente solo vive en con uno de sus hijos en su casa propia. El trabajo de Paquita consiste en la compra y venta de plátanos y diversos granos como maíz, fríjol, soya y otros de acuerdo a la temporada. Todos los días ella se levanta muy temprano para dirigirse al puerto principal de la ciudad para conseguir los productos que luego pone a la venta en el mismo lugar o en ocasiones vende al menudeo en su hogar. Considera que su trabajo es muy rentable porque sus ganancias son muy buenas. Lleva en ésta actividad cerca de 07 años y siempre a trabajado con apoyo de sus hijos o en ocasiones con la ayuda de algunos colaboradores quienes cargan los racimos de plátano o los pesados sacos de granos. Este es su noveno crédito con Kiva, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que le brindan para seguir con su negocio razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles comprará sacos de maiz y racimos de plátano al por mayor para seguir con su actividad laboral.
texts.en:
Paquita, 58, is a hardworking woman who very much wants to improve.  She’s divorced and has nine children but only one of them still lives with her in her own house.  Paquita’s work consists in buying and selling bananas and various grains like corn, beans, soya and others according to the season.  

She rises very early every day to head to the city’s main port to get the products that she then puts up for sale in the same place or sometimes she sells them at retail at home.  She considers her work to be very profitable because her profits are very good.  She’s been in this business for about 7 years and has always worked with her children’s support or sometimes with support from some helpers that carry the banana bunches or heavy sacks of grain.

This is her 9th Kiva loan so she’s grateful for the opportunity and trust given her to continue in business which is why she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy sacks of rice and banana bunches at wholesale to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy corn and bananas at wholesale.

loans.name: Magali

texts.es: Magali tiene 27 años, es casada, y vive en casa de su suegro junto a su esposo, sus 3 hijos, además se encarga de cuidar a su suegro. Magali se dedica a la venta de pescado semi-fresco, una actividad que aprendió de su suegro, ya que él se encuentra  débil por la edad que tiene, Magali se encarga del negocio. Gracias al apoyo de su suegro y el de toda su familia en general, pudo salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos. Con los ahorros que obtiene de la venta del pescado pudo comprar un mototaxi para aumentar su capital, siendo este su herramienta de trabajo para salir a repartir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes. Este es el primer crédito con Kiva, y está muy agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido, que le dará el capital para mejorar su negocio y dinamizar sus ventas. El monto de S/.2500.00 lo invertirá en la compra de pescado al por mayor para su negocio.
texts.en:
Magdali is 27 years old, married, and lives in her father-in-law's house with her husband  and three children. She is responsible for looking after her father-in-law as well as selling fish, a job that she learned from her father-in-law when he became too old to run the business. She is now in charge of the business. Thanks to support from her father-in-law and her whole family, she has been able to get ahead and increase income. With savings from selling fish, Magdali was able to buy a motorbike taxi which is now an important part of her business. It enables her to deliver the fish that her customers have ordered.

This is Magdali's first loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for this financial assistance. It will give her the capital she needs to improve her business and increase sales. She plans to use the S/.2500.00 to buy fish at wholesale prices.

loans.use: Buy fish at wholesale prices

loans.name: Panales No 2 Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Panales no 2 está conformado por ocho integrantes, todas madres solteras, responsables con 15 hijos bajo responsabilidad. Ellas son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar sus estudios básicos. Y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad. Y luchan día  a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracia a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante, María Ofelia es la coordinadora del banco comunal y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, aceite, jabón, detergentes, gaseosas, jugos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias. Ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Panales No 2 agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
The Panales No. 2 communal bank is comprised of eight members.  They are all single, responsible women who have 15 children for whom they are responsible.  They are from Sauce, which is located in the northern part of the country.  These women are known for being responsible and hard-working and for having a great desire for personal improvement.  Sadly, due to the lack of financial resources, they could not complete their basic education.  They were obliged to work from an early age.  They struggle day to day in order to give their children a better future.

Thanks to her spirit and her desire to get ahead, María Ofelia is the coordinator of the communal bank.  She has a ‘pulpería’ located in her house.  A ‘pulperia’ is a small store that sells food products in small quantities.  She sells things like packets of coffee, packets of shampoo, rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, cooking oil, soap, detergent, soft drinks, and juice.  She works in her business selling her products about 12 hours a day.

The reason for the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business of buying and selling food products.  She will do this in order to be able to get better income in the near future.

The Panales No. 2 communal bank is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Unidas está conformado por diez mujeres, madres responsables con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias del Sauce, lugar  que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser unas mujeres responsables con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar con sus hijos y le preparan una rica comida típica como “Nacatamales” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron cursar una carrera universitaria, y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Ellas luchan día a día para brindarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor.

Gracia a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante, Nancy tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como. Sobre de café, shampoo, azúcar, jabón, aceite, tiste, huevos, frijoles, pan, leche, jugos, fósforos, cigarros por unidad. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Mujeres Unidas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank has ten members; responsible mothers with 20 children in their care.  They are from El Sauce, a place located in the northern zone of the country.  They are noted for being responsible women with a strong drive towards personal improvement.  In their free time they like to enjoy their children and prepare traditional dishes like Nacatamales [Nicaraguan style tamales].  Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources they were unable to attend university and had to start to work at a young age to help with household expenses.  They strive daily to provide a better future for their children.

Thanks to her spirit and drive to get ahead, Nancy’s economic activity is a home-based ‘pulpería.’  A pulpería is a small store that sells food items in small quantities: envelopes of coffee, shampoo, sugar, soap, oil, herbal tea, eggs, beans, bread, milk, juice, matches and cigarettes by the unit.  She spends 12 hours daily at work selling her products.   The loan’s objective is to invest in working capital and stock the store with the purchase and sale of food items so that in the not too distant future she can earn higher income.

The Mujeres Unidas communal bank is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide for people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua in order to have ways of earning a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Patty

texts.es:
Patty, de 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo pequeño con quien vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Patty consiste en la venta de ropa, por está razón se encarga de viajar a otra ciudad para comprar las prendas al por mayor seleccionando una a una la ropa de mejor calidad para luego venderlos en forma ambulatoria a precios totalmente cómodos , estás ventas por lo general lo realiza en poco tiempo, el plazo para el pago de las prendas lo coordina con sus clientes brindando siempre las comodidades necesarias y el tiempo prudente para continuar comprando nuevas prendas. Lleva en éste trabajo 09 años y desde que empezó a logrado obtener algunas cosas materiales que siempre a deseado. Del mismo modo, hace 03 años ha incursionado en el negocio de la decoración para fiestas infantiles, en ésta actividad trabaja con ayuda de otra señora y juntas realizan los diseños más creativos que se exhiben en cada fiesta en donde soliciten sus servicios.
Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que en ambos puede poner en práctica su don innegable de relacionarse con las personas y desarrollar su creatividad , en el futuro espera poder concretar su sueño de tener su propia tienda de ropas y continuar con su desarrollo económico. Este es el séptimo crédito con Kiva y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante con su negocio, razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería conformada por ropas para damas , caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Patty, 33, is married and has a little son living with her in her own house.  Patty’s work consists in selling clothes.  Because of this she travels to another city to buy her items at wholesale choosing better quality clothes to then resell from place to place at affordable prices.  Her sales take place quickly as a rule and she sets up payment plans with her customers always giving them the necessary allowances and prudent time so they will continue to buy new clothes.  

She’s been in this business for nine years and since she started she’s been able to obtain some of the material things she’s always wanted. In the same way, three years ago she went into the children’s party decoration business. In this activity she works with another lady and together they make the most creative designs that are then displayed in each party where their services are requested.

She likes her work very much because she can put into practice her undeniable gift for relating to people and developing her creativity in both of them.  In future she hopes to reach her goal of having her own clothing store and to continue developing economically.

This is her 7th Kiva loan and she’s very happy to know that she has financial support that will make it possible for her to continue forward with her business which is why she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy larger amounts of merchandise consisting of clothes for women, men and children.

loans.use: to buy clothes for men, women and children.

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga María de 45 años de edad, madre soltera con tres hijos que están bajo su responsabilidad, estudia en la Universidad y en secundaria. Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta mucho disfrutar en familia les prepara platos típico de la región como “güirilas con cuajadas” ella lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracia a  su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una librería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Actividad a la que dedica unas 9 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su librería con productos como: cuadernos, lapiceros, libretas, grapas, folder, papel crepe, remas de carta, legal, borradores, libros, cuentos, broches de archivo entre otros. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Olga María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Olga María, 45, is a single mother of three children in her care; they attend university and secondary school.  She’s noted for being hardworking and responsible with a drive towards personal improvement.  In her free time she very much enjoys spending time with her family and she prepares a traditional dish for them like “güirilas con cuajadas” [soft corn cake with cheese or cream].  She strives daily to provide a better future for her children.

Thanks to her spirit and drive to get ahead her economic activity is a stationery shop located at home.  She spends about 9 hours daily selling her products.  The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital to stock her shop with products like notebooks, pencils, copy books, staples, folders, crepe paper, reams of letter and legal size paper, erasers, books, stories, file clips, etc. so that in the not too distant future she can earn higher income.

Olga María is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide for people of scarce resources and for poor countries like Nicaragua so that ways of earning a living with dignity are possible.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her stationery shop.

loans.name: Vamos En Victoria Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Vamos en Victoria está conformado por nueve integrantes, madres solteras con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Ellas se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  Que luchan día a día para bríndales un futuro mejor, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron estudiar y tuvieron que trabajar desde temprana edad.
La coordinadora del banco comunal es Melania y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como  café, arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos. Ella dedica a su actividad unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir  su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles. El banco comunal agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para brindarles un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
The community bank, Vamos en Victoria, is made up of nine members, all single mothers responsible for their twenty children. They are from Sauce in the north part of the country. All are hardworking and responsible with a great desire to get ahead. They struggle on a daily basis to make a better future; sadly, because of a lack of financial resources, they couldn't attend school and had to start work at a young age.

The community bank coordinator is Melania who runs a 'pulpería' out of her house. A pulpería is a small store selling food products in small quantities such as coffee, rice, beans, oil, sugar, bread, milk, and eggs. She works about 12 hours a day in the store. Melania is seeking a loan to use as working capital to buy more food products as stock for the store.

The community bank is grateful for the assistance provided by Kiva donors to low-income people from poor countries such as Nicaragua and providing them with a better future.

loans.use: Buy food products such as coffee, rice, beans, oil, sugar, bread, milk, and eggs

loans.name: Nuestros Lirios De Los Valles Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuestros Lirios de los Valles está conformado por doce integrantes, madres solteras responsables de 27 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas son originarias del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser mujeres trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar, por falta de recursos económicos y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde muy temprana edad.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante Corina es la coordinadora del banco y  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, una  pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles  y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, arroz, azúcar, leche, pan, frijoles, azúcar, detergente, jabón, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles como, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Nuestros lirios de los valles agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nuestros Lirios de los Valles is made up of 12 members, single mothers responsible for 27 children under their care.

They are originally from Sauce, a place that is located in the north of the country. It is known for its hardworking, responsible women, with hopes of succeeding. Unfortunately they could not study because of lack of financial resources and they were forced to work from an early age.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead Carina is the coordinator of the communal bank and she has as her economic activity a pulpería. A pulpería is a small store that sells groceries in small amounts such as coffee, rice, sugar, milk, bread, beans, detergent, soap, juice, and soda. She devotes about 12 hours daily to her business selling her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and supply her business for buying and selling groceries so that in the near future she can increase her profits. 

The communal bank Nuestros Lirios de los Valles is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders offer to people with limited means, in poor countries such as Nicaragua, to have decent sources of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her store for buying and selling of groceries such as coffee, rice, sugar, milk, bread, beans, detergents, soap, juice, and soda.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazón de Jesús está conformado por ocho integrantes, seis mujeres y dos hombres. Madres y padres responsables con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originario del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del  país. Se caracterizan por ser responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal. Los cuales luchan día  a día para brindarle un futuro mejor.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante Melida del Socorro  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería que es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles  y en cantidades pequeñas como frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, jugos, gaseosas, tiste, detergente, fosforo, consomé. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The “Corazón de Jesús” (Heart of Jesus) communal bank has 8 members; six women and two men.  They are responsible mothers and fathers with 15 children they are responsible for.  They are from El Sauce, a place located in the northern part of the country.  They are noted for being responsible and hardworking and with the drive for personal improvement.  They strive daily to provide a better future.

Thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead, Melida del Socorro’s economic activity is a ‘pulpería,’ which is a small store that sells food items like beans, sugar, oil, soap, juice, soft-drinks, herbal tea, detergent, matches and consommé in small amounts.  She spends about 12 hours daily selling her products, an activity she does happily.

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock the store purchasing items to sell so that in the not too distant future she will be able to earn higher income. The Corazón de Jesús communal bank is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide for people of scarce resources and for poor countries like Nicaragua so that ways of earning a living with dignity are possible.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: El Mana Group

texts.es:
EL Mana está conformado por 12 integrantes once mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables con 25 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Ellos se caracterizan por ser personas responsables, trabajadoras con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar en familia. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria por falta de recursos económicos.
Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante Yolanda  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, sobre de consomé, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, ellas dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal EL mana agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
“El Maná” (Manna) has 12 members: 11 women and one man, all responsible mothers and fathers with 25 children in their care.  They are from El Sauce, a place located in the north of the country.  They are noted for being responsible, hardworking people who very much want to get ahead.  They enjoy spending their free time with their families.  Unfortunately she was unable to attend university due to the lack of economic resources.

Thanks to her spirit and drive to get ahead, Yolanda’s economic activity is a home-based ‘pulpería.’  A pulpería is a small store that sells food items in small amounts like envelopes of coffee, envelopes of shampoo, envelopes of consomme, rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread and eggs.  She spends about 12 hours daily selling her products.

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her store with items to sell so that in the not too distant future she can earn higher income.  The El Maná communal bank thanks Kiva lenders for the support they provide for people of scarce resources and for poor countries like Nicaragua so that dignified ways of earning a living are possible.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: David Salomon

texts.es: El señor David, es un hombre que ha venido desempeñándose en diferentes labores, para cubrir los gastos del hogar, ayudar a sus hijos y esposa, en la actualidad solamente él trabaja como albañil y solador, su esposa  ama de casa, por lo que todos dependen de él, su mayor deseo es terminar de construir su casita para garantizar la seguridad de sus hijos. Con este crédito que solicita levantara paredes de la cocina que está cubierta de laminas de zinc lo cual no es nada seguro y cuando llueve se  filtra el agua al interior, por lo que le urge hacer esta mejora para el bienestar de la familia.
texts.en:
David is a man who has put forth a great deal of effort in different types of jobs in order to cover his household expenses and help his wife and children.  Currently he is the only family member who is working outside the home. He is working laying bricks and laying tile.  His wife is a homemaker, so the entire family depends on him.  His greatest wish is to finish the construction of his little house so that he can guarantee the security of his children.  

With the proceeds from this loan he will build walls around his kitchen.  Currently there are walls made from laminated zinc sheeting, which does not provide security.  Further, when it rains, water leaks into the house.  For this reason it is urgent that he make these improvements for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, steel, concrete blocks, sand and stones.

loans.name: Claudia Mercedes

texts.es:
Claudia de 43 años de edad, madres soltera con un de 18 años  el cual está terminando sus estudios de secundaria. Ella es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar mucho de la compañia de su hijo y pasar tiempo de calidad con él. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, por falta de recursos económicos,  Y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos y perfumes, actividad que la desempeña de forma ambulante cargando un bulto de unos 20 kg para poder distribuir su mercadería a clientes fijos y eventuales. Ella dedica a su actividad unas 8 horas diaria, ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su mercadería con productos como: sombras de ojos, rubor, lápiz labial, lápiz de ojos, perfumes, crema de cuerpo, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Claudia agradece la ayuda de los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Claudia, 43, is a single mother of an 18-year-old who is finishing high school.  She’s from León, a place located in the west of the country.  She’s noted for being hardworking and responsible with a strong drive towards self-improvement.  She very much enjoys spending her free time with her son and spending quality time with him.  Unfortunately, she was unable to attend university for lack of economic resources and she had to start working at a young age.

Thanks to her effort and drive to get ahead her economic activity is selling cosmetics and perfume, an activity she carries out from place to place carrying a bundle that weighs about 20 kilos to sell her wares to regular and occasional customers.  She spends about 8 hours daily at work.  

The loan’s objective is to invest in working capital to stock up on such things as eye shadow, blush, lipstick, eyeliner, perfume and body creams so that in the not too distant future she will be able to earn higher income.  Claudia thanks Kiva lenders for their support of people of scarce resources so they can have a dignified way of earning a living.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Cristobla Evaristo

texts.es: El señor Cristobal hombre humilde, trabajador, se ha dedicado toda su vida a trabajar la tierra, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa e hijos, su esposa le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que es comerciante, vende frutas y verduras, el por su parte se dedica al cuido de sus cosecha actualmente tiene una manzana de Piña cultivada, la cual requiere de Mantenimiento  con este credito comprara los insumos y Fertilizantes necesarios como: Triple, Completo, Urea etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Cristobal is a humble and hardworking man who has dedicated his whole life to working the land.  He lives in municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife and children.  His wife is a merchant who sells fruits and vegetables, and she supports him in the household expenses. For his part, he cares for his crops and currently is growing approximately two and a half acres of pineapple, which need maintenance.

With the loan proceeds he will buy supplies as well as necessary fertilizers, such as "Triple", "Completo" as well as urea for his crops.  He is grateful from the support that Afodenic and Kiva have brought him.

loans.use: to maintain his pineapple crops.

loans.name: Francis Arelis

texts.es: La señora Francis habita en el municipio de Masaya junto a su familia, su mayor sueño es terminar de construir su casa y mejorar sus condicones de vida, su mayor dificultad es que no puede recaudar de una sola vez el dinero para la compra de Materiales, ya siempre se le presentan inconvenientes  y utiliza el dinero para sufragar otros gastos, su compañero le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que es comerciante, ella trabaja como domestica para una  casa privada, con este financiamiento que se le ha otorgado comprara. Perlines, Zinc, Golosos, Cemento etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado al darle esta nueva oportunidad
texts.en: Francis lives with her family in the town of Masaya. Her biggest dream is to finish building her house and improve her living conditions. Her main difficulty is that she can't raise the money to buy construction supplies all at once, since she always faces drawbacks and uses the money to pay for other expenses. Her partner helps her afford the household expenses, since he's a merchant. She works as a housekeeper for a private residence. With this loan she has received she'll purchase nails, zinc, screws, cement, etc. She gives thanks for the support that Afodenic and Kiva have provided by giving her this new opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
EL banco comunal Los Ángeles está conformado por once integrantes diez mujeres y un hombre. Originario de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de  occidente del país. Ellos se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron terminar sus estudios básicos, y se dedicaron a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante Aleida es la coordinadora del banco comunal Los Ángeles  tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva variada como pantalones, blusas, faldas, short, vestidos, ropa de cama, pillamas, toallas, ropa interior. El  negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su actividad unas 10 horas diarias, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Los Ángeles agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Los Angeles communal bank is made up of eleven members: ten women and one man. It originates in Malpaisillo, which is located in the west of the country. The members are all hard-working and responsible and strive for self-improvement. Unfortunately, because of lack of economic resources, they have not been able to finish their basic education and they have been working from an early age in order to help with their household expenses.

Due to her hard work and her will to get ahead, Aleida is the coordinator of the Los Angeles communal bank. For her occupation, she sells a variety of new clothing, such as pants, blouses, skirts, shorts, dresses, sleepwear, pyjamas, towels and undergarments. Her business is located in the house where she lives. She spends about 10 hours a day working and really enjoys her business. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business buying and selling merchandise, so that she can obtain a better income in the near future. 

The Los Angeles community bank is grateful for the aid that Kiva's investors provide to people with few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua in order for them to have a means of respectable work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock merchandise in various clothing such as pants, blouses, skirts, shorts, dresses, nightwear, pyjamas, towels and undergarments.

loans.name: Pahhoi Lom Group

texts.en:
Vanlalngak belongs to “Pahhoi” Group, and she is the featured borrower member. She is pictured on the extreme left with her hand raised. All the members of the group live in a village which is in Manipur, one of the northeastern states of India.

Vanlalngak and her husband work side by side to manage the family expenses. Her husband is a contractual driver for big wheels, and his income entirely depends on the number of days he works/drives. Therefore, his income is unreliable and meager. 

Understanding the financial condition, Vanlalngak started raising pigs. At the initial stages of her piggery business, she built a sty with the help of her husband at the back of their house, and purchased two piglets. She said she already tried her hand in various income-generating businesses like selling charcoal, selling vegetables, and weaving. But she failed because she cannot combine her outdoor business with the household chores.

Vanlalngak chose to raise pigs, and she is doing great with her piggery farm. She raised pigs in a very economical way by collecting leftover foods from neighbours and also from the neighbouring villages. She also searches for edible grass in the nearby fields and farms for pig feed. The foods are then cooked with powdered rice grain. The rice grain is bought from the rice mill at a cheaper rate. Once the pigs are fully grown and ready to be sold, she usually sells them in the village and neighbouring villages. She also bought a used two-wheeler Scooty (scooter) from the income that she generated from selling pigs. 

With the Kiva loan, she is planning to purchase chicks and start raising poultry besides raising pigs. She said her huge backyard should be utilized, and it should be of good use for raising poultry, too. Her interest in raising chicks started because pigs can be sold only once in a year, and if she can raise chickens, she can sell them after a time period of three months. She speculates she can sell poultry four times in a year, and is hopeful to be successful with her poultry.

She thanked WSDS strongly and says her husband’s love and respect grows more with the ability to share family financial issues. “The bond is stronger and the family’s burden is lighter with both of us sharing.” She thanked Kiva and WSDS once again for all the support and assistance.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, raise them, and sell them for profit when fully grown.

loans.name: Farolitos Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento FAROLITOS está  compuesto por ocho  integrantes todas mujeres,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Carmen tiene 34 años y 4 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, la Sra. Carmen tiene la actividad de venta de accesorios y piezas de repuesto para movilidad desde hace ya bastante tiempo tiene su tienda de accesorios que se encuentra en la zona de Villa Adela de la ciudad de el Alto, en este lugar es muy concurrido por choferes que realizan el mantenimiento de sus vehículos, este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Carmen va a usar este préstamo para la compra de repuestos para surtir su tienda   y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias, la Sra. Carmen va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando accesorios y repuestos para su movilidad,   la Sra. Carmen es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The "Farolitos" communal bank is comprised of eight members, all of whom are women. The communal bank president is Carmen. She's 34 years old and has four school age children. Carmen has been selling accessories and spare parts for vehicles for quite some time. She owns an accessory store which is located in the Villa Adela area of the town of El Alto. This spot attracts a great number of drivers who wish to upkeep their vehicles. This is her first loan with the institution. Carmen will use this loan to purchase spare parts in order to stock her store, and that way she'll provide better service for her customers and increase her profits. Carmen will use her earnings to continue buying accessories and spare parts for vehicles. Carmen is a very hard-working person. She feels happy for the opportunity that she and her fellow group members have received, since in some cases they support their families all by themselves.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts by wholesale.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for more than eight years now. She works with her husband in tilling their farm.

Anastacia is a asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to grow and improve her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador raises hogs within his locality. He is really thankful because, through his hard work and patience, he was able to sustain his family's necessities and support his children's education. Aside from hog-raising, he also engages in a farming business wherein he cultivates his 1.5-hectare rice field. Dominador didn't stop believing that someday he could be a successful entrepreneur.

For his goal to be realized, he is seeking a loan of PHP 20,000. He will use this loan for buying necessary livestock supplies, such as hog feed and essential vaccine to make his hogs healthier upon reaching their optimum growth. Dominador is hoping that his livestock business will continue to grow smoothly.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and essential vaccine to raise his hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase land for farming.

loans.name: Rudy Cesar

texts.es:
Rudy,  requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de granos básicos; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y arrendamiento de terreno.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a obtener la cosecha deseada, aunque tuvo contratiempos logro obtener ganancias; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Rudy wishes to get a new loan, because he needs more working capital in order to keep on investing in his basic grains crops. This will allow him to purchase compost, herbicide, pesticide and insecticide, and to pay for the rent on the land.
The previous loan helped him to obtain the harvest that he wished for. Even though he faced drawbacks, he succeded in turning a profit; his financial conditions and his family's situation have improved.

loans.use: to purchase compost, herbicide, pesticide and insecticide, and to pay for the rent on the land.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
This is Minerva. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise to increase her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Minerva dreams her business stays and hopes to have a peaceful life. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy all the needed grocery items for her variety store. The loan also helped in the education of her children and in their household education. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marilyn dreams that her business will expand and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is 30 years old. He lives in Vejini village, in the Gurjaani district with his 25 year-old wife, retired grandfather, and 3 year-old daughter. Shalva requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The main source of the family is Shalva’s monthly salary. He works at the Georgian bread bakery. Their additional income is Shalva’s grandfather’s monthly pension. The total amount is 500 GEL and it’s rarely enough to cover food expenses. 

Shalva requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Shalva has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Shalva will start trading with vegetables. He will buy at the wholesale price to resell with a price mark-up among the villagers and at the local markets. Shalva is very hard working man. He wants to improve his family living conditions and for this he will work as hard as he can.  Part of the profit he will reinvest in the same field to expand the business and another part to purchase household products for the family.

loans.use: to start up a vegetable trading business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a forty-two year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is fish farming along side operating a retail shop to boost his income. He has a vision of educating his children to higher levels of learning although he is facing hardships of bad weather and theft. 

Paul intends to use the loan to add a new fish in the pond and buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: to add a new fish in the pond and buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Loidah

texts.en:
Loida is a 34 year-old single mother in her second loan cycle applying for a loan of UGX 1,500,000. In the first cycle, she borrowed UGX 1,000,000 that she used to expand her business’ working capital and was able to pay back the loan in time. 

She operates a small retail shop along the streets of the city dealing in babies’ items. Her clients are mothers and fathers that purchase their babies’ clothes and other necessities.

She rents a double-roomed house that she occupies with her daughter in the outskirts of the city.

The future plan and purpose of the loan is to again expand her business since her dream is to see it grow so big to an extent of being able to import the stock dierctly.

loans.use: To buy baby items to sell

loans.name: Zephanus

texts.en: Zephanus is a 48 year-old married man who has seven children. He has been in the tailoring business for a while but also has rentals, coffee, and pig businesses to earn additional income.  The high cost of raw materials and customers not paying on time are his major challenges, while his dream is to own a fashion house.  Zephanus is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new stock like sugar, rice and  bathing soap  to sell.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
This is Crisanta. She previously accessed an 23,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Crisanta hopes to expand her business and dreams of improving their living conditions. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Dolor

texts.en:
This is Dolor. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase additional supplies of pork and chicken. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 35,000 PHP, to pay for additional supplies of pork and chicken. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dolor dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies of pork and chicken.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has two children. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. She has been doing this work for five years. 

She stated “feeding animals” is what is most enjoyable about farming. Her biggest challenge is “getting animal feed.” Animals on the farm have been given the names of “Shiroo.”

Alice was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, “They have agricultural products.” Alice was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session and replied, “savings.”

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, “How will this loan benefit your family?”, Alice replied, “I will get money to pay school fees.”

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Alice owns a cow, pig, poultry, and bicycle, but does not own a pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, TV, and DVD, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a thirty-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is running a salon and a video library. He has a dream of educating his children to higher levels of education and improving on his business. He is facing hardships of increased competition and electricity inefficiency, which hinders his business growth. His dream is to own a beauty parlour.

Patrick is requesting a loan to buy machines and cosmetics for the salon.

loans.use: to buy machines and cosmetics for his salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos, vive en casa propia,  actualmente solo con sus dos hijos, ellos ya están grandes y se valen por si solos.  Ella, se dedica a la venta de comida, el oficio lo aprendió y lo realiza por la necesidad de adquirir ingresos en un local que compro, ya que su compañero de vida murió y no tiene ayuda de nadie.
