El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar productos necesarios para la comida tales como: carnes, pollo, verduras, condimentos, entre otros, para la elaboracion de alimentos; esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos y  aumentar la clientela.
Su sueño es tener una mejor calidad de vida y buena salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Santos lives in her own house, currently just with her two children - they are already grown-up, and take care of themselves. Santos works selling food, a job she learnt and does because she needs to have an income, at a premises she bought, because her life partner died and she doesn't have help from anyone. 

The loan she needs will allow her to buy products she needs for the food such as: meat, chicken, vegetables, condiments, among other things, to make the food. This investment will help her improve her income and grow her customer base. 

Her dream is to have a better quality of life and good health so she can keep working.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, condiments, among other things.

loans.name: Ma. Martina

texts.en:
Ma. Martina is a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is 50 years old and happily married to Alberto, who works as a tricycle driver. God blessed them with loving children and only one remains studying. She and her husband are helping each other in working so they can give their family a good future.

Ma. Martina owns a computer shop. These computer shops are rented for Php 20.00 per hour. Still, some families don’t have their own computers so they go to computer shops to encode and print documents. Others rent to connect with their loved ones abroad, and others, especially the children and the youth, rent to play games. Normally, computer shops open at 8am and close at 7pm. Her regular customers are the children and youth of their community. She earns Php 400.00 a day.

She is requesting Php 25,000 that she will use to buy new units of computers and maintain the other units that she has.

Just as any other business owners, she is also hoping that her shop will continue to expand and have more customers and branches. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
This is Lita. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 13,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.


Lita hopes that her business will continue to grow and will be able to help her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet used the previous loan to pay school fees for herself. She is a 37-year-old single mother living in Kasese, Uganda. For 15 years she has been a social worker. With her savings she has been able to begin a transportation business by buying motorcycles. The high rate of mechanical breakdowns and high fuel prices affect her business growth. 

She is a good mother who is determined to change her future and her child's future through education. Juliet intends to use the loan to pay school fees for herself.

loans.use: to pay school fees for herself.

loans.name: Danelia

texts.es:
Doña Danelia con 50 años de edad no deja de soñar en grande y de seguir adelante con sus proyectos propuesto a alcanzar mientras tenga vida, salud muchas fuerzas. Ella no pudo estudiar en su juventud ya que sus padres de escasos recursos no pudieron ayudarla. Ella es casada y con una numerosa familia compuesta por 10 hijos de los cuales 4 dependen aun de ella y están estudiando en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación. Ella es agricultora desde toda su vida ya que sus padres le inculcaron desde pequeña esta actividad en lo que es café, maíz y frijoles.

Ella solicita a COMIXMUL un apoyo para la compra de insumos que puedan mejorar su cosecha en general desde la raíz hasta el grano para obtener una ganancia total sobre ella. 

Sus planes son los de poder mejorar sus cultivos para obtener ganancias netas re invertirlas y salir de su compromiso para así mismo poder seguir gozando de los beneficios que nuestra institución da para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Danelia at 50-years-old does not stop having big dreams or continuing forward with her proposed projects while she still has life, health and lots of strength. She was not able to study in her youth because her parents had scare resources and were not able to help her. She is married with a large family comprised of 10 children, 4 of which depend on her help and study in elementary school in different grades. 

She has been a farmer of coffee, corn, and beans for her entire life because her parents trained her on this activity since she was very young. 

She is requesting help from Comixmul to purchase supplies that will improve her yield from root to grain in order to obtain a better income. Her plans is to have better crops to obtain a better net income, invest, and then complete her compromise in order to continue having a good time with the benefits of the institution that helps her to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her crops

loans.name: Rudy Antonio

texts.es:
Rudy, vive con su compañera de vida, disfruta de dos hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad. El, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como: maíz y frijol, el oficio lo realiza desde hace 15 años, lo lleva a cabo todos los días de 7:00am a 3:00pm y lo aprendió de sus padres, por el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas entre otros, para llevar a cabo la siembra; esta inversión le ayudara tener los materiales agrícolas en el momento oportuno. 
Su sueño es ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios y que no les falte la alimentación.
texts.en:
Rudy lives with his life partner and has two children aged 4 and 6 years old. 

He works growing basic grains such as maize and beans. He has been doing this work for 15 years and does it everyday from 7am till 3pm. He learnt it from his parents. At the moment he's having no trouble. 

The loan he requires will allow him to buy the farming supplies he needs such as: fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, pest-control substances, and insecticides among other things, to carry out the sowing. This investment will help him to have the farming materials at the right time. 

His dream is to help his children with their studies and make sure they don't go hungry.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, pest-control substances, insecticides, among others.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa como pantalones,polos y chompas,la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de realizar servicios de llamadas,la socia se dedica a este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar polos,chompas y pantalones.

La socia se encuentra contenta por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
This member keeps working in her business selling clothes such as pants, shirts and sweaters. She also keeps working in her business providing calling services. She has had this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell clothes. She is asking for the loan to buy shirts, sweaters and pants. 

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments on time. She is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy shirts, sweaters and pants.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik has been engaged in farming and agriculture for about ten years. He has a plot of land and a small farm where he has sixteen cows and nineteen chickens. All the products (meat, milk, and eggs) Andranik sells at the Kapan wholesale market to re-sellers.

Andranik lives in the small city Kapan with his wife and three school-aged sons. Andranik’s wife helps him in their farming activities very much. They do their best to have some more income and better living conditions for their family. They need a loan of 300.000 Armenian drams for the organization of hay gathering activities.

loans.use: to help with the organization of hay gathering activities.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana, age 37, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns furniture shop, which is the only source of income for the family. 

Rukhsana is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase wood for manufacturing furniture. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. 

Rukhsana hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase wood for manufacturing furniture.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a graduate and is a married woman in her second cycle applying for Ugx 1,500,000. She has a small boutique business that operates along the streets of the city for survival since she lost her job in a commercial bank. Her husband is also unemployed, despite having completed their studies together in the same university.

The purpose of the loan is to add more stock to her business so that she can be able to support her family without any difficulty.

She has a dream of working so hard towards going back to university for a Master's degree.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sonia Luzmila

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 24 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Cañete en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Sonia pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta preparar deliciosos postres y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Verde para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Sonia trabaja como auxiliar en el área contable de una empresa comercial de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Sonia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar diversos materiales para la construcción de una habitación en su hogar, ya que actualmente ella y su familia comparten un mismo cuarto, de esta manera Sonia y su familia podrán tener mayor bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ascender profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 24-year-old single woman who lives in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial with her parents and siblings. She is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person, who has a great desire for self-improvement. Thanks to her effort and the support of her parents, Sonia was able to study for a professional accounting degree. In her spare time, she likes making delicious desserts and sometimes she cooks a really tasty Green Rice to share with her family. 

On her own initiative and with a lot of determination and dedication, Sonia works as an accounting assistant in a commercial business in her city. She works everyday for about 10 hours and believes she is doing well because of her good performance and because of the kind way she treats others.

Sonia is really grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have offered she will be able to make improvements to her house. She wants to buy different materials for the construction of a room in her house, because at the moment she and her family share the same room. In this way, Sonia and her family will have a greater sense of wellbeing and so she will keep working and striving to achieve her greatest dream of moving up the job ladder.

loans.use: to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
It has already been five years that Armen, in the small city of Kapan, has been engaged in cultivating vegetable crops. He has a very big rented land for a period of 25 years.

Armen has higher education; he graduated from the Yerevan State University Physical Department. He is married and his wife is unemployed. They have one daughter. Armen works also at the Municipality of Srashen village.

Armen has a small greenhouse for which he needs to buy manure and fertilizer, and he asks for a loan of 200.000 Armenian drams. He hopes that his first cooperation with Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon will bring good profit in the future.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for his greenhouse.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra, age 42, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a shoe shop in the main market. He wants to purchase some shoe making material but, due to insufficient savings, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Azra is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase leather, rexine, gum, and nails for making shoes. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. They are going through serious financial issues, but Azra hopes that their living conditions get better with the passage of time. 

She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase leather, rexine, gum, and nails for making shoes.

loans.name: Kajik

texts.en:
Kajik has a private truck, which he has bought with the help of his own savings and from time to time, he provides private freight delivery for his villagers and neighbors. Kajik and his family live in the village of Aknaghbyur, which is in the Tavush region. He lives with his wife, children and retired mother. Near their house, they have a plot of land and Kajik and his wife cultivate some vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers and some greens) for their family's use. Kajik is a very hard-working man. He has worked in their village at the gas service and he used to work as a driver, after which he was a worker. For several years, Kajik has gone to the Russian Federation to work abroad. All these prove that Kajik does everything for his family’s well being. 

Kajik needs a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy tires for his car and to do some technical repair on his car.

loans.use: To buy tires and repair his car

loans.name: Vergine

texts.en:
To tackle financial hardships, Vergine grows apricot, peach, apple, and pear trees on two hectares area, and also cultivates tomatoes. She has been with this business for 16 years and is able to earn income for covering her family’s basic costs.

Vergine lives with her husband and son. In order to enlarge her farming business (which is the main source of family's income) she's asking for a loan. With the help of the loan, Vergine will be able to renovate her old greenhouse and purchase seeds and fertilizer, which is very important for successful land cultivation.

The loan is important for Vergine to increase the cultivation of fruits and vegetable and gather more income, which is vital for improving her family's life.
Vergine's most important dream is to earn a high enough income to provide her son with everything.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse and purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of one son. She is involved in the business of ‘waan’ manufacturing. Waan is a thread-like material that is used to make a bedstead of wooden frame on four legs. She offers various types of waan in different colors and is famous for providing good quality material in her locality. 

Samina operates the machine at home with the help of her husband. They are contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. For the improvement of her business, she applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy another waan-making machine to provide good quality thread. She hopes to get an increase in her sales, which will help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to buy another waan-making machine.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is 38 years old and a mother of four children. For the past three years Shamshad has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her children to school for further studies. 

She has some savings and applied a loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase another buffalo. She is in her 4th loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She is hopeful to get an increase in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 33-year-old married woman. She has four children - three daughters and one son. She is striving hard to meet their demands including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a factory but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 

She started her business of sewing clothes to contribute in the family income. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. She enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. To meet the demands of her customers she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy a new sewing machine along with stock of threads in different colours. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine along with stock of threads in different colours.

loans.name: Margrait

texts.en: Margrait is a 29-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two children. She has been running a business of clothes sales of Christian bridal dresses for many years. She initiated her own business to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. She purchases Christian bridal dresses in bulk from the market then sells them to the people of her community. Because of her good quality fabric, the demand is increasing day by day. So, she applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy more dresses in different designs, colours, and sizes. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with Kashf foundation. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her children.

loans.use: to buy more dresses in different designs, colours, and sizes.

loans.name: Ederzon Roberto

texts.es:
Ederson es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Ederzon se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Chicharrón de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Ederzon trabaja como vendedor en un centro de ventas de equipos celulares, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Ederzon se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir sus gastos de estudios, como pago de matrícula, compra de libros y materiales de estudios, de esta manera Ederzon podrá cursar adecuadamente sus estudios, así pues el seguirá trabajando y estudiando para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Ederson is a 22-year-old man, is single, and lives in the city of Inca in the district of Parcona with his parents and his siblings. He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great dream to get ahead. Thanks to his effort and the support of his parents, Ederzon finds himself studying the professional career of Business Administration that he likes. In his free time he likes to play soccor with his friends and sometimes he cooks a delicious Chicharrón de Pollo (traditional dish with rice, beans, and fried chicken) to share with his family.

From his own initiative, with a lot of determination and dedication, Ederzon works as a salesman of cellular equipment in a sales center. He works everyday from early in the morning for about 10 hours. He thinks that he does well because of his good performance and because of the friendly attitude that he has towards others. 

Ederzon is very grateful for the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help provided he will be able to cover the costs of his studies such as matriculation fees, book purchases, and study materials. This way he can continue to work and study to achieve his big dream to become a professional.

loans.use: to cover the costs of his studies

loans.name: Phila-Minthe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe PHILA-MINTHE est composé de trois personnes qui sont des cohabitantes. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Philaminthe(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 30 ans. Philaminthe a très peu fréquenté l’école. Philaminthe est mariée à un certain Jean-Marie. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Philaminthe vit avec son enfant et son mari. Philaminthe et son mari assurent ensemble les charges familiales.  Pour ce faire, Philaminthe vend des tissus par la méthode de distribution depuis quatre ans. Philaminthe  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Philaminthe sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe PHILA-MINTHE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The PHILA-MINTHE group is made up of three members who live in the same house.  The group's representative, named Philaminthe, is 30 years old.  She is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  

Philaminthe only attended school for a very short period of time.  She is married to a man named Jean-Marie.  Philaminthe and Jean-Marie have one child who goes to school and is their dependent.  Philaminthe lives with her husband and her child and jointly takes care of the household expenses with her husband.

In order to contribute to the expenses of the family, Philaminthe has been selling fabrics through the distribution system for four years.  She buys her merchandise at a market located in Benin.

Eager to satisfy the needs of her customers, and also to increase her turnover and income, she is requesting a first loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the PHILA-MINTHE group.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul, 44 years old, is married with four children, all of whom are in school. He acquired a loan of UGX 1,000.000=. He trades in coffee at Kirembe in rural Ishaka. He also trades in cattle to get some additional income. His business started in 2008 with challenges but as of now it has stabilized and he can get an income to support his family and pay school fees for his children who are in secondary school. His clients are people from within and around Kirembe-Katenga because he serves as a monopolist. He hopes to expand his business to meet the ever-growing market for the products. He is a committed man who is self-reliant and who freely associates with the local people. He thanks the bank for financial support at reduced interest rates.

loans.use: To buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida, 29, is a married woman. She has been the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her excellent services she has become very famous in her neighborhood. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetic products for her beauty parlor.  That is why she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She is hopeful to increase her customer base soon. With the help of this loan, she will be able to meet the requirements of her parlor, which will help her to generate more income for her family. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Carine

texts.en: Carine is a young Cameroonian, age 20, married with a male kid, age 11 months, living in an urban center. She has been in her business for more than six months, which gives her a bit of experience and stability. This business is successful because it is situated in a commercial area in an urban set up, and Carine has been in it for more than six months. She does not have any other loans, other than this loan, and this is her first loan. This loan will help her to increase her stock by 12 percent and her profit by 29 percent; hence, her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetic products

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is 20 years old and married. She has one child. To earn a living, she makes and sells Samoan crafts, like tanoa [a wooden vessel], samoan tootoo, and woven fine mats. She has been doing this for one year. Eseta has requested a loan to buy pandanus leaves, carving woods, and carving knives. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and for her child's education. She joined SPBD in 2013, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for making Samoan crafts, including pandanus leaves, carving woods, and carving knives.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en: Nasira is a 33-year-old woman and the mother of five children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing, and education. She has been doing a business of carpet manufacturing for the last seven years. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs. By this time, she has become famous in her community for providing good quality carpets. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation. Currently she has requested a loan of 35,000 Pakistani rupees to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her carpet sales.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is a single mom of three children living in Hovtun village. She has been running a farm for many years. Currently, her farm includes 3 cows, 3 goats, pigs and chickens. Narine also cultivates wheat and sells the harvest locally. Narine milks cows and uses it to make cheese and other agricultural products. Over time, she has become famous in her area for providing high-quality milk and milk products, so she is able to cover her children's daily costs.

As agricultural business is the only source of income for Narine, she would like to expand her farm. With this loan, Narine would like to purchase fertilizer and fuel and cover other costs of cultivation. The cultivation of different types of fruits and vegetables will increase her income and Narine will be able to improve her life.

Narine's only dream is to provide her children with a beautiful life, a good education, food and clothing.

loans.use: to pay for ferilizer and fuel and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Ricardo Angel

texts.es:
Ricardo es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, Ricardo no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Chicharrón de Chancho para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Ricardo trabaja como serenazgo para una empresa municipal de su ciudad, el brinda servicios de seguridad ciudadana, adicionalmente tiene una pequeña bodega donde vende abarrotes y algunas bebidas, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de  10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Ricardo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de abarrotes y bebidas para abastecer su bodega, de esta manera Ricardo podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a 22-year-old man, is single, and lives in the city of Pisco with his parents and brothers. He is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with a great desire to get ahead. Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources and for the need to work to support his parents, Ricardo has not been able to study a professional career in law that he wanted to. In his free time he likes to cook a delicious Chicharrón de Chancho (traditional pork dish) to share with his family.

From his own initiative, with determination and dedication, Ricardo works as a security guard for a business in the city. He provides security services in the city. Additionally he has a small store where he sells groceries and some drinks. He works everyday for about 10 hours and he thinks that he does well because of his good performance and because of the friendly attitude that he has towards others. 

Ricardo is very grateful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided he can complete the purchase of greater quantity and variety of grocers and drinks to stock his store. This way Ricardo will be able to serve more clients and continue working and straining himself to complete his dream to have his own home.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and drinks

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La socia Adela se dedica al negocio de venta de biblias,la socia distribuye a las diferentes lugares como templos,colegios entre otros,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene en este negocio 7 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las biblias.La socia solicita el credito para comprar biblias.

La socia esta contenta con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Adela works in a business that sells bibles. The member distributes to the different places such as temples, colleges, and other places. The member works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. The member has had this business for 7 years and she does very well. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell bibles. The member requests a loan to purchase bibles.

The member is happy with the loan and promises to complete her quota.

loans.use: to purchase bibles

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a 37-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Azra has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Azra is very much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is single man of 36 years. He has one child and also supports his parents and siblings, financially. He practices mixed farming and has been in this business for five years. He earns a monthly income of 18,000 Kenyan shillings.

This will be Samuel's second loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy three mother pigs. In future, he wants to have a greenhouse.

loans.use: To buy three mother pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Asuman

texts.en:
Asuman is a forty-one-year old first-time borrower applying for a 1,500,000 UGX loan. He has a wife and four children that he lives with in the unfinished house that he managed to get after getting some revenue from a rental unit. On top of the income he gets from the rental, he also supplies fire wood, a cheap source of cooking fuel, to secondary schools. He has four children who all attend school and he is hoping to educate them in good schools so that they can pass well and go to university.  

Asuman would like to use the loan to finish his house so that he and his family can have descent accommodations.

loans.use: to buy building materials for finishing his family residential house.

loans.name: Musarrat

texts.en: Musarrat is a 57-year-old married woman. She has been in a beauty parlor business for two years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hairstyling and facials. Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this, she requires hair care products and skin products with packs of hair rollers and combs, so she applied for a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR)  through Kashf Foundation. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products and skin products with packs of hair rollers and combs.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 36 years old, and she is already skilled and devoted to her work as a farmer, who manages agriculture well. Her farm is not very rich and the income from it is not big, but due to Marine’s care and hard work it yields income for her family. She keeps on her farm now six cows, six calves, two pigs and ten chickens. Marine also cultivates some vegetables and fruits (tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, apples, and apricots) on the family's own land, but the produce is for family use and not for sale.

Marine lives in the village Noratus, which is in the area of Gavar. She is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband works as a builder, but he tries to help Marine around their farm, also. Marine is sure that she can enlarge their farm and earn greater profit from it. For that purpose, she asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams (AMD). She will use the loan to buy two cows, ten chickens, and a lot of fodder for her farm animals. It is Marine’s first deal with Kiva lenders, and she expects good results.

loans.use: to buy two cows, ten chickens, and a lot of fodder for her farm animals.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a married woman and a mother of seven children. Her husband is working for daily wages, and his income is not enough to support his family. That is why Kousar is running her own business, producing and selling milk, to contribute to the family income. Over time, Kousar has become famous in her area for providing good-quality milk.

To get an increase in the production capacity of milk, Kousar is requesting a loan of Rs. 30,000 through Kashf Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend her profits on expanding her business further.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for milk production.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
This is Luis. His previous loan was a big help in his business. As of now, he is more focused in attending to his coin-operated water dispenser business as well as in his computer shop. He and his wife continue to work to provide for their family.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan that he will use to pay for the maintenance of his water dispenser and computers. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Luis dreams of having a big place for his business and hopes that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his coin-operated water dispenser and computers.

loans.name: Jamali

texts.en: Jamil is a 35-year-old hardworking man with 2 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. His main business is rental houses, as well as transport to boost his income. He faces challenges of increased competition from other landlords and failure of tenants to pay on time, while his dreams are educating his children to higher levels of learning and owning a housing estate. Jamil is requesting a loan to buy iron sheets for construction.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for construction.

loans.name: Ratanak

texts.en: Ratanak is a single young man residing in Battambang Province's Ek Phnom district in Cambodia. He lives in a family consisting of seven members including him and his mother who sell vegetables and meats for family income, as the breadwinners in the family. Now, he has his own job at a local NGO (Non-profit Organization) and receives a decent income to support the family. Ratanak wants to pursue his master's degree specializing in Tourism at a local university. Therefore, he applied for his first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) in order to pay his tuition fee. He hopes that this loan will relieve his financial burden so that he can pay more attention to his studies and get a good job to support his family.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen, age 30, is a married woman. She is running a general store with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Nasreen’s husband. They sell milk with other items of daily use, such as biscuits, rusks, etc., in their store. They have been doing this business together for the past five years and earn enough income to cover their household expenses. To meet the demands of her customers, Nasreen applied for another loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees. This loan will help her to purchase more cans for storage of milk and some packs of biscuits and rusks. She is in her second loan and has shown good repayment behavior. Nasreen dreams of providing quality education to her four children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more cans for storage of milk and some packs of biscuits and rusks.

loans.name: Sah 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SAH 2 est composé de neuf personnes qui sont des cohabitantes. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Émilie celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 66 ans. Émilie n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Émilie est mariée à un certain Valentin. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et un à leur charge. Émilie vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Afin de faire face aux diverses charges du ménage, Émilie vend des boissons et de l'eau glacée (pure water) depuis une dizaine d’années. Émilie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Émilie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SAH 2, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The SAH2 group consists of nine women who live in the same house. The group's representative, named Émilie, is 66 years old. She is the woman raising her hand in the photo.

Émilie did not attend school. She is married to a man named Valentin with whom she has three children. Some of the couple's children are in school and one is their dependent. Émilie lives with her husband and her children and jointly takes care of the household expenses with her husband.

In order to cover the various expenses of the family, Émilie has been selling drinks and frozen water (Pure Water), for about 15 years. She buys her goods at a market located in Benin.

Eager to satisfy the needs of her customers and to increase her turnover and income, she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the SAH 2 group. Their previous loan was duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Azeeman

texts.en:
Azeeman is 52 years old and a widow. For the past three years, she has been manufacturing ‘waan’ -- ropes, or straps, made from a dried, long, grassy plant. 'Waan' are used for many purposes, including making beds (combined with wooden frames on four legs). She offers various types of ‘waan’ in different colors, and is famous in her community for providing good-quality products.

Azeeman is a single parent of three children and is responsible for fulfilling the basic needs of her children, including food, health care, and education. She is also accountable for improving their standard of living.  She wants to expand her business, so she applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000. She intends to use the loan money to buy another machine for making 'waan' out of good-quality materials, to increase her sales. She wishes to use her increased profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy another machine for making 'waan' out of good-quality materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more dairy cows

loans.name: Annie

texts.fr: Annie est une femme de 37, mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle possède et gère un stand de vente de chaussure dans un quartier de la ville depuis 7 ans. elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter des marchandises afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et ses bénéfices.les bénéfices ainsi générés vont lui permettre d'agrandir son capital d'une part et d'autre part de subvenir au besoins de sa famille (nutrition, logement, éducation)
texts.en:
Annie is a 37-year-old woman who is married and the mother of two children.  She owns and manages a booth where she sells shoes in one of the neighborhoods of her city.  She has been involved in this activity for the past seven years.

She is requesting a loan to buy some merchandise in order to increase her turnover and profits.  With her profits, she will be able to increase her capital and also to meet the needs of her family (food, lodging, education).

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Rafiqan

texts.en:
Rafiqan is 40 years old and a married woman. She has six children; she is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing and health care.  She started her business of embroidery, to contribute to the family income. She is expert in embroidery and makes beautiful-looking embroidery on cloth. Her customers are based in her community or from nearby areas. At present, she enjoys a great customer list, and her work has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she has requested a loan of Rs. 15,000 to buy a stock of thread in different colors, with packs of pearls, sequins and stones, for embellishment. These supplies will help her to meet the orders of her customers, without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors, with packs of pearls, sequins and stones, for embellishment.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amistad Cusqueña”,el socio continua con su negocio de venta de libros y brindando el servicio de taxi,el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio y brindando el serviucio de taxi los cuales le va bien bien gracias al empeño que le pone a cada uno de ellos,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio sale adelante por su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de llantas para su carro.
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Amistad Cusqueña” communal bank. He is continuing with his business selling books and with his taxi service. He has been in his business and offering the taxi  service for some time. These activities are going well thanks to the effort he puts into each one of them. The member is a responsible and hard-working person, as this is how he keeps going for the sake of his family. 

He is requesting the loan to buy tires for his taxi. Member feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to pay his installments on time. He is grateful for the assistance he has been provided.

loans.use: To buy tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Dukore I Group

texts.fr:
Jean fait partie du groupe  Dukore I et   habite à Gitega. Il a   35 ans et est marié à Nadine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants dont 2 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge une jeune fille.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (riz et haricot)  depuis 16 ans. 

Il  est à son  dix-huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique (haricot, riz) à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait construire une maison  en ville.
texts.en:
Jean is a member of the Dukore I group and he lives in Gitega.  He is 35 years old and married to Nadine, a farmer.  Jean and Nadine have three children, two of whom are in school.  He also supports a young girl.

Jean has been selling grocery products (rice and beans) for the past 16 years.

He is on his eighteenth loan with Turame.  With this loan, financed by Kiva, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of grocery products (beans, rice) for resale, in order to make more money.  In the coming years, he would like to build a house in the city.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of grocery products (beans, rice) for resale.

loans.name: Banguka I Group

texts.fr:
Floride fait partie du groupe Banguka I et   habite à Gitaga. C’est une veuve de  38 ans. Elle  a 3 enfants âgés de 5  à 14 ans, dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de banane et de farine   depuis 10 ans. 

Elle  est à son  treizième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes et de farine à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Floride is a member of the Banguka I group and she lives in Gitega.  She is a 38-year-old widow with three children between the ages of 14 and 5.  Two of her children are in school.

She has been selling bananas and flour for the past ten years.

She is on her 13th loan with Turame.  With this loan, financed by Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas and flour for resale, in order to make more money.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas and flour for resale.

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.es:
Vilma, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita mas capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar vigésimos de diversas series.
El efecto que tuvo con el crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda, ya que logro obtener mayores  ganancias y asimismo la clientela  aumento; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Vilma needs to apply for another loan because she needs more working capital to continue investing in her business. This loan will be used to purchase various types of lottery tickets. 

The last loan proved to be a great help, as she was able to increase her earnings as well as her customer base. This has improved her economic conditions and the family circumstances.

loans.use: purchase a variety of lottery tickets.

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik has been raising apricot, peach and pear trees for more than 10 years and supports her family with the profit from her farming. Nazik works hard to sustain her family of six: Nazik, her parents-in-law, her husband and her two children.

As the agricultural income is hardly enough to cover the family's daily costs, Nazik also works as a nurse and provides medical services to her co-villagers. With the earnings she gets, she manages to pay her household expenses. Nazik is requesting a loan so that she can buy the supplies she needs such as fertilizers, seeds, and other things. These will help Nazik to have a good harvest and obtain better profits to provide her family with better financial stability.The other part of the loan will be used for the renovation of the greenhouse. This is very important for Nazik to enlarge the cultivation of fruits and vegetables and gather more income.

Nazik is sure that this loan is a first step to her future success. She dreams of providing her children a beautiful life, a good education, food and clothing.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and renovation of her greenhouse

loans.name: Unidos Por Un Peru Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Unidos Por Un Perú” y está conformada por 05 socios entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar. Lily es la que preside al grupo, pues fue elegida por sus compañeros. Actualmente  se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, la cual lo realiza a pedidos. Como actividad segundaria ofrece productos de belleza, obteniendo un ingreso extra para su hogar. Se siente  feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de prenda de vestir como chompas, pantalones, casacas y así tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. Su mayor deseo es de instalar una boutique donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. Lily tiene 30 años es separada con 02 aún dependientes. El nuevo grupo “Unidos Por Un Perú” agradecen el crédito brindado. Lily es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo color celeste.
texts.en:
This is the new group "Unidos Por Un Perú," and it is made up of five members who are excited to start working. Lily was elected to preside over the group. Currently she works selling clothing items, which she does to order. As a secondary service she offers beauty items, thereby earning extra income for the household. She is happy that, thanks to her hard work, she has been able to improve her family's quality of life. She applied for this loan in order to purchase clothing items such as sweaters, trousers, and jackets to offer to her customers. Her biggest goal is to set up a store from which to sell her products. 

Lily is 30 years old, she is separated, and has two dependent children. In the picture above, Lily is the third from the left in the blue shirt. 
The group "Unidos Por Un Perú" is grateful for the offer of a loan.

loans.use: purchase sweaters, trousers, and jackets.

loans.name: Agrace

texts.en: Agrace is 42 years old and married with three children, all of whom attend school. She acquired a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy mulch for her banana and pineapple plantations. She has a banana plantation and grows pineapples at Kasozi. She has a retail shop business where she gets some additional income. Her business started in 1990 with challenges but as of now, it has stabilized and she can get an income to support her family and pay school fees for her children at the university. Her clients are people from both the village and the town. She hopes to expand her business to meet the ever-growing market for the products. She is a committed woman, hardworking and social. She thanks the bank for the continuous support they have given her to increase her business and sustain the family.

loans.use: To buy mulch and organic manure

loans.name: Radik

texts.en:
Radik successfully manages agriculture. He has a very big private land and he is specialized in potato cultivating. Radik and his family live in the village Zovaber in the area of Gegharkunik. He is married and has three sons. Radik’s parents also live with him; his mother is retired.

Radik has higher education; he is an engineer. Radik’s father is also an engineer, and both of them work in the same place on their specialty. Like many families, their salary and income is not enough for their big family. So Radik has decided to enlarge his potato cultivation, and he asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of potato seedlings and fertilizer for his cultivation activities.

loans.use: To buy a lot of potato seedlings and fertilizer for his cultivation activities.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 32-year-old lady who enjoys doing hand embroidery on leather sheets for shoe making. She receives orders from the shoe-making factory and earns a reasonable amount of income to support her family. She has five children and is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing and education. To fulfill the orders of her customers on time, she has applied for a loan of Rs 20,000 through Kashf Foundation. This loan will help her to purchase leather with some spools of thread and packs of beads. In this way, she can manage to complete orders on time and earn enough income to support her family well.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of leather, some spools of thread and packs of beads.

loans.name: Maurice Bertrand

texts.en: Maurice is a Cameroonian, 38, living in a rural area. He is married with three children. The oldest is seven years and the youngest is three years old and in primary school. He has been in business for over a year now, which makes him stable, experienced and successful. This is his first loan with us. This loan will help him increase his profit by about 28 percent and hence, his standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for provision store items to sell

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 52-year-old married woman who has been selling milk for the past five years. She has three calves and two buffaloes in milk. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. She has three children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her seventh year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through support for it. Now she requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to purchase another buffalo and feed for its calves. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 43-year old, vigorous married woman. She has been involved in the business of hand-embroidery for the past six years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is a laborer, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. She is a mother of four children and is responsible for their food, health and education, and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. 

At this time, she requested a loan of 30,000 rupees to buy raw materials such as colorful threads, sequins, unique stones and pearls in large quantities. It will help her to meet the orders of her customers on time. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her area.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as colorful threads, sequins, unique stones and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 27-year-old energetic lady. She has been actively involved in the business of hand-embroidery for the past six years with the support of Kashf Foundation. Her embroidery patterns are very famous in her locality, and her demand is increasing day by day. But due to lack of availability of funds, she is not able to fulfill the demands of her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 30,000 rupees to buy raw material such as frames, needles, sequins, threads of different colors, unique pearls and stones. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She expects an increase in profits and hopes to save some money to provide better living standards to her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as frames, needles, sequins, threads of different colors, unique pearls and stones.

loans.name: Zahidan

texts.en: Zahidan has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 14 years now. During the initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to be famous in her community to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. To meet the orders of her customers on time, she requested another loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase more spools of thread with packs of beads, sequins and glittering material in various colors. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Zahidan has taken up.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread with packs of beads, sequins and glittering material in various colors.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a 25-year-old single man with no dependants. He is a carpenter who owns a workshop, a business he started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. He has requested a second loan of KES 30,000 to purchase timber, plywood and paints to use in his workshop. 

The profit he earns will help him to expand this business as well as to repay his loan. He hopes to see his business grow and have a neat and healthy family in future.

loans.use: to purchase timber, plywood and paints.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 30-year-old man from Nyalenda in Kisumu county. He is married to Stella and they have two children aged four and two years old respectively.

He has been running a barber shop for the last five years and makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. He has applied for his second loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more machines and repair his shop. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

His dream is expand his business and take care of his family.

loans.use: To purchase machines and repair his shop.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose used her previous loan to buy shutters. She has paid it very well and has applied for another one such that she could buy materials to do an extension of her veranda, to provide a good shed for resting and also drying ground. 

She is grateful that Kiva lenders through UGAFODE have been contributing to her family's well being. She is a hard working lady who loves to see her family progressing. The veranda will also help to protect the face of her house.

loans.use: To buy cement and labour for work on her veranda

loans.name: Manushak

texts.en:
Manushak is 40 years old. She lives in Akhaltsikhe District with her sister and niece. Manushak has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Manushak has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Manushak has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit Manushak will begin selling bed linen. She plans to go to Turkey and purchase bed linen at wholesale prices and then resell among her villagers at a higher price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to begin selling bed linen

loans.name: Sirvard

texts.en:
Sirvard is from Surenavan village of Ararat region where she lives with her son and his family. Sirvard has been running a farm for many years. In particular she cultivates tomatoes and grows different types of fruit trees (apricot, peach, and apple). Over time, she has become famous in her area for providing good-quality products. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Sirvard has a two-year-old grandchild (in the photo) and is very motivated to provide him a beautiful life, food and clothing.
 
In order to continue running her farm, Sirvard needs to purchase seeds and fertilizer, which is very important for successful cultivation of the land. For this purpose, Sirvard has requested this loan. The other part of the loan will be used for covering watering costs. The loan is very important for Sirvard to gather more income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer and cover watering costs

loans.name: Jareti

texts.en:
Jareti is a 50-year-old married man. He supports a family of three children aged between seven and 22 years. His spouse supports him in meeting some of their financial needs. Jareti runs a transport business in Kapsabet town and he has been in this business for the last eight years.

Jareti has borrowed KES 90,000 from KADET LTD. With this loan he intends to purchase a new motorbike to expand his transport service business. From this business he gets an average profit of KES 13,000 each month. 

With the anticipated profits he intends to expand his business by starting a dairy farming business to diversify his sources of income, and also to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Rubik

texts.en:
Rubik has a small and beautiful farm which he takes care of with great pleasure and enthusiasm. He has two bulls, one heifer and one calf. Rubik’s wife helps him very much with the farming activities. They live in a small nice city, Gavar, in the Gavar area. Rubik is 60 years old and he has four grown-up children, three daughters and a son. They are all married and live separately with their families. Rubik completed higher education; he graduated from Gavar State University. 
It is Rubik’s first loan and he wants to borrow an amount of 500,000 Armenian drams for the purchase of one cow and animal fodder. He and his family hope very much that Kiva lenders will give him an opportunity to enrich both his farm and his family income.

loans.use: to buy one cow and animal fodder

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a 52-year-old man, married to Lucy and a father of seven children. Two of the children are over eighteen years and do not live with him. He is a farmer and also sells groceries. He has been in this business for fourteen years and gets a monthly income of KES 25,000.

This will be Walter's seventh loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and animal feeds. In future he wants to own more cows and also be a well-known dairy farmer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and animal feeds

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 61 years old, married to Abraham and blessed with four children aged 32, 28, 26 and 22 years respectively. She practices farming which she has been doing for the past 10 years in order to earn a living. She earns a monthly income of KES 50,000. 

She has requested a second loan of KES 100,000 to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the planting season. The profit she earns will contribute towards her buying more land. She dreams of becoming a renowned farmer in this region.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds for the planting season.

loans.name: Jaime Rufino

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre de 29 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven Jaime no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jaime trabaja como albañil, realizando obras de construcción, como casas, habitaciones, y otros, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, adicionalmente los fines de semana trabaja como chofer de taxi, brindando servicios de transporte, Jaime se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jaime se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de herramientas, como madera, una carretilla, martillos y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder seguir realizando sus trabajos de construcción, así pues Jaime seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casas propia.
texts.en:
Jaime, 29, is a single man that lives in the city of Ica. He is a kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person, with a strong will to succeed. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and because he had to work since he was young, Jaime could not study Mechanics. During his free time, he enjoys cooking a delicious “rice with chicken” to share it with his family.

He took the initiative to work as a mason, something he does with commitment and dedication. He does different types of works in houses, rooms, etc. Jaime starts working early in the morning, every day, and does it for approximately ten hours. During the weekends, he works as a taxi driver. Jaime likes his job and believes that he does well because he offers good prices and is kind to others.

Jaime feels grateful to Kiva lenders, since with the help he received he will be able to buy things he needs for his job, such as wood, a wheelbarrow and a hammer. These things will be very useful to continue with his works. He will continue working hard in order to make his dream come true: to have a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amistad Cusqueña”, él socio continua brindando el servicio de taxi, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio a la vez continua con su negocio de restaurante siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.

El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Communal Bank "Amistad Cusqueña". He continues with his taxi service. He has dedicated himself to this activity for a long time, and it's going well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his work every day. At the same time, he continues with his restaurant business, which is the way in which he supports his family.

This member feels very grateful for this loan and is committed to paying his monthly installments on time.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Sofyan

texts.en:
Sofyan runs a 'warung', a small Indonesian shop, selling snacks, drinks and other small items in Bogor.  Bogor is about 2 hours away from Jakarta.  Sofyan’s shop is not just a typical 'warung', Sofyan is also a part of the Ruma Network, selling mobile phone airtime credit and processing bill payments for customers.  Sofyan is excited to be a part of this network because he hopes that these services will bring more customers to the shop and increase his income.  

Sofyan lives with his wife and 2 children.  Since joining Ruma, Sofyan is earning on average $30/per day in mobile airtime credit sales.  With the support and assistance from Ruma staff, he hopes to grow his business even more.  

Sofyan is now offering to process electricity bill payments for customers as a new service.  To do this, he is required to print receipts for these transactions.  He is requesting a Kiva loan to help him to purchase the printer so he can offer this new service.

loans.use: To purchase a printer for printing out the required receipts for mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. 

Five years ago, Kalsoom began sewing shoe uppers in her house. She supplies these uppers to different factories where they are used in making shoes. As a result, she now earns enough money to contribute to the family's income. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the orders of her customers on time. This is why she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for her second loan of PKR 30,000 to buy leather and spools of thread in large quantities. This will help her to increase her sales. 

Kalsoom is very experienced in her business. She is confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy leather and spools of thread in large quantities.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie signed up for membership to PMPC this year. She is married with 2 children. Elsie is 38 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She operates her sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 11,000 PHP for additional capital.

In the future, Elsie hopes to expand her business and wants to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 32-year-old mother from Manyatta in the county of Kisumu. She is married to Jorim, a businessman who provides financial support to the family. She is blessed with four children, ages 19, 15, 13 and 12.

Florence sells charcoal, a business she has been doing for the last 15 years. She makes a monthly income of KES 60,000. She has applied for her ninth loan, which she will use to purchase more sacks of charcoal in bulk from the suppliers located outside of Kisumu. She will use the anticipated profits to start a new business.

Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 44-year-old man who is married to Mary has five children. He has been in the taxi business in Kangemi for six years now. He earns monthly income of 35,000 shillings.

This will be Stephen's second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan to pay school fees for his children. In the future he wants to be a successful businessman and also continue paying school fees for the children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Vibian

texts.en:
Vibian is a 35-year-old married woman who supports a family of three children that are between one and eight years old. She runs milk and vegetables business in Kapsabet. This has been her income generating business for the last three years, and she earns an average monthly profit of KES. 10,000.

She has requested a loan of KES. 30,000, and with it she intends to purchase more stocks of milk and vegetables and other food items, like potatoes. She anticipates earning profits that she will use to expand her business by opening a small cantine to sale cakes as well as fermented milk.

Vibian hopes to improve her living standards and be financially stable. She also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase milk and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 39 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Thelma is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pig.

Thelma has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Arlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling eggs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and ducks. Arlyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional trays of eggs to sell in her business.

Arlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: purchase additional trays of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling used shoes and clothing, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years.

Marciana requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of used shoes and clothing to resell. Marciana would like to build and expand her business, in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of used shoes and clothing to resell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income by selling ready-to-wear clothing and providing printing services.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy materials for her tailoring business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan, to build her tailoring business further. Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: John

texts.en: John works hard to support his family. He is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. He has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for his business, which he has had for 8 years now. In the future, John would like to save enough money so he can afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for his business.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Shirley works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig raising. Shirley is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, sugar, milk, canned good, spices, etc., for her general store business.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, sugar, milk, canned good, spices, etc.

loans.name: Regia

texts.en:
Regia is a 42-year-old separated mother of five from Israel’s Negev region. She works part-time as a kindergarten teacher and has a clothing store, which is open in the afternoons and evenings. The store is located on a main street and has a good customer base. However, Regia needs to update her stock to meet her customers' demands.

She needs this loan to pay for electrical work, lighting and new stock of clothes.

Regia wants to continue and strengthen her business but, most importantly, she wants to ensure her children’s education and strong future.

loans.use: To pay for electrical work, lighting and new stock of clothes.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Abibatu is 25 years old and married with 2 children who are 3 and 7 years old. She runs a plastic home products business in Tombo, an area in western rural Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business since 2008 and sells bowels, spoons and food containers within her community. She says that the main problem in her business is lack of capital to expand.

Abibatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more home products for resale.
