Le premier crédit lui permettra d’acheter plus de marchandises pour mieux répondre aux besoins de clients. Elle espère à l’avenir stocker plus de marchandises afin de revendre en période sèche et diversifier ses marchandises. Notons qu’elle est âgée de 35ans.
texts.en: Afiwa lives with her husband and their two children in Lomé. The children are 9 and 6 years old and in school. To help out her husband in covering household expenses, she has been selling red oil out of her home since 2010. This initial loan will enable her to purchase more merchandise in order to respond further to the needs of her customers. In the future, she hopes to stock more merchandise to resell during dry periods and to diversify her merchandise. Note that she is 35 years old.

loans.use: to purchase containers of red oil

loans.name: Nudjiratou

texts.fr: Nudjiratou est une femme âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 3 enfants dont 02 à l’école. Nudjiratou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1987. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé et travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes. Nudjiratou a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. Dans les prochaines années, Nudjiratou voudrait augmenter la taille de son étalage. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Nudjiratou is a 37-year-old woman who is married to a chauffeur. She has three children, of whom two are in school. Nudjiratou has been working as a retailer since 1987. She sells grocery items to any customers in her store. She purchases the goods in Lomé and works by herself. At the moment, her main problem is not being able to meet all the demand. 

Nudjiratou has requested her fourth WAGES loan to purchase grocery items. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, she would like to increase the size of her displays. She says that she plans on using the profits to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell in her general store, like charcoal, rice, sugar, and oil.

Tessie has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from tailoring.

Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like charcoal, rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Zakia's Group

texts.en:
Zakia is a member of a two-person group. She is very a diligent and hard-working woman, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along her husband and five children. 

Her husband has been running a gold shop for six years. Zakia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her husband wants to expand the gold shop. He would add some more space to his shop and would also improve the seating arrangement of his customers. He would renovate his shop to attract more customers. 

Zakia is very hopeful for this loan and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. In the picture, Zakia is raising her hand.

loans.use: to expand her husband's jewelry shop.

loans.name: Lattou Group

texts.fr:
Mme AGUIRATOU représente le groupe  LATTOU. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgée a 14ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 02 vont à l’école.
Mme vend des céréales depuis 02ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Léo. Ses clients viennent de divers quartiers.
Mme veut s’acheter 01sac de sorgho blanc et 03sacs de maïs.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Mme ambitionne agrandir son activité et mieux s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mme AGUIRATOU is the representative of the group called  LATTOU. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 14 and the youngest two years old. Two of them are in school. 

Mme Aguiratou has been selling cereals (grains) for two years. She buys her grains  in Léo. Her customers come from various areas. 

Mme Aguiratou wants to buy one sack of white sorghum and three sacks of maize. She wants to reinvest her profit in her business. She would like to grow her business and take better care of her children.

loans.use: to buy a sack of white sorghum and three sacks of maize.

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de bijoux à domicile, Eugénie est une femme de 49ans qui vit avec son conjoint comptable et leurs 02 enfants de 15 et 12ans à Lomé. Les enfants sont tous scolarisés. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2007 et s’y plait beaucoup car cela lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Son troisième crédit lui permettra d’acheter plus de marchandises. Elle espère rendre prospère son activité et assurer le bien être de la famille.
texts.en: A jewelry retailer out of her home, Eugénie is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Lomé with her husband, an accountant, and their two children, aged 15 and 12 years old. The children are both in school. To help out her husband in covering household expenses, Eugénie has had this business since 2007 and is very happy with it, since it enables her to meet the needs of her family. Her third loan will enable her to purchase more merchandise. She hopes to make her business prosper and to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry to sell

loans.name: Waceema

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Waceema works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buy-and-sell gasoline. Waceema is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell in her general store, like soap, canned goods, eggs, sugar, and milk.

Waceema has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like soap, canned goods, eggs, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Gloria Nohemi

texts.es:
Gloria es una señorita de 20 años de edad, soltera, vive junto a sus padres en el Caserío Chuacruz, municipio de San José Chacayá, departamento de Sololá.
A Gloria le gusta mucho interactuar con la gente, es por ello que trabaja en una asociación como secretaria brindándole atención a la gente que le visita; de esa forma contribuye y apoya a su comunidad. Por este trabajo que ella realiza recibe un salario con lo que ella aporta recursos económicos para el sostenimiento de su familia y el de ella misma. 
Por otra parte ella cuenta con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la comunidad donde vive, con la cual también genera pequeños ingresos que complementan el sostenimiento de su familia.
Actualmente ella solicita un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para compra de una refrigeradora para conservar productos perecederos que vende dentro de su tienda.
Sueña con ampliar su tienda y mejorar el servicio hacia sus clientes y mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 20 years old, single and lives with her parents in Chuacruz, a village in the San José Chacayá municipality, in the administrative division of Sololá.

Gloria loves interacting with people, for this reason she works as a secretary for an organisation which offers help to people who visit it. This is how she contributes to and supports her community. The salary she receives for the work she does gives her the financil resources to support her family and herself.

She also runs a small grocery store in her community, which also generates a small income which supplements upkeep of her family.

She is currently applying for a loan of Q 5,000.00 to buy a refrigerator to store perishable products which she sells in her shop.

She hopes to extend her shop and improve service to her customers, and to improve and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a 37-year-old woman and a member of a two-person borrower group. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and one daughter. 

She has been doing the business of selling school bags for six years. Her sales are increasing with the passage of time. 

Bushra has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She would purchase a new variety of school bags to sell and, in this way, her sales and net income would be increased. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. 

Bushra is raising hand in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of school bags to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing equipment for her business.

Fe has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment for her business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetables-vending business in the Philippines.

Conchita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for ten years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Aridjatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de tissus coupons et de bicarbonate au marché, Aridjétou est mariée et est maman de 02 enfants qui ne sont plus scolarisés. Âgée de 59ans,  elle désire répondre aux besoins des clients c’est pour cela, elle sollicite son second crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Elle espère augmenter son stock et assurer le bien être de la famille.
texts.en: A retailer of fabrics and bicarbonate at the market, Aridjétou is married and a mom of two children, who are no longer in school. She is 59 years old and would like to meet the needs of her customers. To do so, she is requesting her second loan to purchase some merchandise. She hopes to increase her inventory and to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase fabric samples and bicarbonate

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 55 years old, married, with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Delia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials, like bamboo and fishing net.

Delia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, like bamboo and fishing net.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 31 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowena is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rowena has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from food-vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Twigarukire Group

texts.fr:
Aline fait partie du groupe  Twigarukire et   habite à Gitega. Elle a   33 ans et est mariée à Venant, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants, âgés de  2 à 12 ans, dont 2  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de la bière  depuis 12 ans. 

Elle  est à son  sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bière à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Le gain de son commerce lui permet de satisfaire le besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Aline is part of the group Twigarukire and lives in Gitega. She is 33 years old and married to Venant, a merchant. Together they have five children, aged 2 to 12 years old. Two of the children are students. 

Aline has been doing commerce in beer for twelve years. 

She is on her sixth Turame loan. With the KIVA she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of beer to resell in order to earn more. 

The profit from her business enables her to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of beer to resell, in order to earn more

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 43-year-old Mbalu, from Waterloo, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with four children between the ages of 17 and 27 years. Three of her children attend school. She started business for the daily survival of her family.
 
Mbalu runs a food-stand business. She sells chicken and fish within a busy market area. She has been running this business since 2006. She works at the business nine hours per day, seven days per week.   Mbalu says that the main challenges to her business are transportation problems and price fluctuations.

Mbalu has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities for resale, like cooking oil and packaged chicken. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. 

In the future, Mbalu plans to have a permanent business residence. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities for resale, like cooking oil and packaged chicken.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
San Miguel en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres está creciendo por mejorar e ir creciendo gracias a las capacitaciones que está recibiendo. Todas las miembros están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer como estas ellas, y 9 de las integrantes estaban en el indicador amarillo o medio, es decir, con un ingreso no muy bajo, pero con las capacitaciones podrán ir mejorando.
Nilda es parte de este grupo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de flores. Cuenta que es muy creativa y hace muy lindos arreglos para todo tipo de ocasiones. Es una persona que pese a las dificultades quiere salir adelante y mostrar que es capaz, es muy activa y trabajadora.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de flores, ya que es su principal insumos y así seguir invirtiendo en su plan de negocios, y superar su línea de pobreza.
texts.en:
San Miguel, in its second cycle of the women’s committee program, is growing and improving thanks to the training the women are receiving. All group members are doing a survey on poverty elimination to see where they fall. Nine of the members were in the yellow or medium indicator, meaning with an income that is not too low but with the ability to improve. 

Nilda is part of this group. She is a very hard-working woman who sells flowers. Nilda says she is very creative and makes beautiful arrangements for all types of occasions. In spite of her difficulties, Nilda is a person who wants to get ahead and show that she is capable. She is very active and hard-working.

Nilda is requesting this loan to buy flowers, since they are her main supplies. That way she can continue investing in her business plan and reach above the poverty line.

loans.use: to buy flowers to make floral arrangements.

loans.name: Virgen De Schoensttat Group

texts.es:
Virgen de Schoensttat está en su ciclo número  4 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son madres de familia, que con ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias se han unido y luchan, quieren ir mejorando también su situación de pobreza y crecer cada día.
Mercedes es parte de este grupo, ella es una persona muy sacrificada, que con su esfuerzo y arduo trabajo está creciendo. Lucha por su familia y para poder darles lo que se merecen por medio del lavado de prendas, es muy sacrificada y cuenta que su trabajo es duro, pero que lo hace para poder ir mejorando su vida.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de jabones, enjuagues para ropas, y demás insumos para poder seguir en su trabajo y de esa forma ir mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The “Virgin of Schoensttat” communal bank is in its 4th loan cycle with the “Women's Committee” program. They are all mothers of families who, hoping to get ahead and help their families, have united to struggle together. Living in poverty, they want to continue improving their situation and to grow each day.

Mercedes is part of this group. She is a very sacrificing person who is growing through her efforts and hard work. She struggles for her family by laundering clothes to be able to offer them what they deserve. Mercedes is very sacrificing and she tells us that although her work is hard, she does it to be able to continue improving her life.

Mercedes is requesting this loan in order to invest in purchasing soap, clothing rinses, and other inputs so she can keep on working in this manner and continue improving her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soap and rinses for clothes and other things.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El Sr. Ruben es una persona muy trabajadora, que se esfuerza y trabaja por ir creciendo y dar a su familia lo que necesitan para el día a día. Su anterior crédito de Kiva lo utilizó para la compra de hilos y color para poder tejer.
Hoy solicita el crédito para la compra de sábanas, frazadas, cortinas y otros para poder seguir con sus ventas. El agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que por medio de la ayuda de Kiva mejoró sus ventas y esta creciendo.
texts.en:
Sr. Ruben is a hardworking individual. Through work and effort, he has been able to grow and provide his family what they need day after day. His previous Kiva loan was used to buy thread and dyes for weaving.

Today he is requesting a loan in order to buy bed sheets, blankets, curtains, and other products so that he can continue his sales. Ruben is grateful for the opportunity he has received. With the help of Kiva, he has been able to improve his sales and keep growing.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets, blankets, curtains, and other products.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 49ans et maman de 04 enfants dont 02 scolarisés, Afi est à son quatrième cycle de prêt et vend des produits de premières nécessités (huile, sucre, riz, tomate, cube) dans sa boutique. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Lomé et a démarré en 1995. Cet argent lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin d’assurer son devoir de femme au ménage. Son conjoint est agronome.
texts.en: A 49-year-old mom of four children, of whom two are in school, Afi is on her fourth loan cycle. She sells basic groceries (oil, sugar, rice, tomatoes, bouillon cubes) in her store. Having started in 1995, she gets her supplies  from the Lomé market. This money will enable her to bolster her business, so as to ensure her duties as a housewife. Her husband is an agronomist.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Sikiratou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique, Sikiratou est mariée à un employé de bureau. Âgée de 40ans, elle est maman de 02 enfants(08 et 06ans), qui vont à l’école. Elle sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle espère assurer l’épanouissement de la famille et rendre pérenne son activité.
texts.en: A retail grocer in a store, Sikiratou is married to an office worker. She is 40 years old and a mom of two children (8 and 6 years old), who go to school. Sikiratou is requesting her first WAGES loan to purchase grocery items. She hopes to ensure her family thrives and to make her business sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 42 years old and married, with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Elvira is borrowing PHP 19,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Elvira has been farming sugarcane for three years and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell charcoal and vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her farming sugarcane and buy-and-sell charcoal and vegetables businesses. Elvira is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Nena works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell in her general store, like shampoo, sugar, milk, coffee, chips, and soft drinks.

Nena successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, sugar, milk, coffee, chips, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela es de la ciudad de Ybycui, es una joven que esta estudiando contabilidad, y comenta que su meta es poder ser una gran contadora, donde pueda ayudar a las personas que necesiten de ella y de sus servicios. Cuenta que se ve trabajando en una empresa donde pueda aplicar todo lo que aprendió y ser de ayuda a la sociedad.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de la universidad, ya que de esa forma podrá aligerar un poco la carga de su familia y seguir estudiando. esta contenta por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Angela is from the city of Ybycui and is studying accounting.  She says her goal is to be able to be a great accountant so she can help people who need her and her services.  She says she's working in a company where she can apply everything she learned and be a great help to society.

She's requesting this loan to invest in paying her university fees.  This way she'll be able to lighten her family's load a bit and continue studying.

She's happy about this opportunity because it will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es excelente persona, trabajadora se dedica a la peluquería ya que tiene  un Salón de Belleza, en una zona muy populosa, su local está muy bien ubicado, cuenta que tiene los elementos que necesita para poder dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, además también vende accesorios, ropas, cremas, etc. Y por medio de todo eso esta tratando de crecer como persona y microempresaria.
Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, y su meta es poder seguir creciendo, ayudar a su familia y el día de mañana ser conocida por su esfuerzo y trabajo que hace.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cremas, bijouterie y ropas en general de temporada, ya que de esa forma podrá tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is a good, hardworking person. She works as a hair stylist in a beauty salon she owns, located in a popular area. Her establishment is well-located and she says that she has all the equipment she needs to offer her clients a good service. She also sells accessories, clothes, creams, etc. All these things help her to grow as a person and as an entrepreneur. Rosa says that she has a good customer base. Her goals are to continue growing, help her family and in the future be recognized for the work she does and the effort she puts into it.

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy creams, imitation jewelry and seasonal clothes. This way, she will have a wider assortment to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy creams, imitation jewelry and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.es:
Las Perlas es un excelente grupo, formado por 16 mujeres, quienes gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio ya están en el ciclo número 18 del programa de comité de mujeres. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y 6 de ellas están con ingresos muy bajos.
Acela es miembro de este grupo, y también se dedica a las ventas, su principal negocio es la venta de mercería, ya que tiene todo tipo de artículos, como ser prendas, calzados, zapatillas, artículos de bazar y demás. Cuenta que está trabajando por salir adelante y también trata de ayudar a sus compañeras a que no se desanimen y sigan trabajando.
Acela solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas y calzados, para poder tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes y seguir creciendo y mejorando sus ingresos como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Las Perlas is an excellent group made up of 16 ladies who, thanks to their efforts and sacrifice, are in their 18th cycle in the “Comité de Mujeres” program.  They are taking the survey for the elimination of poverty and six of them have very low incomes.

Acela is a member of this group and sells general merchandise; all types of items such as clothing, shoes, slippers, and ladies’ accessories.  She tells us that she is working to get ahead and also tries to help her fellow members so that they will not get discouraged and will keep on trying.

She is asking for this loan so she can buy clothing and shoes in order to be able to offer a greater variety of items to her customers and continue to grow and improve her income as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
Las 16 integrantes cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una se esfuerza al máximo para ir creciendo en las pequeñas labores que hacen, ya que es el sustento de sus familias. Una de ellas es Gregoria, quien trabaja en la venta de prendas de segunda mano.
Gregoria cuenta que sus ventas están creciendo ya que la venta de prendas de segunda mano esta cada vez mejor, ya que es más accesible para muchas personas. Ella se define a sí misma como una persona muy trabajadora que lucha y quiere salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de segunda mano, para poder seguir con sus ventas y tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus compañeras están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The 16 group members work doing a variety of things.  Each one makes the maximum effort to grow the small businesses they have, since they support their families.  

One of the members is Gregoria, who works selling secondhand clothing.  Gregoria says that her sales are growing since secondhand clothing is always improving since it is more affordable for many people.  She says that she is a hardworking person who fights to succeed. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase used clothing so that she can continue with her sales and have more variety to offer her customers.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she and her group members are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing to sell.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
20 son las mujeres que forman este grupo, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que por medio de su sacrificio y esfuerzo decidieron salir adelante. Quieren poder dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Patricia ella es la presidenta, quien motiva siempre a sus amigas a poder seguir trabajando, asistir a las capacitaciones para ir creciendo y mejorando. Cuenta además que se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, gracias a que es muy hábil esta creciendo y ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Hoy en miras a seguir creciendo pide de este crédito, ya que quier invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, como ser camisas, pantalones, jeans, remeras y demás, que le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con sus ventas y mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
There are twenty women in this group. They are women heads of households who by making sacrifices and through their efforts decided to move forward. They want to provide everything for their families that they were unable to have.

One of them is Patricia. She is the president who always motivates her friends to continue working, to attend meetings in order to grow and improve. She works selling various clothing, and thanks to her proficiency she is growing and already has a good client base.

Today in order to continue growing she is asking for this loan so she can invest in the purchase of various clothing, such as shirts, pants, jeans, t-shirts and so on, which will be a big help so she can continue with her sales and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, jeans, t-shirts, and other items for her business

loans.name: Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca” conformada por 09 socias trabajadoras que el transcurso del tiempo han ido mejorando a través de sus negocios. Ella es Lucia  una de las integrantes, casada con  08 hijos, 02 de ellos  en etapa escolar. A sus 58 años Lucia a llegado a cumplir con algunos de sus sueños como mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios. Hace más de 05 años que se dedica a la venta de mazamorras, la cual realiza en las afueras de su hogar. Su reciente crédito lo destinará para la compra de insumos como azúcar, leche y arroz. Su mayor deseo es de habilitar un espacio donde puedo ofrecer sus productos y de esta manera brindarles una mejor atención a sus comensales. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Lucia es la tercera del lado derecho, viste chompa negra y cafarena color fucsia. Miriam con  pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
This is the Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca Group. It is made up of nine hard-working female members, who over time have been improving their lives through their businesses. One of the members is Lucia. She is married with eight children. Two of her children are still in school. At 58 years of age, Lucia has managed to fulfil some of her dreams, such as improving her home and helping her children with their studies.

For more than five years Lucia has made a living by selling soft maize-based food. She sells this from outside her home. She will use the loan to buy supplies, such as sugar, milk, and rice. Her greatest wish is to set up a space where she can offer her products and thereby give her diners better attention. 

The group is grateful to Kiva investors for their help. Lucia is the third from the right; she is wearing a black jacket and a fuchsia-coloured turtleneck top.  Miriam could not be present for reasons pertaining to her job.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, and rice

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El socio Marco Antonio se sigue dedicando al negocio de brindar servicio de taxi,el socio tiene un carroq ue hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,el socio sigue vendiendo cervezas y gaseosas,el socio por medio de estos negocios quiere salir adelante,el socio se dedica a estos pequeños negocios 4 años,el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar cervezas y gaseosas.

El socio se encuentra contento por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio continues to work in the taxi service business. He has a car that services the different streets in the city of Cusco. The member continues to sell beer and beverages. Through these businesses, the member is able to get ahead. The member has worked in these small businesses for 4 years. His dream is to have a new car. 

The member requests a loan to purchase beer and beverages. The member is happy for the loan and promises to pay the quotas punctually and is grateful for the help provided.

loans.use: to purchase beer and beverages

loans.name: Mirzo

texts.ru: Мирзо 51 года. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Одного сына, которому 25 лет и одну дочь, которой 21 года. Он окончил Металлургический Колледж. Он более 25 лет работал в заводе по разработки алюминий. Он поменял свою работу в 2008 году. Он перешел работать в музей. Он работает контролером. Жена Мирзо работает директором музея. Мирзо и его жена стараются обеспечить своих детей хорошим условием проживания. Они не смогли сделать сбережения для проведения свадьбы своих детей. Его сын собирается жениться. Однако Мирзо не имеет денег для проведения свадебного торжества своего сына. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 10 000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своего сына. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему сделать счастливым его сына.
texts.en: Mirzo is 51 years old, married and has two children - one son, who is 25 years old, and one daughter, who is 21 years old.  He graduated from the Metallurgical College.  He worked at an aluminum processing plant for over 25 years.  He changed his job in 2005 and transferred to work at a museum.  He works as a controller.  Mirzo's wife works as the museum director.  Mirzo and his wife try to provide their children with good living conditions.  They could not save enough to hold weddings for their children.  Mirzo's son is planning to get married.  However, Mirzo does not have money to hold the wedding celebration for his son.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to hold the wedding celebration for his son.  He awaits your kindness.  This loan will help him to make his son happy.

loans.use: to hold a wedding for his son

loans.name: Mision De Amor Group

texts.es:
Misión de Amor está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, lleva ese nombre ya que formar el grupo fue una misión de amor a sus familias, ya que por eso están luchando todas y se están esforzando.
Yudith es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una librería cerca de la escuelita del barrio y cuenta que tiene muy buena venta, ya que todos los alumnos de esa escuela son sus clientes. Ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de las capacitaciones vaya mejorando su vida y la de su familia.
Solicita su crédito para anexar a su negocio la carga electrónica de celulares que se convertirá en un nuevo emprendimiento. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
"Misión de Amor" ("Mission of Love") is in its second cycle of the women's committee program. The group has this name because forming this group was a mission of love for the members' families, as all of the women are fighting and working hard for their families.

Yudith is one of the members of this group. She has a bookstore close to the neighborhood school, and she says that she has very good sales because all of the students of that school are her clients. She wants to continue investing in her business, and as time goes on, by means of the workshops, she wants to improve her life and that of her family.

She has applied for this loan to add the sale of electronic prepaid cell phone minutes to her business, which will become a new venture. In this way, she hopes to continue growing with her business and give her family all that they need to have a life free of deprivation.

loans.use: to add the sale of prepaid cell phone minutes to her bookstore.

loans.name: 3 De Junio Group

texts.es:
El grupo 3 de junio es nuevo, esta en su ciclo uno del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas se unieron con la esperanza de crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas. Un instrumento que les sirve de ayuda es la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual arrojo que dos de las integrantes tienen ingresos muy bajos.
La Sra. Laura es la Tesorera del grupo ella es vendedora  de Ropas y trabaja también en una peluquería. Es una mujer muy sacrificada, que por medio de estos trabajos está tratando de salir adelante y mejorar su vida. Su familia es quien la inspira, y es por ella que lucha. Esta solicitando de este crédito para poder comprar remeras, short, buzos, pantalones, camisas, y otras prendas para la venta, ya que por medio de esto ayuda a su familia.
texts.en:
“3 de junio” is a new group; this is its first cycle in the Women Committee program. The members got together hoping to grow not only economically, but also as persons. One tool that is useful for them is the poverty elimination survey, which showed that two of them receive a very low income.

Laura is the group’s treasurer. She sells clothes and works in a beauty salon. She is a committed woman that is trying to get ahead and improve her life with the help of her jobs. Her family is an inspiration for her and the reason for her to fight. She is requesting a loan to buy t-shirts, sweaters, pants, shirts and other garments to sell. This is how she helps her family.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shorts, sweaters, pants, shirts and other garments to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Señor Juan, está casado con la Sra.  Faustina, ambos tienen dos hijos, por quienes luchan para poder darles todo lo que  viven en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Don Juan trabaja como macatero (vendedor ambulante de todo tipo de productos). Se dedicó al rubro de las ventas ya que dejaba muy buenas ganancias  para poder mantener a su familia. Su zona de venta son las ciudades de Asunción, Itá e Itauguá llevando productos artesanales fabricados por mano de obra local y algunos productos elaborados por su señora específicamente sobrecamas, frazada y hamacas.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de prendas, calzados, artículos de mercería y lo que tenga que ver con el negocio en general ya que cuenta con muchos pedidos. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y su familia están recibiendo.
texts.en:
Juan is married to Faustina and they have two children for whom they strive to give everything they can.  They live in the city of Carapeguá.

Don Juan works as a street vendor selling all kinds of goods.  He started working as a salesman since it gave him very good profits that he uses to support his family.  He sells in the cities of Asunción, Itá and Itauguá and carries handmade, local goods as well some products that his wife makes.  In particular, she makes bedspreads, blankets, and hammocks.

He is asking for this loan to buy clothing, shoes, sewing supplies, and general supplies for his business.  He needs these things because he has many orders.  He is grateful for this opportunity that is being offered to them.

loans.use: buy clothing, shoes, and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo (Tajy Poty) está en su ciclo número (6) del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teresa, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 3, es decir con un buen ingreso, pero ella es consciente de que debe de seguir trabajando para ir mejorando. Teresa tiene un pequeño copetín bien surtido con golosinas, comestibles, bebidas y demás. Es una persona que se esfuerza por salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Teresa Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos para surtir su negocio con bebidas, golosinas, jugos, galletitas y demás, que son los que más solicitan sus clientes, además eso le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Tajy Poty group is on their 6th loan with the Women's Committee Program, where they all work and help each other to get ahead.

One of the members, Teresa, was found to be within income level 3 in the most recent survey, which is a good income but she is conscience of the fact that she should continue working to improve.  Teresa has a small stand that is well stocked with candy, food, drinks, and other goods.  She is someone who strives to progress and help her family with her work.

Teresa is asking for this loan in order to buy goods to stock her business, including drinks, candy, juices, cookies, and other things which are in the highest demand by her customers.  In addition, this will help her to solidify her business plan, which will help to improve her income.

loans.use: buy drinks, candy, juices, etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Marites has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her food-vending and general store businesses.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 48 years old and has one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Monina is borrowing PHP 27,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Monina has been raising pigs for 30 years and earns additional income by raising chickens.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 42 years old and married, with four children.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase stocks to sell, like canned goods, soap, cream, sugar, and spices.

Yolanda has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from raising chickens.

Yolanda aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell, like canned goods, soap, cream, sugar, and spices.

loans.name: Kolgtaaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme RAMATA représente le groupe  KOLGTAABA. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgée a 17ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. 02 vont à l’école.
Mme vend divers habits pour enfants et adulte depuis 2008. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter 1/2douzaine d’habits, 01douzaine de slip, 1/2douzaine de soutien gorge, des maillots, couvertures et des serviettes.
Elle épargne ses bénéfices pour s’occuper de ses enfants. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique et devenir  grossiste afin de bien scolariser ses enfants
texts.en:
Ms. RAMATA represents the group KOLGTAABA. She is a married mother of four children, of whom the oldest is 17 years old, and the youngest is 7. Two of them go to school. Ms. RAMATA has been selling a variety of clothing for children and adults since 2008. She gets her supplies from the Sector 10 market in town. Her customers include both men and women. 

She wants to purchase a half-dozen pieces of clothing, a dozen undergarments, a half-dozen bras, some undershirts, blankets, and towels or napkins. She saves her profits to take care of her children. Her ambition is to open a big store and to become a wholesaler, so as to provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, underwear, bras, undershirts, and towels or napkins to sell

loans.name: Gilbert Kipkoech

texts.en:
Kipkoech is a student at Strathmore. This is his story.
My name is Kipkoech from Kericho, the tea growing part of Kenya. I come from a needy family of seven children and the born the second in the family. My father works as a security guard at a local firm in the village while my mother Is a small scale farmer who grows mainly subsistence crops for family use. My father has a residential house where we have all grown as a family. 
I recently got an admission letter from Strathmore University for a degree in Bachelor of Commerce. To me this is a wonderful opportunity which is only a dream due to the financial problems of my family. My parents however are not in a position to support me through the course, this has made me to pass through a lot of challenges in my education. However, when I learned about KIVA, I knew this was an opportunity to make my dream come true. I received an admission letter to join Strathmore university and I believe that KIVA loan will offer me a financial assistance that will help me go through my education. After I complete my education I will also join hand with KIVA loan to help other needy students who are financially challenged.  I totally commit myself to paying back the loans for the full assistance of other needy students and for the better of the organization.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Commerce at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Rose Wanzuu

texts.en:
Rose is a student at Strathmore. This is her story.
I am Rose from Malindi, Kenya, a town along the Indian Ocean. I come from a needy family of four headed by a father who is a waiter in a tourist Hotel. I live in a society where education is highly degraded and traditions given first priority. This is characterized by early marriages of girls at premature ages, high rate of HIV/AIDS and drug and substance abuse. This is very disheartening as the society continues to lag behind as many young people succumb to the vices. Coming from such a society gives me the strong will to make it in life and give back to my society. However, this will be only a dream because of the financial status of my family, thus I result in turning to KIVA for a loan that will enable me to successfully acquire university education at Strathmore University. Upon the completion of my education I intend to give back to my society by starting an organisation that will strive to highlight the need to eradicate early marriages. Secondly I intend through the organization to educate the society on the negatives of drug and substance abuse, thus creating a difference in the society. I trust that the KIVA loan will make my dream a reality. It is my commitment that I will comply with the terms and conditions governing the Kiva loan for the betterment of the organisation at large.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Commerce at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en:
My name is Phyllis. I am the third born of three children born to a single mother here in Nairobi. I have always had the passion for pursuing law but in recent times, I learnt more about the concept of digital law. In the time that I have been out of school, I have engaged in activities that have resolved even more clearly my desire to join the Strathmore Law program. I have worked tirelessly with Creative Commons, an organization that has redefined the licensing methodologies in the Internet. I am the lead of the School of Open Initiative in Kenya, which is work that deals with introducing young high school students to Open Educational Resources that they can take advantage of in the Internet. 
However, I am unable to raise the funds to study at Strathmore University because my family is not financially endowed with the capacity to cater for my fees. Attending law school will sharpen me more on the issues of Intellectual property, as I believe the future for Africa’s children is the provision of Open licensed resources. The KIVA loan will not only make my dreams come true, it will give me a lee way to form a basis for the future of Africa’s learning environment.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Law at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Josephat Mwangi

texts.en:
Josephat is a student at Strathmore. This is his story.
My name is Josphat. I am from a family of four children; I am the eldest. My parents have no stable income and rely on our small piece of land to cater for our needs education included. The  sales from our single dairy cow and the farm products is not enough and have led to my parents struggle much to raise us. The situation was made worse by them spending a lot on my treatment. They are also paying for my brother who is in secondary and the other will be joining secondary next year.
 I was born with leg problems and was forced to stay at a disabled children’s home undergoing treatment for 2 years when I was young. Despite the challenges I have worked hard and devoted to give my all to ensure their efforts are paid. I have also been involved in community based groups where we have been helping the needy in the society such as the elderly. I really need financial assistance so that I can see my dream come true and also be able to help others in the society. I look forward for your assistance and thanks in advance.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Commerce at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Naomi Wangari

texts.en:
Naomi is a student at Strathmore. This is her story.
My name is Naomi; I have one brother and one sister who are in Primary and Secondary schools respectively. I would like to study the course of Bachelor of Science in Hospitality Management at Strathmore University. I am doing so, so as to achieve my long life dream of becoming a CEO in an International Hotel and thereby assisting my parents in catering for my siblings' future expenses.  My father is currently not in a formal employment but is engaged in part time jobs while my mother is in a small scale business locally; selling 2nd hand clothes. I plan to commit myself in community service in the Campus Kiva, by joining the Red Cross projects as I am certified in the area. I will also participate in other community work projects for the needy, such as the 'Marter Hospital Heart run'. In future I plan to also lend money to other deserving students, through Kiva to ensure continuity and a bright future for them

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Hospitality Management at Strathmore University.

loans.name: George Githiri

texts.en:
George is a student at Strathmore. This is his story.
My name is George; a first born in a family of three. My mother passed away in 2004.
I have always wanted to study information technology and become an expert in that area - but I do not have the means to afford university education to pursue a degree course. My father, who is a painter, depends on casual labour to take care of the family and with his meager earnings which is hand to mouth and there is nothing to save for my university education.
I am glad to have been selected for KIVA loan, which will finance my studies at Strathmore University so that I can realize my dreams of becoming an Information Technology specialist.  There was no other way that I could have pursued my University education were it not for KIVA loan. I feel like I have stepped into my dream. While at Strathmore I will take part in Campus KIVA activities and bring positive change to the lives of other. In Future I also intend to give to KIVA by being a lender on KIVA website.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Business Information Technology at Strathmore University

loans.name: Boniface Githua

texts.en:
Boniface is a student at Strathmore. This is his story.
My name is Boniface from Kiambu County. Aged nineteen years, I am the first born in a family of four. I am applying for Kiva loan which will cover my tution. The reasons why I went for the Kiva loan were: first with the loan I will able to access higher education and take I course that will enable achieve my dreams of becoming a software engineer and second it is not easy to take  this course in Kenyan public universities.
If one gets a chance, the location and learning facilities can not compare with those of Strahmore University.
My mother is a casual labourer and does not even earn enough to meet the basic family expenses.
I believe that a degree in Bsc. Informatics and the skills I will get will enable me become a top software engineer. Thank you very much for giving me a chance and other needy bright students from poor backgrounds.
I will do the same in future and while at Strathmore I will work with Campus KIVA to bring positive change in the lives of others.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of science Informatics at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Brenda Mwendwa

texts.en:
Brenda Mwendwa is a student at Strathmore. This is her story.
My name is Brenda Mwendwa. I would like to undertake a Bachelor of Business Science in Financial Economics in Strathmore University. I have one elder sibling, a sister.  I applied for the course at Strathmore University because of its good quality of educational services and facilities.  Upon graduation, I would like to become a financial analyst in a bank. This will enable me to give investment suggestions to clients and evaluate the economic outlook on different sectors and industries.
The reason why I applied for Kiva loan is because my parents could not be able to afford the fees for the whole course. My sister also depends on my parents for financial support though she is self-employed. The Kiva loan will also ensure that I study well without any financial setbacks. In studying the course at the university, I am planning to join the Campus Kiva Club that will help me build my professional skills and participate in community service projects. I also plan to become a lender in the Kiva Organisation once I get a stable job so that I can help other needy students to acquire financial support and achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in BBS Financial Economics at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Totona Bruce

texts.en:
Totona is a student at Strathmore. This is her story.
My name is Totona and I come from Narok county,  from a polygamous family. My father has nine wives. Currently living with my mother and  three brothers. Given this opportunity, I will be the first to join University while the other two are in primary school and another in secondary school. I chose to study at Strathmore University because of its quality education and high moral conduct among students. I want to study Bachelor of Science in telecommunications and work for a senior manager for one of the telecommunications companies after my graduation. I hope that one day I will be a role model for the community that I come from. In Narok, most young men and boys spend days and nights moving herds of cows from area to another looking for pasture. In future, I will also lend on KIVA site.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Science in Telecommunications at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Ronnie Alex

texts.en:
Ronnie is a student at Strathmore. This is his story.
My name is Ronnie and I come from Mombasa; the Kenyan coastal region. I am the 4th born in a family of 5 children. My mother works as a primary school teacher. I am interested in the loan to assist me pay for my school fees at Strathmore University where I got admission to do a degree in commerce(BCOM).
After University I want to be a financial consultant in one of the big companies in Kenya or if offered a chance, outside the country. In the near future I hope to be leading in the fore front in the fight against poverty by first eradicating it in my family and being a role model to other people of my age by showing them that being born poor does not necessarily mean living in poverty for the rest of your life.
At Strathmore I will join the Rugby team and through Rugby promote KIVA spirit.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Commerce at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Wambulwa Ayub

texts.en:
Wambulwa is a student at Strathmore. This is his story.
My name is Wambulwa. I am 20 years old and my family is from Bungoma in Western Kenya but I was raised in an Orphanage in Nakuru after my mother became chronically sick. My father died when I was 4 years old. I want to study Bachelor of Business Information Technology at Strathmore University because of their good quality education they offer in relation to my academic aspirations. I have three brothers and four sisters in total. My mother is a peasant farmer but unproductive due to her persistent sickness. As a student in Strathmore University, I will offer my best to the campus KIVA through through active participation and mobilization of information about KIVA. Just as KIVA is working to change people's lives, I aspire to be a prominent and hearted lender after completion of my course and work towards fulfilling the goals of KIVA

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Business Information Technology at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Jackson Njehia

texts.en:
Jackson is a student at Strathmore. This is his story.
My name is Jackson. I hail from a humble background. I was born alone before the passing of my mother while I was 10 years of age. As a result, I was left under care of my aunt. She had a son and 2 daughters. With so much financial problems and assistance from USAID APHIA PLUS and well wishers we managed to complete secondary education for me and my male cousin. I was the only one who managed to get an admission in public university after passing my National Exam.
I have applied for KIVA loan for assistance since I found it difficult in paying tuition fees and would like to pursue my degree in Bachelor of Commerce. Upon completion of my education, I intend to give back to the society by starting an organization that will help other needy, orphans and potential individuals through their education to make their dream true.
I believe that KIVA  will make my dream a reality by enabling me to pursue my career course at Strathmore University where I will obtain quality education from skilled lecturers. It also has an enabling environment for learning with high standards of discipline.
I promise to comply with terms and conditions governing the KIVA loan for the betterment of the organization at large.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Commerce at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Doris Soyian

texts.en:
Doris is a student at Strathmore. This is her story. 
I am Doris, an applicant of loan from Narok County. I am the fifth in a family of 9 children; with both parents. I have applied and wished to join Strathmore University because of its provision of high quality education and high level of discipline that Strathmore community in whole have shown since its establishment.

I am taking the Kiva loan to cater my tuition fees. The main reason of taking this loan is to solve financial problems in payment of tuition fees and get enough time to concentrate in my studies and achieve top grades. I am joining to pursue a degree in law course and later be equal field lawyer capable to apply the knowledge in places where people are in quest for justice.

My hopes and dreams is to get the Kiva loan and study hard to achieve my goals, moreover to get a job immediately after my course and  start repaying the loan as a sign of respect and gratitude to the lenders.   At Strathmore I will take part in Campus Kiva activities. After graduating, I will help others achieve their dreams by lending to them on KIVA site

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Law at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Chrisanto Omari

texts.en:
Chrisanto is a student at Strathmore. This is his story.
My name is Chrisanto; a forth Born in a family of six children. I come from Nakuru. I decided to apply for the KIVA Loan due to the financial difficulties that we have in our family. My father is a Casual Labourer in Nakuru While my Mother works as a farmer. I want to study Actuarial Science in Strathmore University. This is because Strathmore University is well known for its decency and more so quality in the students they produce to the market. This will help me have greater job opportunities once am done with school hence I will be able to get a good job and help my family and the society at large. Currently I work as a handy man and also love playing football. My dream in life is to be a successful professional and hence help my siblings have a better life and education and also help my parents in their old age.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Acturial Science at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Philip Kamau

texts.en:
Philip is a student at Strathmore. This is his story.
My name is Philip from Kiambu County, third born in a family of five children. We live with our mother who earns very little from her tailoring business at a kiosk near home.  I had a lot of problems in paying
my secondary school fees of which I still have an owing balance. I have applied for Kiva because I look forward to pursuing my degree in Bachelor of Commerce but am not in a position to pay the tuition fees. If I get the loan, I will give my best to my course and I also commit myself to pay back the loan and to help others in future.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Commerce at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Andrew Mutuku

texts.en:
Andrew is a student at Strathmore. This is his story.
My name is Andrew; I take this opportunity to apply for the KIVA Loan, having done the Strathmore University Entrance Exam and passed. I am the firstborn in a family of three. Both of my siblings are in schools, one in high school four and the other in primary. My parents work as peasant farmers in the dry lands of Kitui County. In my district there are only a few who have managed to study up to the University Level, mainly due to lack of financial capabilities. I completed secondary education in 2012 emerging as the second best in the K.C.S.E Exams in my school. I want to study Bachelor of Commerce (BCOM) as I dream of becoming an accountant. In future, am willing to help other needy people in the society without favor irrespective of the community they emerge from. In future, I am ready to hold hands with the Strathmore Fraternity through the KIVA Loan Scheme, to help more students benefit from this noble Course.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Commerce at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Gilbert Ali

texts.en:
Gilbert is a student at Strathmore. This is his story.
I am Gilbert from Emuhaya district. I come from a family of six children and am the fifth born. My father works as a school grounds man in a Primary school while my mother is a local small scale farmer in Emuhaya district. My father lives in one of the slums in Nairobi. He actually found it difficult to educate the first four children who only got primary school education and due to financial problems their education terminated. I am the only one in our family who has managed to get a University admission. I found it difficult also at secondary school in fees payment of which I was helped by APHIA PLUS, USAID programme.
I have applied for the KIVA loan for assistance since, I find it difficult to pay tuition fees and would like to pursue my degree in Bachelor of Commerce at Strathmore University. I am grateful to KIVA lenders for believing in me. Once I get quality education, I will be able to help my four siblings who are ahead of me and not employed. I commit to paying back the loan and assisting others in future.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Commerce at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Stella Andia

texts.en:
Stella is a student at Strathmore. This is her story.
I am Stella from in Bungoma County. I come from a family of three and I am the second born. My father works with Water Resources Management Authority while my mother teaches at Teachers Training College. Payment of school fees has been challenging for us with my parents struggling to make ends meet despite my father's sick condition which has proven costly too. I aspire to be a professional actuary and a key volunteer in community projects. I would like to engage in other projects like KIVA with an aim of reducing dependency ratio in the society. I would like to see my dreams become a reality and therefore I requested KIVA lenders to grant me financial aid through a loan to be able to study Actuarial Science at Strathmore University, engage in community service projects and acquire skills in profession building. This loan will enable me fulfill my dreams. I pledge to comply with KIVA terms and conditions and on completion of my studies pay back the loan and be able to aid my family and other needy people in the society.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in BBS Acturial Science at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Claude Kamau

texts.en:
Claude is a student at Strathmore. This is his story.
My name is Claude; I am the firstborn in a family of three, with a younger sister and brother as siblings in that order. I aspire to study law at Strathmore University and consequently become relevantly vast in the concepts and elements of a true advocate of justice and human rights in a legal field and judicial system hugely tainted by corruption, extortion of clients as well as their exploitation by self-serving legal practitioners. My parents are both teachers at the secondary school level. I aim upon contributing to Campus Kiva by encouraging my fellow loan beneficiaries to go that extra mile and,in reciprocation of the noble initiative to which they are beneficiaries, also lend a helping hand to the needy and less-privileged among us, and in general help alleviate poverty in society. I am intent upon creating a lender's profile on the Kiva site as soon as I get a stable income and  through with servicing my loan, as well as becoming an active contributor to the growth of KIVA.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Laws at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Merly works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable and spices business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food-vending. Merly is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetable and spices business.

She successfully fully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting an additional loan to build her buy-and-sell vegetable and spices and food-vending businesses.

Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Era

texts.en:
Era is 32 years old and married, with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Era is borrowing PHP 22,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Era has been farming rice for five years and earns additional income from motorcycle transport and raising chickens.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 33 years old and married, with one child who is in school. Mercy works very hard to provide for the family.

Mercy runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like noodles, salt, soft drinks, shampoo, and chips.

Mercy has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Mercy would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like noodles, salt, soft drinks, shampoo, and chips.

loans.name: Garukirabakenyezi Group

texts.fr:
Sophie fait partie du groupe  Garukirabakenyezi et   habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve de 52 ans.Elle a 4  enfants âgés de  20  à 30 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de  bananes et de haricot  depuis 40 ans. 

Elle  est à son  vingtième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes, de haricot et du café  à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Sophie is part of the group Garukirabakenyezi and lives in Gitega. She is a 52-year-old widow and has four children, aged 20 to 30 years old.

She has been doing commerce in bananas and beans for forty years. 

She is on her 20th Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of bananas, beans, and coffee to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of bananas, beans, and coffee to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar es un agricultor de 48 años de edad, dedicado al cultivo de café y la caña de azúcar en su vereda. Actividad que alterna con la venta de legumbres, frutas y hortalizas en la plaza municipal de jueves a domingo, con el fin de generar mejores recursos para el sostenimiento de sus tres hijos menores de edad. 
Se siente agradecido con la vida por su maravillosa familia y sueña con brindarles mejores oportunidades. Razón que lo ha motivado a solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido con el fin de aumentar sus ventas. Espera ahorrar y poder construir su vivienda para garantizarle a su familia una mejor caliad de vida.
texts.en:
Omar is a farmer and is forty-eights years old.  He makes a living growing coffee and sugar cane on his land.  He also sells different types of vegetables and fruits in the town plaza from Thursday to Sunday.  His goal is to generate more revenue so that he can provide for his three young children.  

He is thankful for his life and his marvelous family, and dreams of offering them better opportunities.  This is what has motivated him to request a loan.  He will buy stock supplies so that he can increase his sales.  He hopes to save so that he can build up his home and guarantee a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy different types of vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Tufaniso

texts.ru:
Туфанисо добрая и скромная женщина в возрасте 38 лет.    Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Тухфанисо   работает в областной больнице города Худжанда.  Она  старшая медсестра.     Она очень любит свою работу.  Старается помогать больным людям.  В больнице работает более 15 лет.  Ее старшая дочка уже совсем выросла и Тухфанисо планирует выдать ее замуж.    Все что она зарабатывает все уходит на проживание и они вместе с мужем никак не могут накопить денег. Тухфанисо хочет отремонтировать свой дом так как дом нуждается в обновлении. Но на ремонт она не имеет достаточно денежных средств.  Посоветовавшись с родными она решила получить кредит в Арванде. На полученный кредит Тухфанисо планирует купить строительные материалы для отделки комнат.
  Надеется, что в Арванде ее финансово поддержат и помогут в осуществлении ее планов.
texts.en: Tufaniso is a kind and modest woman, who is 38 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Tufaniso works at the district hospital in the city of Khujand.  She is the head nurse.  She loves her work very much.  She tries to help sick people.  She has been working at the hospital for over 15 years.  Her oldest daughter has grown up already, and Tufaniso plans to marry her off.  Everything that she earns goes toward living expenses, and she and her husband just cannot save money.  Tufaniso wants to repair her house because it needs updating, but she does not have enough money for this.  After seeking advice from relatives, she decided to obtain a loan from Arvand.  Tufaniso plans to use this loan to buy construction materials for fixing up the rooms.  She hopes that she will be financially supported at Arvand and helped with realizing her plans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a student at Strathmore. This is his story.
My name is Moses, a second born in a family of five. I am resident of Uasin Gishu County; where my parents live. My father and my mother practice small scale farming with one acre; planting farm and three cattle (one cow and 2 heifers).
When I showed my academic capability my parents were assisted with well wishers and managed to get bursaries that enabled to finance my school fees. While at secondary school, I portrayed leadership skills where I was a church captain for 3 years and hockey assistant captain where we lead our team to play at provincial level thrice. I believe given an opportunity at Strathmore will manage to do better in such similar fields. It has always been my dream to be an Actuary and help to foster development in our society, by enabling companies and diverse institutions in our growing economy to realise their strengths and weaknesses and thus explore their opportunities and curb their risks. I have wished to pursue my degree in Actuarial Science at Strathmore University but my family financial status does not allow me hence leaving me with KIVA as my only option. I am so pleased about KIVA and I thank the founders. After my studies I will a lender via KIVA.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Acturial Science at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Ruth Kerubo

texts.en:
Ruth is a student at Strathmore. This is her story.
My name is Ruth, a 3rd born in a a family of 5 children. I come from Kisii county. My mother works as a procurement assistant officer while my father is deceased. Coming from a single parented household, my mother finds it so hard to pay our school fees but has managed to see me through high school with the little money that she earns and a bit of help from friends and relatives. I have applied for the Kiva loan for assistance since my mother can’t afford to pay for the fees and I would like to pursue my degree in Bachelor of Commerce at Strathmore University. Am so thankful and sincerely feel grateful for the Kiva lenders for considering me and believing in my abilities. Once I get the quality education, I would like to give back to society by helping other needy children to pursue their education and also helping my family members. I commit to paying back the loan fully and comply with the terms and conditions governing Kiva Loan

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Commerce at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
My name is Hellen,I come from Turkana County.I went to Turkana Girls’ Secondary where I managed to get a grade of a B plain. I am the first born of the family of six and I live with my uncle who is a pastor in Lodwar.My  parents divorced when I was only 5years old and because my mother could not provide for me , I had to stay with  my uncle.
While at secondary school I could not raise my school fees but because of my commitment to church activities, the church raised my school fees. On completing my secondary level, I had to use the Business skills I got from school to start a small business so that I can help my family. I would buy fish from the fishermen at the shores of lake Turkana, fry them and sell to raise money for my family.
Actually after getting my grade I thought my dream of becoming an accountant was shuttered because of lack of money to proceed with my education and also join Strathmore which was the school of my dream. I thank God that though a 2012 KIVA Full tuition beneficiary of KIVA , I got the information that I can follow my dream by getting the loan.
I came to know about Strathmore University through newspapers and magazines. As result and I become so much interested  with  the  high quality of education it gives and I also believed that it is the only place I could achieve my dream of becoming an accountant and also it could be a place that I could acquire life skill and this all is only possible because of KIVA.
I am sure that if I get the KIVA Loan my mind will settle and I will be working very hard at school so that I will get good grades that I can get a good job that will help me give back to my community, help my sibling and also eradicate poverty from Turkana Land.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Commerce at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
My name is Rebecca from Turkana County, I am a second born in a family of six siblings. I have one sister and four brothers. I have been living with my uncle since I was 7 years, after my parents separated, because I had no one else to take care of me.
I went through my secondary education in Turkana Girls’ Secondary School and I managed to score a mean grade of B+. My school fees were met by Mama Mzungu Foundation, which only offers help to secondary school students only. I was introduced to a KIVA beneficiary from Turkana; she received her full tuition last year and is now an exemplary student at Strathmore. 
I chose Strathmore University because it is one of the leading universities in Kenya, offering quality education, and produces the best professionals in the country.  I am interested in pursuing a Bachelor of  Business Information Technology. 
Given the loan to take me through my entire 4-year course, I promise to work very hard to get good grades and after graduating, get a good job, which will empower me to clear the KIVA loan. I also look forward to giving back to the society especially in my home area, Turkana, which is faced by many challenges because it is situated in the arid parts of Kenya.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Business Information Technology at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Boniface Ndegwa

texts.en:
Boniface is a student at Strathmore. This is his story.
My name is Boniface. I come from a family of three where I have a younger brother and a single mother. My mother has been unwell for a long time and unable to work. As a result we have been living under my aunts roof and she has been taking care of us since my mother doesn't have the capability to provide for us because of her sickness. Once I receive the loan and join Strathmore from 1st July 2013, I promise to work very hard and make myself and everybody proud especially my mother. I will also help other students in future and contribute to the growth of our nation and make this world a better place  for the entire human race.
Thank you very much.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Business Information Technology at Strathmore University.
