loans.name: Jotham Omondi

texts.en:
I am Jotham from Yala, a town along the Kisumu –Busia highway.I come from a needy family headed by a grandmother who is a peasant farmer after both of my parents died when I was still at a tender age as well as my twin brother who also passed away earlier than expected making me to remain  a single child in the family to date.

I hail from a society where education is highly degraded and traditions set in the forefront. This is as characterized by early marriages of girls at premature ages as well as boys due to increased intake of drug substances resulting to their education being held at stake.

This is very disheartening and sends a lot of concerns to me as the society continue to derail as young people succumb from the vices. Coming from such a society gives me power and strength that I will prove my critics wrong and give back to the society. I am turning to KIVA for a loan that will enable me  to successfully acquire university education at Strathmore university. Upon completion of my education I strongly believe in giving back to the society by providing moral authority and setting up institutions that will be able to curb such vices amicably and streamline the society.

I trust that KIVA will make my ambitions come true and will comply with the terms and conditions governing the KIVA loan for the betterment of the institution at large.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Commerce at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Gurlli

texts.es: Gurlli tiene 54 años, es casada y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y uno de sus hijos. Gurlli se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles tales como gaseosas, harina, arroz entre otros. Gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su esposo, ha abierto una tienda donde ella vende estos productos, su negocio es estable y le ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia. Como una mujer emprendedora Gurlli espera sacar adelante su pequeña tienda y hacerlo crecer de tal manera que pueda abastecer a sus clientes ofreciéndoles un mejor servicio y de calidad. Para Gurlli este es su primer crédito con Kiva por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido, demostrando con responsabilidad y puntualidad sus compromisos de pago. El monto de S/.1500.00 lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, arroz, leche, etc.
texts.en:
Gurlli, 54, is married living in her own house with her husband and one of her children.  Gurlli works selling food items like soft-drinks, flour and rice, among others.  Thanks to her effort and support from her husband she’s opened a store where she sells these products.  The business is stable and it helps her improve her and her family’s quality of life.

Like all enterprising women, Gurlli hopes her store will succeed and grow so that she can supply her customers offering them better service and quality.  For Gurlli this is her first Kiva loan so she’s grateful for the economic support received and she’ll demonstrate this by being responsible and punctual with her payments.  She will use the 1,500 soles to buy soft-drinks, rice, milk, etc.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Vecinta

texts.en:
Vecinta is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Vecinta has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from a general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her buy-and-sell vegetables and general store businesses.

Vecinta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. She is widow, and she has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Lucia requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional materials for her business. Lucia would like to build and expand her business in the future, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 35 years old, married, and has two children who are in school, Alma works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business, selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy additional sacks of charcoal to resell. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Carmelita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a sound system operator business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials and equipment for her business.

Divina has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from fish-vending.

Divina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Mahuzonsou 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUZONSOU 1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Philomène (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 50 ans. Philomène n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Philomène est mariée à un certain Albert. Le couple a un enfant. Philomène vit avec son enfant et son mari. Philomène et son mari assurent ensemble les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Philomène vend des verres à boire et des ustensiles de cuisine de façon ambulante depuis dix ans. Philomène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Philomène sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUZONSOU 1, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group "MAHUZONSOU 1" is composed of three persons who are friends living in the same district. The group's representative, Philomène (with her hand raised in the photo), is 50 years old. She did not attend school. She is married to a man named Albert. The couple have one child. Philomène lives with her child and husband, and they jointly ensure that the family expenses are covered. To do so, Philomène has been selling drinking glasses and kitchen utensils door to door for ten years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her income, Philomène is requesting, along with the other members of the group "MAHUZONSOU 1", a fourth loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase insulated containers and drinking glasses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cloth to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Anita works hard to support her family. She has a furniture shop business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from raising pigs.

Anita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional materials for making furniture. Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that all of her hard work will help her to attain her dream -- to save money to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her furniture-making business

loans.name: Alyass Group

texts.en:
Alyass Group consists of four members from Taiz, Yemen. All of the members are women. 

They have requested a YER 320,000 loan to buy women's clothes. 

Mrwa is a 30-year-old woman. Because she faced a bad situation, she decided to help her family. She works very hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothes, but, unfortunately, the money she makes is really not enough. 

She has enough experience, selling clothes and perfumes. She intends to expand her business, so that she can increase her profit. Therefore, she asked for a loan of YER 80,000 to buy women's clothes and perfumes in order to expand her business. 

Mrwa hopes that she will make a profit and will buy a lot of products and sell them to new clients in different quarters and places in her city.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes and perfumes in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Gloria works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by selling rice.

Gloria is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional ingredients for making her foods to sell. Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream -- to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
Florencio  es un señor casado de 29 años de edad, tiene 4  hijos, 3 hombres y 1 mujer  quienes viven en el Caserío Santa María, Cantón el Tablón, Sololá, Sololá.
El se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años, eligió está actividad porque mediante lo que realiza  obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables para el sustento  familiar, otro beneficio que obtiene de esta actividad es que lo realiza al lado de su familia.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para la compra de semilla de papa y abono orgánico para su cultivo.
Uno de sus mayores sueños es  ampliar su actividad agrícola,  para obtener mejores ganancias y así sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Florencio is a married man and is twenty-nine years old.  He has four children, three boys and one girl.  They all live in the small town of Santa María, in the canton of Tablón in Sololá.  

He makes a living in agriculture, and has been doing this for ten years.  He chose this activity because through this, he is able to make enough revenue and profits to sustain his family.  Another benefit from this type of work is that he can do it alongside his family.

He is requesting a loan of Q 6,000.00 in order to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer for his crop.  

One of his greatest dreams is to increase his agriculture activity so that he can obtain higher earnings and thereby move his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Luz De Xeabaj Group

texts.es:
El señor Diego de estado civil casado, tiene 30 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, tiene 4 hijos y 3 de ellos estan estudiando, él tiene una tienda de artículos de consumo diario, inició este negocio con el apoyo de su familia y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y decide solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería para surtir su tienda, en el futuro desea tener una abarroteria y atender a todos sus clientes, los demás integranmtes del grupo se dedican a comercio y artesanía.
texts.en:
Diego, who is married, is 30 years old. He did not have the opportunity to go to school. He has four children, three of whom are studying. He has a store which sells daily consumer goods. He began this business with the support of his family and, up until now, he has ten years of experience.

He got a group together and decided to ask for a loan, which he will use to buy merchandise to stock his store. In the future, he wants to have a grocery store and serve all of his customers. 

The other members of the group work in trade and crafts.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Aseslo

texts.en:
Aseslo is a 54-year-old, married man from Getafe, Bohol. He has 12 children. The youngest child is aged 8. Aseslo engages in farming. He grows rice, and that is the family's source of livelihood. He has been growing rice for more than 10 years, now.

Aseslo requested a loan of 5,000 PHP. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers, to increase his harvest. Aseslo hopes that he could expand his farming business, to provide his family with nutritious food and to set aside some of the profits to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, in order to increase his harvest of rice.

loans.name: Adoh

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 23ans, Adoh est revendeur d’appareils électriques dans une boutique. Il est marié et papa de 02 enfants dont 01 scolarisé. Son second prêt lui permettra d’acheter des appareils électriques afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de la famille. Il espère devenir grossiste et assurer au mieux au besoin de la famille.
texts.en: A young man, Adoh is 23 years old and a retailer of electrical equipment in a store. He is a married dad of two children, of whom one is in school. His second loan will enable him to purchase some electrical equipment in order to respond better to the needs of his family. He hopes to become a wholesaler and to do better at ensuring the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase electrical equipment

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 47 years old, married, and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running her general store for 20 years, and she earns additional income from raising pigs and motorcycle transport.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional items to resell at her store, like bread, biscuits, shampoo, soap, and groceries.

Helen has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF, before this loan. She successfully paid back her previous loan. Now she is requesting a new loan, to build her general store business further. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to resell at her store, including bread, biscuits, shampoo, soap, and groceries

loans.name: Las Comerciantes  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Comerciantes está formando por 10 mujeres que se dedican en su mayoría al comercio, lo cual les permite mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que esta rodea de montañas por su geografía accidentada, esta bañada por 4 ríos y cuenta con varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gastronomía es muy variada y cautiva el paladar de todos los que la visitan.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mónica, este es el tercer crédito que realiza en conjunto con sus amigas y compañeras del grupo, el cual le gusta por la unión y compañerismo que existe entre todas ellas.

Ella tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos, su primer hijo tiene 15 años y está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su segundo hijo apenas tiene un año y medio. Su esposo en busca de un mejor futuro labora en el extranjero, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de unos familiares.

La Señora. Mónica se dedica a la costura, esta actividad la aprendió trabajando ya que sus padres eran profesionales en esta actividad, ahora tiene un pequeño taller en su casa y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, todo lo que confecciona vende en las ferias de la ciudad. Como pasa en casa también se dedica a la cría de animales. 

Su crédito lo va ha invertir en la compra de telas e hilos para su taller. 

Su meta es  tener una casa propia.

Las fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
Las Comerciantes Communal Bank is made up of 10 women who work primarily in commerce, which allows them to improve the economic stability of their households.  They live in the city of Cuenca, which is surrounded by mountains because of its rugged geography.  It's bathed by four rivers, and there are a variety of places to enjoy nature.  The cuisine is varied and captivates the palate everyone who visits.

Mónica is one of the members of this group.  This is her third loan with her friends and colleagues from the group, which she likes because of the unity and companionship among all the members.

She's 33 years old and married, and has two children from this relationship.  Her first child, 15, attends a school in the city; her second child is barely a year-and-a-half old.  Her husband is working abroad in search of a better future.  She lives with some relatives because she doesn't have her own house.

Mónica makes a living sewing, which she learned on the job because her parents were professionals.  Now she has a small tailor shop in her house and she works every day without a fixed schedule.  She sells everything she makes in the fairs in the city.  As she spends all her time at home, she also raises animals.

She's going to invest her loan in buying fabric and thread for her workshop.

Her goal is to have her own house.

The small photos are of two members who weren't able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel  es un señor  soltero de 60  años de edad,  tiene 7 hijos  3 hombres y 4 mujeres quienes viven en el Caserío Central, Aldea Xajaxac, Sololá, Sololá.  

El se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando zanahoria en el lugar donde vive. Esto lo aprendió de su padre desde pequeño posterior a ello,  tuvo la oportunidad de trabajar con otras  personas y de esta manera el fue adquiriendo más conocimiento a través de lo que realizaba.
El ahora cuenta con 20  años de realizar su propio cultivo viendo que obtiene ganancias buenas cultivando  zanahoria.   De este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q 1,000.00  para  la compra de semillas de  zanahoria y   fertilizante para cultivar  y cosecharlo,  mejorando  así sus ingresos junto a su familia. 
Sueña  con comprar otro terreno  para poder producir más,  con el fin de tener un mejor desarrollo familiar.
texts.en:
Miguel is a single 60-year-old man who has 7 children, 3 men and 4 women, who live in Caserio Central, in the village of Xajaxac, and province and department of Solola.   

Miguel is a farmer, cultivating carrots in the location where he lives. He learned this skill from his father while a child.  Since then, Miguel has had the opportunity of working with other people and in this manner, he acquired more knowledge, well beyond what he already knew.

Miguel now has some 20 years of farming experience and is obtaining good earnings growing carrots. For this purpose, Miguel is requesting a loan of 1,000 quetzals to purchase carrot seeds and fertilizer so that he can grow and harvest his crop, thus improving his family's income.

Miguel dreams of purchasing another plot of land so he can produce more and advance his family.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and fertilizer for his fields.

loans.name: Louis Charles

texts.en: Louis Charles started selling EarthSpark clean energy products a few months ago, integrating these products into his existing business. After selling out the entire inventory he bought with his last loan, he still has customers calling him with more orders. He is looking to increase his inventory and is taking out a second loan to help meet the demand in his community.

loans.use: To stock clean energy retail business

loans.name: Forestal

texts.en:
Forestal lives in Les Anglais, Haiti. As a farmer with two children in school, he appreciates organizations who help farmers improve their lives. He plans to use this loan to purchase EarthSpark products to sell solar lamps in his locality. 

He is looking to purchase solar light bulbs and solar desk lamps. With a Kiva loan, Forestal will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.

loans.use: To stock clean energy retail business

loans.name: Mujeres Al Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “MUJERES AL PROGRESO”  está conformada por 9 socios quienes se encuentran pasando el 03 ciclo. Son socios responsables en sus cuotas grupales. Vanessa tiene 25 años es conviviente con dos hijos de 6 y 3 años. Se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido de sus clientes actividad que realiza hace unos años de esta manera a podido ayudar a su esposo quien se dedica a dar servicios de mecánico en la empresa Jusat. Vanessa tiene un nuevo proyecto de negocio que consiste en implementar una pequeña bodega en su vivienda.  El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropas de estación del invierno para niños  para poderlo ofrecer a sus clientes. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo  brindado. Vanessa es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Al Progreso group is comprised of nine members who are in their third cycle.  These members are responsible with their group payments.

Vanessa, age 25, is in a common-law marriage and has two children, ages six and three.  She sells clothes by order to her customers.  She has been doing this for some years.  This way she has been able to help her husband, who works as a mechanic at the Jusat company.

Vanessa has a new business project, which is setting up a small grocery store at her house.  

She will use the loan to buy winter clothes for children in order to be able to offer them to her customers.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan that has been proffered.  Vanessa is the first one on the left.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes for children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bottles of water and to air-condition his storage area

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: María, tiene 36 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Hace más de un año que ella ha decidido poner su propio negocio con el fin de obtener otros ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar. Ella vende arroz, azúcar, manteca, harina, sal, café, churros, dulces, refrescos, condimentos y otros productos básicos. También hace topogigios (helados) para vender. Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo por 9,000 lempiras para surtir de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, pan, refrescos, churros, dulces, café, sal, azúcar etc. y aumentar sus ventas para obtener más ingresos. Su plan sigue siendo la de ampliar el negocio para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 36, is married and has four children; she lives in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  She decided to start her own business over a year ago so she could earn extra income to support her household.  She sells rice, sugar, shortening, flour, salt, coffee, snacks, candy, soft-drinks, condiments and other basic products.  She also makes ‘topogigios’ (frozen treats) to sell.  

She’s decided to request a second loan for 9,000 Lempiras to stock up on food items like basic grains, bread, soft-drinks, snacks, candy, coffee, salt, sugar, etc. to increase sales and earn higher income.  Her plan continues to be to expand the business in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Letecia works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by raising pigs.

Letecia is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy additional dried fish to resell, at her dried fish vending business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream -- to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 59 years old, married, and has five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Lilia requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional boxes of fish to resell. Lilia would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to resell

loans.name: Santos Jeremías

texts.es:
Santos es un joven de 23 años de edad, soltero; vive junto a su familia en  Caserío Xecampana (debajo de la campana en idioma Cakchiquel) municipio de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, departamento de Sololá.
Por falta de recursos en la familia, Santos decidió empezar a trabajar para poder ayudar con los gastos; por esa misma razón decidió aprender la labor de carpintería; el elabora mesas, sillas, roperos, ventanas y muchos otros artículos más. Actualmente tiene 3 años de estar realizando esta actividad. Es una labor que le gusta mucho y al mismo tiempo le generan buenos ingresos que le ayudan a apoyar a sus padres en los gastos.
El solicita un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para compra de madera para la elaboración de más muebles.
Sueña con crecer en el campo de la carpintería y ampliar el negocio, además de prestarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Santos, 23, is a young single man living with his family in the settlement of Xecampana (“Under the Bell” in Cakchiquel tongue), Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan Municipality, Sololá Department.

For lack of family resources, Santos decided to start working to help with expenses which is why he learned carpentry.  He manufactures tables, chairs, armoires, windows and many other things too.  He’s been doing this for three years now and it’s work that he enjoys very much while at the same time it generates good income that helps him to his parents with expenses.

He’s asking for a 5,000 quetzal loan to buy wood to make more furniture.  He dreams with growing in the carpentry field and to expand the business.  In addition, he wants to provide better customer service.

loans.use: to buy wood to make more furniture.

loans.name: Inerai

texts.en:
Inerai lives in Carrefour Corse, a small locality in Haiti. As a farmer with four children in school, he appreciates organizations working in community development. He is looking for a loan to help him purchase EarthSpark products to sell solar lamps in his locality.
 
He is looking to purchase solar light bulbs and solar desk lamps. With a Kiva loan, Inerai will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.

loans.use: To stock clean energy retail business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 36-year-old, married woman who lives in Talibon, Bohol. She engages in providing cosmetology services. She offers services like manicure and pedicure. To be able to sustain her livelihood, Catherine requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy tools, like nippers, cuticle pushers, and other tools of her trade. Catherine would like to expand her manicure and pedicure services in the future, to improve her status of livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional tools of her manicurist trade, like nippers and cuticle pushers

loans.name: Ifelodoun Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFELODOUN est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier et font des tontines ensemble. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Oussamatou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 42 ans. Oussamatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Oussamatou est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Moudachirou. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Oussamatou vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Oussamatou et son mari assurent ensemble les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Oussamatou vend des produits de layettes par la méthode de distribution depuis quinze ans. Oussamatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Oussamatou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe IFELODOUN, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Ifelodoun Group is made up of three people who live in the same district and who have formed a tontine (informal savings group) together. The representative of the group, named Oussamatou (shown in the photo with her hand raised) is 42 years old. Oussamatou did not attend school. She is married to a driver named Moudachirou. The couple has three children, some of whom attend school. Oussamatou lives with her ​​husband and children, and together she and her husband pay for all of the family's expenses.

To do this, Oussamatou has been selling baby clothes by delivery for the past fifteen years. She buys her merchandise in a market in Benin. In her quest for customer satisfaction and in order to increase her sales and income, Oussamatou, along with the other members of the Ifelodoun Group, is requesting a fifth loan from Alidé. The group's prior loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase baby clothes for resale.

loans.name: Angie Tatiana

texts.es:
Tatiana es una joven de 19 años de edad que busca como ganarse la vida y generar recursos para pagarse sus estudios. Actualmente se encuentra estudiando administración, actividad que alterna con la venta de calzado a sus compañeros. Asegura que hasta la fecha ha logrado pagar los semestres con el desarrollo de este oficio, razón que la ha motivado a solicitar un crédito para la compra de mercancía y aumentar su nivel de ventas.
Su mayor sueño es terminar su carrera y tener una tienda de calzado para convertirse en una fuente generadora de empleo para su comunidad.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a young woman of 19 years old who is trying to find ways to make a living and generate income to pay for her studies. She is currently studying administration, which she does on top of selling footwear to her peers.

She says that, up until now, she has managed to pay her tuition with her income from this business. This has motivated her to ask for a loan to buy merchandise and increase her level of sales.

Her greatest dream is to finish her degree and have her own shoe store, to generate employment in her community.

loans.use: to buy footwear.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan José es un joven de 21 años de edad, soltero; vive junto a su familia en  Caserío Monte Mercedes, municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá.
El es un joven que quiere triunfar en la vida y para ello es muy emprendedor y se dedica a varias actividades las cuales son: compraventa de verduras, esto lo realiza en la ciudad capital de Guatemala, una segunda actividad es el servicio de trasporte de productos de Sololá hacia la ciudad capital. Para esta actividad cuenta con un camión. Estas actividades las realiza porque primeramente son actividades honestas y legales y además son actividades que le generan buenos ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia.
Una tercera labor que realiza en su tiempo libre es la reparación de vehículos (mecánica).
El solicita un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para compra de llantas y otros repuestos que su camión necesitan.
Sueña con comprar un camión más grande y también comprar un lote de terreno.
texts.en:
Juan José, 21, is a young single man living with his family in the Hamlet of Monte Mercedes, Solalá Municipality and Department.  He’s a young man who very much wants to succeed in life and to do so is very enterprising.  

He carries out a variety of activities.  He buys and sells vegetables, something he does in the capital city of Guatemala.  His second activity is transporting products from Sololá to the capital city and to do so has a truck.  He does these activities because in the first place they are honest and legal and also because they are activities that generate good income to cover family expenses.  A third job he has is vehicle repairs (auto mechanics) in his free time.  

He’s asking for an 8,000 quetzal loan to buy tires and other spare parts his truck needs.  He dreams with buying a bigger truck and also to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy tires and other spare parts for his truck.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es una mujer de 25 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos: dos hombres y una mujercita, esta hermosa familia actualmente vive en el Barrio Panul 1, municipio de San Antonio Palopó, departamento de Sololá
Irma se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de cebollines. Realiza esta actividad por falta de un empleo formal. Ella le pone mucha dedicación a esta labor y por ello logra buena cosecha que al momento de venderla obtiene los ingresos necesarios para aportar económicamente al sostenimiento de sus hijos y de ella. Su cosecha la vende a compradores mayoristas que la visitan en su comunidad. 
Ella solicita un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para compra de verdura para revenderla.
Sueña con ampliar la venta de cebollines a través de la adquisición de un punto de venta permanente y con ello incrementar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Irma, 25, is single and has three children: two boys and a little girl.  This beautiful family currently lives in Panul 1 Neighborhood, San Antonio Palopó Municipality, Sololá Department.  Irma works in agriculture specifically growing scallions.  She does this work because she lacks formal employment.  She puts a lot of dedication into this work which is why she gets good crops yields and when she sells them she earns the necessary income to contribute to her and her children’s support.  She sells her crops to wholesale buyers that visit her in her community.

She’s asking for a 5,000 quetzal loan to buy vegetables to resell.  She dreams with expanding the scallion sales by means of the purchase of a permanent sales spot thus increasing sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Ma Angela

texts.es:
Doña María Ángela tiene 57 años de edad, casada, con un hogar estable por muchos años y madre de 2 hijos los cuales se involucran en el cultivo de hortalizas, maíz, frijol, café, entre otros. Su grado de educación es de primaria completa gracias al apoyo de sus padres mismos que le enseñaron desde joven a trabajar la tierra ya que ellos han sido agricultores desde toda una vida. En esta actividad se involucra su hijo mayor el cual está casado, su esposo y ella misma. EL producto que se cultiva es distribuido y vendido en el mercado local y con intermediarios que llegan a la zona para revender.

Actualmente ella solicita a COMIXMUL un financiamiento para poder comprar semilla de calidad y certificada de papa para poder cultivar ya que es más segura y eficaz.

Sus sueños son los de comprar otro terreno para sembrar en mayor escala ya que cada ganancia que ella logra obtener lo ahorra para poder cumplir su sueño y seguir re-invirtiendo para que sea posible.
texts.en:
María Ángela, age 57, is married and has had a stable household for many years.  She has two children, and they get involved in growing the vegetables, corn, beans, and coffee, among other crops.  She completed elementary school, thanks to her parents’ support.  When she was young they taught her to work the land because they had been farmers their whole lives.  Her oldest child, who is married, her husband, and she are involved in this business activity.  The product that is grown is distributed and sold at the local market and to intermediaries who come to the area in order to resell.

She is currently requesting a loan from COMIXMUL in order to be able to buy quality, certified potato seeds.  She will do this in order to be able to cultivate in a more secure and effective manner.  Her dream is to buy another piece of land in order to sow on a greater scale.  This is because she saves all of the profits that she manages to get in order to fulfill her dream and to continue reinvesting so that it will be possible.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds to sow.

loans.name: Lea Dagmar

texts.es: La señora Lea, continúa laborando como docente en una escuela brindándoles sus conocimientos a los niños desde hace más de 10 años, ella como la mayor parte de los nicaragüenses ha logrado ir construyendo su vivienda a base de créditos. Ahora solicita este octavo préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y realizar un anexo en la parte trasera de su vivienda, para lograr mayor espacio para que sus hijos se sientan tranquilos.
texts.en:
Lea continues working as a teacher at a school.  She has been providing her knowledge to students for over ten years.  She, like most Nicaraguans, has managed to be building her house through the loans.

She is now requesting her eighth loan in order to buy construction materials.  She will build an addition onto the back part of her house.  She will do this in order to mange to have more space so that her children are comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: El Renacer De Chacrasana Group

texts.es: “EL RENACER DE CHACRASANA” se encuentra conformada por 08 socios dedicados a diversas aéreas del comercio así como también brindan servicios. Quienes se encuentran pasando el 08 ciclo. Haydee tiene 44 años es conviviente con 2 hijos aun dependientes. Actualmente se dedica a golosinas, gaseosas  en un quiosco que está en las afueras de su casa. Años  atrás trabajaba en el club de Huampani como cuartelera de esta manera ha podido educar a sus hijos ya no cuenta con ingreso fijo de su esposo. El préstamo lo invertía en la compra de más golosinas, gaseosas y galletas. Su mayor deseo es lograr que sus hijos tengan una cerrera profesional. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Haydee es la primera del lado derecho viste chompa negra.
texts.en:
"El Renacer de Chacrasana" borrowing group is made up of eight members who work offering services and in different areas of trade. They are currently entering their eighth loan cycle.

Haydee is 44 years old and lives with two children who are still her dependents. Currently, she works selling candies and soft drinks in a kiosk that is outside her home. Years ago, she worked as a housekeeper at the Club de Huampaní hotel. In this way she has been able to educate her children, since she doesn't have a fixed income coming from her spouse.

She will invest this loan in buying more candies, soft drinks and biscuits. Her greatest desire is that her children have professional careers. 

The group is thankful to Kiva lenders for the loan provided. Haydee is the first person on the right, wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy drinks and biscuits.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is a 57-year-old, married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has five children. The oldest is 22, while the youngest is 12 years old. Danilo is engaged in a hog-raising business. He has been raising pigs for almost two years, now.

Danilo requested a loan of 7,000 PHP. He will use the loan to buy feed and additional pigs, to gain more income to help him meet the family's daily expenses. Danilo would like to expand his hog raising business further in the future, in order to provide his family with good food and to finance his children's college education.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional pigs

loans.name: Miryam

texts.es:
Miryam es una persona caracterizada por ser trabajadora y bondadosa con las personas de su comunidad. Con 36 años, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad. Se dedica desde hace más de 5 años a la venta de mercancía (ropa interior, jeans, blusas), actividad con la cual genera ingresos para su hogar.
Sueña con tener un gran negocio y poder generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
Aspira a que sus ventas sigan aumentando, razón que la ha motivado a solicitar un crédito que invertirá en la compra de   mercancía y brindarle a sus hijos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Miryam is a person known in her community for being hardworking and kind. She is 36 years old and has two children who are under the age of majority. She has been working for more than five years selling merchandise (underclothes, jeans and blouses). This business generates income for her household.

She dreams of having a great business and being able to generate employment for people in need.

She aspires to continue to grow her sales. This has motivated her to ask for a loan, which she will invest in buying merchandise and providing her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy underclothes, jeans and blouses.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Myra works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income by raising pigs. Myra is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional fruits to sell in her fruit-vending business.

Myra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store, like canned goods, spices, and vinegar.

Narcisa has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from pig-fattening.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, spices, and vinegar.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es:
Sandra es una joven de 22 años de edad y madre de dos hijos los cuales están en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación que en compañía de su pareja ponen de su máximo empeño para que a ellos no les haga falta nada básico dedicándose a la agricultura que es su único medio de ingreso en lo que es la siembra y cultivo de café, maíz y frijoles. Ella es comerciante de su propio producto en un mercado de la zona local ubicado a pocos metros de su casa como también el producto es comercializado y vendido por los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona en busca de un producto de calidad. Fue su pareja quien le enseño a cultivar y a vender el producto final hace más de 3 años y la tierra que trabaja es propia gracias a una herencia de parte de los papas de su pareja. Ellos también tiene otro pequeño negocio que es la cría y venta de cerdos con lo cual también generan un poco más de ingreso para su familia.

Ella solicita ayuda para la compra de semilla certificada de maíz y de frijol para sembrar una nueva producción y poder tener más ingresos.

Sus Planes son los de poder comprar un poco más de tierra en la que pueda sembrar y hacer una porqueriza más grande para obtener mejores ganancias y poder seguir ayudando a su pareja en los diferentes gastos de la canasta básica. Como madre poder enviar a sus hijos a la universidad para que ellos puedan estudiar una carrera y puedan emprender sus negocios.
texts.en:
Sandra, 22, is a young mother of two children attending different grades in elementary school.  She and her spouse put in their maximum efforts so that they will lack none of the basics.  They work in agriculture which is their only source of income.  They grow coffee, corn and beans.  She herself sells her products in a market located a few meters from home and it is also sold to various buyers that come to the zone looking for quality products.  Her spouse taught her to farm and sell the final product more than three years ago and the land she works is her own thanks to an inheritance received from her spouse’s parents.  They also have another business raising and selling pigs that generates a little more income for their family.

She’s asking for help to buy certified corn and bean seeds to start a new planting cycle and earn more income.  Her plan is to be able to buy a little more land to plant on and to make a larger pig sty to earn higher profits and continue helping her spouse to cover basic family expenses and as a mother to be able to send her children to university so they can study a career and be able to start their own businesses.

loans.use: to buy certified corn and bean seeds to plant.

loans.name: Calicanto Iii Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento CALICANTO III está  compuesto por diez  integrantes ocho mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Faviola tiene 27 años y tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  la Sra. Faviola es una persona muy emprendedora que desde sus siete años comenzó a trabajar ayudando a su mamá en la venta de refrescos, con el tiempo se hizo cargo del negocio de su mamá vendiendo api con pastel y/o con buñuelo, la Sra. Faviola tiene un puesto en la feria de navidad en la ciudad de Cochabamba donde tiene ingresos adicionales, , vive en casa de su mamá y le ayuda en los gastos familiares, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus Apis como azúcar y harina de maíz blanca y morada, la Sra. Faviola se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo  brindado a ella y todo su grupo ya que son personas que trabajan duro para salir adelante.
texts.en: The “Calicanto III” communal bank has ten members, 8 women and 2 men.  The bank president is Faviola, 27.  She has three school age children.  Faviola’s a very enterprising woman who started working at the age of 7 helping her mother sell refreshments.  In time, she took over her mother’s business selling ‘api’ [traditional beverage made from purple corn] with cake and or fried flour tortilla.  Faviola has a stand in the city of Cochabamba’s Christmas street fair where she earns extra income.  She lives in her mother’s house and helps with family expenses.  The loan she’s requesting is to buy ingredients like sugar and white and purple corn flour, used in making api.  Faviola feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided to her and her entire group because they are people that work hard in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make 'Api.'

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a motorcycle/trisikad transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Merly requested a loan of PHP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her trisikad. Merly would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle/trisikad

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 38 years old and married. She has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running the general store for 23 years, and she also earns income by selling native Filipino products.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional items to resell, like sugar, eggs, vinegar, and other groceries. Merly has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to resell, like sugar, eggs, vinegar, and other groceries

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar accesorios tales como: monitores, tarjetas de video, papel, tinta, memorias USB, entre otros y para remodelar el local.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir unas computadoras, asimismo suministros, los ingresos han aumentado; las condiciones económicas  y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: Israel needs to request a new loan because he needs working capital to continue investing in his business.  It will make it possible for him to buy such accessories as monitors, video cards, paper, ink, USB memory sticks, etc. and to remodel his site.  His previous loan helped him buy computers and supplies.  Income has increased and so have his economic conditions and family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Norhanena

texts.en:
Norhanena is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years, and she earns additional income from coconut farming.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase household foods and items to resell, like canned goods, milk, sugar, and soap. She successfully paid back her previous loan. Now, she is requesting a new loan, to further build her general store business. Norhanena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase household foods and other items to sell at her store, like canned goods, milk, sugar, and soap

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José, es una persona de hogar, vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo; no posee ayuda del extranjero. El, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como: maíz y maicillo, asimismo realiza  hortalizas de yuca y a la ganadería, el oficio lo aprendió como ayudante y posteriormente decidió llevar a cabo sus propios cultivos, tiene 16 años de realizarlo.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, asimismo semilla, pago de mano de obra y preparación de la tierra; esta inversión le ayudara a tener todo lo necesario para la siembra del cultivo.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando en el cultivo, mejorar su vivienda  y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is a person of his home.   He lives with his life companion and their son; he gets no help from abroad.  He works growing basic grains like corn and sorghum and also vegetables like manioc and also raises livestock.  He learned this occupation as a helper and subsequently decided to start growing his own crops; he’s been doing so for 16 years.

The loan he needs will make it possible for him to buy agricultural supplies like manure, herbicide, pesticide, fungicide, insecticide and seeds; he will also pay labor costs and prepare the soil.  This investment will help him have everything needed to plant his crops.  His dream is to continue working his crops, to improve his house and to give his family improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay labor costs to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Hala Group

texts.en: Hala is a group of four women from Taiz, Yemen. They have requested a loan in the amount of 200,000 YER to buy home appliances. Asma, 28 years old, is the leader of the group. She is an educated, married woman. She lives with her family in a small house in Taiz. Her husband is working very hard to cover the needs of her family, but his income is not enough to pay for everything. She decided to help him buy home appliances, so she applied for a 50,000 YER loan to buy home appliances for personal use. She hopes that she will be able to buy all of the home appliances she needs.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for personal use.

loans.name: Nidia Del Carmen

texts.es: Nidia es una mujer de negocio exitosa, con 38 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos menores de 15 y 9 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de zapatos, ropa usada y variada, esta actividad tiene cinco años de estar practicando, sus productos los comercializa en su comunidad y vecinos, tiene de ser clientes de  la institución desde hace 8 años lo que demuestra su buen comportamiento de pagos, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de paca usada, zapatos usados de varón, zapatos usados de mujer etc.
texts.en: Nidia, 38, is a successful businesswoman.  She’s married and has two minor children aged 15 and 9.  Her business is selling shoes and assorted used clothes.  She’s been doing this for five years and she sells her wares among her neighbors in her community.  She’s been a member of the institution for 8 years and has shown good payment behavior.  She will use this loan to buy a bale of used clothes, used men’s and women’s shoes, etc.

loans.use: to buy used shoes for women and men and to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns additional income from a general store that she owns.

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle. Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle
